loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is 34 years old and married. Jane works very hard to provide for them.

Jane runs a sari-sari (variety) store in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy stocks of groceries for her sari-sari (variety) store.

Jane has been in this business for five years and sells a variety of items such as diapers, cigarettes, biscuits etc. 

In the future, Jane would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy stocks of groceries for her sari-sari store

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Lilibeth

texts.en:
Lilibeth is 44 years old and married with two children.

Lilibeth works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari (variety) store in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase groceries for her sari-sari (variety) store.

Lilibeth has borrowed and paid back six loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the sari-sari store for 14 years and earns an additional income from food vending.

Lilibeth aspires to earn more to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase groceries for her sari-sari (variety) store

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for bales of used clothing for her business

loans.name: Judith

texts.en: Judith is a married woman with three children. The oldest child is 21 years old. Judith is engaged in farming. She grows rice and corn crops on her land located in Banga, South Cotabato. Judith works hard to keep her farm productive. She applied for a loan to purchase fertilizers and pay for labor at her farm. Judith hopes to achieve an abundant harvest. She wants to be able to save for her children's future.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and pay for labor

loans.name: Shameem's Group

texts.en:
Shameem is 60 years old, married, and has two sons. Both of her sons work, the eldest one operates a grocery store while the youngest one works in a factory. 

Shameem stays at home and manages her household responsibilites. 

She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her son who wants to expand his grocery store business. With the loan, he will buy groceries in bulk to add to his store's inventory. 

He has been operating this business for the past five years and Shameem hopes that an investment will make his business more profitable. 

She is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her third loan application. In previous loan years, she has maintained a good credit behavior and never missed any meetings. 

Note: In the photo, the lady raising a hand is Shameem.

loans.use: to buy inventory for a grocery store business

loans.name: Maribel

texts.en:
Maribel is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a tailoring business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 27,000 through NWTF to buy cloth and other materials for her tailoring business.

Maribel has been in this business for 10 years. Maribel earns additional income from raising pigs.

Maribel has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to buy cloth and other materials

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay for bales of clothing for her business.

loans.name: Peljee

texts.en:
Peljee is 55-year-old widow who lives with her three children in a house in Hovd province, Mongolia.  She is a friendly woman with a good personality. Peljee manages a business selling household goods.  She started the business in 1994 at a rented stall in a local market with the help of her daughter.  Peljee has gained a lot of experience in her business. 

Peljee requests a 3,000,000 MNT loan to purchase more inventory for her business.

loans.use: To purchase more inventory for her business.

loans.name: Rochele

texts.en:
Rochele, 33, is married and has four children. Two are in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Rochele has a sari-sari (variety) store business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for five years. 

Rochele requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell in her store.

In the future, Rochele would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell in her store

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Leonora

texts.en:
Leonora is 42 years old and earns her living through farming.  She is married with four children, the oldest of whom is 12 years old.  She tills her own land in Banga, South Cotabato, where she grows rice and corn.  Lenora sells her harvest at the market.  Leonora hopes to be able to sustain her children's education. 

Lenora plans to use the requested loan to purchase fertilizer and other farm inputs.  She hopes that her business will grow.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and other farm inputs

loans.name: Narantsetseg

texts.en:
Narantsetseg is 47 years old and lives with her husband and son in a house in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia.  Her husband is a driver who owns his transportation business and her son works in a private company.  She manages an intestine trading business at a rented stall in a local market.  She started her business in 2000.  Her working capital is 1,000,000 MNT with daily earnings of 150,000-200,000 MNT. 

Narantsetseg requests a 3,000,000 MNT loan to purchase more intestines for trade and construction materials for her house.  She plans to continue her work and expand her business in the future. She is a polite and friendly woman who says, "I want to do construction work on my house."

loans.use: to buy more intestines for trade and materials for home construction

loans.name: Jariatu

texts.en:
Jariatu is 42 years old and married with three children who are 8, 12 and 15 years old.  In 2005, Jariatu established her assorted drink business.  She started the business to help her husband support their family.  Working six days a week and 10 hours a day, she earns about Le 750,000 every month. 

Jariatu requests a Le 4,000,000 loan.  She has received and successfully repaid one loan and needs the new loan to buy more assorted drinks to sell.  Specifically, she will buy 60 crates of canned soft drinks that cost Le 24,000 each, 30 crates of hard drinks at Le 60,000 each, and 20 crates of bottled drinks at Le 48,000 each.  Jariatu hopes this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately Le 300,000. 

In the future, Jariatu plans to educate her children to the university level. She is very determined and hardworking.  She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To purchase 114 crates of assorted drinks for sale.

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.en:
Lourdes is a 46-year-old married woman with four children.  Her oldest child is 21 years old.

Lourdes is engaged in farming and hog-raising businesses.  She grows rice and corn on her land.  She also raises pigs in her backyard.  Lourdes sells her harvest and fattened pigs at her town's market.

The requested loan will be used to purchase fertilizer, pig feed and vitamins.  Lourdes hopes to improve her skills in managing her farm and piggery. She wants to increase her earnings and save for her children's future.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer, pig feed and vitamins

loans.name: Sodnomdamba

texts.en:
Sodnomdamba is 31 years old and lives with her husband and son in a Mongolian yurt, in the Arhangai province of Mongolia.  Her son is four years old and attends kindergarten.  Her husband is a factory worker.   Sodnomdamba manages a trading business of household goods in her town.  She started her business in 2009 with sock sales.  

Her initial working capital was 100,000 MNT, which has recently grown to 500,000 MNT.  She requests a 500,000 MNT loan to purchase more inventory for her business.  She plans to increase her sales so she can expand her business.  She is a polite woman who says, "I want to expand my business in order to feed my family."

loans.use: To purchase more inventory for sale.

loans.name: Purevsuren

texts.en:
Purevsuren is 57 years old and lives with his wife in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic ten, in Ulaanbaatar, the capital of Mongolia.  He has six adult children who all live separately with their families.  His wife retired early because she gave birth to six children.  Purevsuren runs a transportation business with his truck. He has a clients who use his service daily to deliver their goods from the warehouse to market.  A few days ago his truck’s engine broke and now needs to be repaired. 

Purevsuren will use the requested loan to buy a second-hand engine and replace the truck's broken engine.  He will also use the funds for other services on his truck that he uses for his transportation business.

loans.use: To buy a second-hand engine and perform other services on the truck he uses for his transportation business.

loans.name: Michael

texts.en:
Michael is 38 years old and married with three children who are 5, 7 and 11 years old.  In 2007, he established his spare parts business to support his family.  Working six days a week and 10 hours a day, he earns about Le 750,000 every month. 

Michael requests a Le 5,000,000 loan.  He has already successfully repaid two loans and needs the new loan to expand his business.  He hopes this loan will help him increase his monthly profits by approximately Le 250, 000.  In the future, Michael plans to open two spare part shops, buy a vehicle and bike for commercial use, and educate his children to the highest level.  He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy more spare parts for his business

loans.name: Merlyn

texts.en:
Merlyn is 60 years old and married.  She has one child who is 34 years old.  Merlyn is a farmer and hog-raiser. She tills her land in Banga, South Cotabato, where she grows corn and rice. Merlyn also raises pigs in her backyard. She fattens the pigs and sells them at the market.

Merlyn needs fertilizer for her farm and feed for the pigs she raies.  She plans to use the requested loan for these necessary business supplies.  Merlyn hopes to have a stable business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and pig feed

loans.name: Merta Jati Group

texts.en:
Ni Putu will use the loan to buy a pig that will be prepared to be a sow, while the remaining money will be used to buy feed. By breeding the sow, she plans to sell piglets to her neighbors. 

Currently in her village it is difficult to find a young pig. She saw this as a business opportunity. She hopes to become the largest seller of piglets in the village.

This period, one of the members of her group resigned and was replaced by a new one.

loans.use: to buy a pig that will be prepared to be a breeding sow

loans.name: Narandelger

texts.en:
Narandelger is 28 years old and lives with his wife and son in an apartment in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia.  His wife is a hairdresser who also cares for their 2-year-old son.  Narandelger manages a cell phone repair and trade business at a rented stall in the Narantuul market, one of the biggest markets in Mongolia.  He started his business in 2009 and has gained useful experience. He has been able to stabilize his business and build a strong customer base. 

Narandelger requests a 2,500,000 MNT loan to purchase more cell phones and cell phone parts for his business.  He plans to expand his business and have his own store in the future.  Narandelger is an open-minded man who possesses excellent managerial skills. He says, "I want to have my own store."

loans.use: To purchase more cell phones and cell phone parts

loans.name: Miguela

texts.en:
Miguela is a 62-year-old married mother of four children, the oldest 44 years old. Engaged in farming for 35 years, Miguela grows rice and corn crops on her land, which she and her husband maintain. Miguela does her best to help improve their living conditions. She also wants to be able to help send her grandchildren to school.

This loan will be used to purchase seeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs.

loans.name: Lamin

texts.en:
This is 31 year-old Lamin, who is married and has three children aged 8, 12 and 14 years. In 2003, Lamin established his used clothing business as a means of support for his family. Working 6 days a week and 12 hours a day, he earns about Le 800,000 every month from this business.

Having already received and repaid two loans, Lamin requires a new loan of Le 3,000,000 in order to buy bales of used clothing. He hopes that this loan will enable him to increase his monthly profits by approximately Le 200,000 and in the future plans to open another used clothing business to be managed by his wife. Lamin thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To pay for bales of assorted used clothing.

loans.name: Lonjid

texts.en:
Lonjid is married and lives with her husband and son in an apartment in Bayanzurh district, Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Her husband is a driver who owns a transportation business and her son goes to secondary school. 

Lonjid manages a sportswear trading business at a rented stall at a trading center. She started her business after coming from Korea in 2003. Before her business operation, she used to live and work in Korea to save some money. With her savings, she has been able to buy an apartment and start her own business. Now she is an experienced businesswoman who has conducted her business for 8 years. She is responsible for managing her business and employs one salesperson. 

Lonjid is a hardworking and honest woman who says, "After coming from Korea I bought an apartment which had been given in exchange of my debt. At that time it was hard for me to lose my apartment. However I worked hard to stabilize my business and now everything is going well." She is requesting a 3,000,000 MNT loan to purchase clothes for her business.

loans.use: to purchase more clothes

loans.name: Zainab

texts.en:
This is 25-year-old Zainab. She is married and has 2 children, ages 3 and 6 years old. 

In 2005, Zainab established her food stuff business. She began her business because she needed a means of providing income for her family. Working 6 days a week and 10 hours a day, she earns about 930,000 SLL every month from this business. 

She would like a loan in the amount of 4,500,000 SLL. Zainab has already received and successfully repaid 1 loan, and now requires a new loan in order to add assorted food items by cartons or bags. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately 300,000 SLL. In the future, Zainab plans to open a wholesale shop, hire workers and buy land. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy more food items for her business

loans.name: Hishigmaa

texts.en:
Hishigmaa, 43 years old, lives with her husband and two children in a house in the Sansar area of Ulaanbaatar, Mongolia's capital city Her two children, ages 20 and 22, go to a college.

Hishigmaa manages a button-making business which she and her husband started in 1996. Her husband is responsible for making the buttons, while she is responsible for selling them at Narantuul market, one of the busiest markets in Mongolia. They are quite experienced business owners who are planning to expand their enterprise in the future. Their working capital now exceeds 1,800,000 MNT, with daily earning between 80,000 and 120,000 MNT.

A polite and friendly woman who says, "I am planing to buy a car in order to start taxi service business too," Hishigmaa is requesting a 3,500,000 MNT loan to purchase a new car.

loans.use: to purchase a new car.

loans.name: Farzana's Group

texts.en:
Farzana is 47 years old and runs a school in her community. She is a good administrator and runs her school very well. She believes in a good quality education and that's why she works very hard in making her school better. 

She is married by status and her husband operates a business selling paint boxes. Farzana has four children. Her eldest son works in a police department while others are young and getting their education. 

Farzana has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for the expansion of her school. With the loan, she will buy furniture which will help her provide better sitting arrangements for the students of her school. 

She has been running this school for past 10 years and hopes that by providing better facilities to her students she will be able to gain much respect and earn a good profit. 

Note: In the photo, the lady raising a hand is Farzana.

loans.use: to buy furniture for a school

loans.name: Mildred

texts.en: Mildred is 39 years old and married with four children, the oldest being 15. Mildred and her husband are both farmers. They till their own land located in Banga, South Cotabato where they grow rice and corn crops to sell. Mildred also raises pigs in their backyard and does her best to help sustain her family. She requested a loan to purchase fertilizers and pig feed. She is hopeful that this loan will help her businesses grow.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and pig feed

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Enkhtur

texts.en: Mr.Enkhtur is 42 years old and lives with his wife and four children in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. They live in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent built on Enkhtur’s elder brother’s land. Enkhtur’s eldest daughter is a student at University and the other children attend secondary school. Enkhtur is planning to buy a plot of land so he needs to save money by increasing his business profit. He used to run a transportation business, carrying people on one of the city’s remote bus routes, but government is pushing out private drivers from public services. Therefore he decided to run a butchering business, relying on his relatives, also butchers, at the meat market where he is already renting a stall. The loan he is taking will be used to stock up on meat products to sell.

loans.use: To stock up on meat products to sell at the meat market.

loans.name: Kadiatu

texts.en: Kadiatu is 42, married, and has four children aged 20, 17, 14 and 8. In 2006, Kadiatu established her business selling foods such as garri (a staple made from cassavas), bulgur, groundnuts, salt and beans. She started this business to help support her husband provide livelihood for their family. Working 7 days a week, 12 hours a day, she earns about Le 600,000 every month from this business. She would like a loan of Le 3,000,000 to help her buy more food stuffs for her business. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately Le 200,000. In the future, Kadiatu plans to embark on an international business and educate her children to university level. The current inflation level is her major business challenge. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy more foods to sell

loans.name: Nilda

texts.en:
Nilda is a farmer working in Banga, South Cotabato. She grows rice and corn crops on her land. Nilda makes sure her farm is free of weeds and pests so that her crops can grow healthy. She wants to be able to sell quality produce to the people in her community and has requested a loan to purchase fertilizer and other farm supplies. She hopes to achieve an abundant harvest.

Nilda is 43 years old and married with four children. Her oldest child is 21 years old. Nilda wants to improve her skills in managing her business. She also wants to earn more to provide for her children's future.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Adjoa

texts.en: Adjoa is divorced and has three children. She trades in provisions, cloth, materials and cooking utensils at Elmina near Nkontrodo. Adjoa uses her income to educate her children. She will use the loan to purchase other types of utensils to meet the demands of her customers. She anticipates  reinvesting her profits.

loans.use: to purchase utensils

loans.name: Efua

texts.en: Efua sells provisions such as milk, biscuits, and toffees at Elmina near Nkontrodo. She is married and has four children. She assists her husband in the payment of school fees and utility bills. Her loan will be used to buy milk, Milo (a brand of malted milk), and other food items for sale. She hopes to use the profits from her business to save to buy a land.

loans.use: to purchase milk, Milo and other food items

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is a hardworking farmer from Kitale town in western Kenya. She has been in this business for 27 years. Her main products are milk, vegetables, fruits, bananas, and maize which she sells locally. She depends on farming to provide for the basic needs of her family. 

Rose is requesting a loan of 62,400 KES through Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow. She says that with the dairy cow, her family will be guaranteed enough milk for domestic consumption and sale. The profits from the sale of milk will help meet the basic needs of her family.

Her major challenges have been animal diseases, which are very expensive to treat, and the high cost of animal feeds especially during the dry seasons.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Ama

texts.en:
Ama sells provisions and soap in Elmina near Nkontrodo. She is divorced and has two children. She sees to the wellbeing of her home.

Ama’s loan will be used to buy more soap to sell. She hopes to reinvest any profits.

loans.use: to buy more soap to sell.

loans.name: Ramonito

texts.en:
Ramonito is 62 years old, married and has a 33-year-old child. He is a hardworking man who lives in the town of Banga, South Cotabato.

Ramonito is a farmer and primarily grows corn crops. He tills his land and prepares it well for planting. He spends his whole day keeping the farm free of weeds and pests.

Ramonito has requested a loan and plans to use it to purchase fertilizer and other farming necessities. He hopes to earn more and so be able to help send his grandchildren to school.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and other farming necessities.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase glass and aluminum.

loans.name: Robina's Group

texts.en:
Robina is 42 years old, married, and has three sons. She couldn't educate her children due to financial constraints. All of her sons work to financially contribute to the family. Her eldest son operates a Punjabi food restaurant, the second one operates a cigarette selling shop, while the youngest one is only 14 years old and works in a factory. 

Robina's husband also involved in selling Pan (betel leaves) and cigarettes. His shop is located in the market. 

Robina is also a working lady. She is a nurse by profession. After her nursing job, she comes back home and spends time on her housework. 

She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband who wants to improve his business of selling pan and cigarettes. With the loan, he will purchase pan (betel leaves) and cigarettes of different brands to fulfill the demands of his customers. 

Robina hopes that an investment will be a profitable one for her husband and her family's living standards will become better. 

This is her first loan application to Asasah. 

Note: In the photo, the lady raising her hand is Robina.

loans.use: to buy pan (betel leaves) and cigarettes for resale

loans.name: Mery

texts.en: Currently taking care of five dependents and seeing to the well-being of her home, Mery sells slippers, panties, shoes and cloth at Elmina. Her loan will be used to buy slippers and panties for resale, and she hopes to reinvest her new capital back into the business.

loans.use: to buy slippers and panties for resale.

loans.name: Said

texts.en:
Said, a responsible husband and the loving father of two children, is from Panjikent, Tajikistan where his spouse is a housewife. From childhood he has been interested in agriculture and today he is engaged in animal husbandry, selling cattle in the market called “Shurcha” in Panjikent. Said, who has been in this business for three years, is requesting a loan of 6000 Somoni for the purchase of cattle and the expansion of his business.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes its role as a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: to buy cattle.

loans.name: Efua

texts.en: Efua, a divorced mother of two children, is a fishmonger who also sells fruits at Elmina, near Nkontrodo. Efua uses her income to pay school fees and utility bills. She is requesting this loan to purchase more fruits to sell. With the new profits from her expanded business, Efua plans to save to build a snack bar.

loans.use: to purchase more fruits to sell.

loans.name: Abena

texts.en: A divorced mother of three children, Abena sells provisions and smoked fish at Elmina, a fishing community in Cape Coast. In this business for some time now, Abena is also responsible for the well-being of her home. Her loan will be used to buy fresh fish to smoke for sale, and she hopes to use the new profits to expand her fish business.

loans.use: to buy fresh fish to smoke for sale.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase noodles, salt, sugar and fish sauce to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Saltanat's Group

texts.en:
Saltanat is the leader of this group. She is 25 years old, married, and has one child.  Her husband is an anti-corruption officer. Saltanat works as a cashier in the ticket office. In order to contribute additional money to the family budget, she also breeds livestock. She started this activity three years ago with an initial investment of 15,000 soms. Saltanat is requesting a loan to purchase of some goats for breeding. In the future, she wants to build a shed in the yard in order to keep the livestock there during the winter season.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused microfinance institution in Kyrgyzstan. MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly), and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only microfinance institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135. If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase goats.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a mechanical plow the help plow the rice fields.

loans.name: 7 Nam Ngạn Group

texts.en:
Hằng, a 36-year-old married mother of two children, is the leader of a four-member group, the 9.1.7 Nam Ngạn solidarity group. She lives and works in the city of Thanh Hoa, an urban area in Thanh Hoa Province.

For five years, Hằng has had a business making iron furniture. One of the most critical business difficulties she faces is the lack of capital, so she is requesting her first loan from the Thanh Hoa Fund of Poor Women to purchase steel and iron for her enterprise. With her business profit, Hằng hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, to make enough money to provide for her kids, and for her children to do well in school.

loans.use: to purchase steel and iron.

loans.name: Ith

texts.en:
Ith is married (appearing here in the photograph with his wife) and resides with his two children in Kampot Province, Cambodia. He is a motor-taxi driver, earning an income of $5 per day, which helps cover the family’s expenses. His wife sells traditional cakes, earning an income of $5 per day. The family’s standard of living has improved since Ith and his wife have had these businesses.

Ith is requesting a loan of $500 to purchase a new motorbike to improve his business. This will be his first loan from CREDIT, a Kiva partner.

loans.use: to buy a new motorbike.

loans.name: 2 Nam Ngạn Group

texts.en:
Đắc is 53 years old, married and has two children who are no longer living at home. She lives in Thanh Hoa, an urban town in Thanh Hoa province. For the past five years Đắc has operated a food stall from which she sells vegetables. The main hardship Đắc faces in her business is the lack of capital.

In 2010, Đắc joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. She is now the leader of a three-member group, the 2.10.1.2 Nam Ngan solidarity group. Đắc has successfully repaid a loan from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women and is now requesting another loan to purchase vegetables to resell.

With her profits Đắc hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, her business to do well, and her children to find good jobs.

loans.use: to purchase vegetables to resell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase an additional flock of chickens and chicken feed.

loans.name: Hakikmo

texts.ru: Хакикмо жительница города Душанбе. Ей 46 лет. Она замужем. У нее трое детей. Она имеет средне - специальное образование, портниха. Шьет национальные платья на заказ. Этим видом деятельности занимается 28 лет. Кредит берет для приобретения тканей.
texts.en: Hakikmo lives in the city of Dushanbe. She is 46 years old. Married, with three children. She has a technical education as a seamstress. She  sews made-to-order traditional outfits. She has been in this business for 28 years. She is taking out a loan in order to purchase fabrics.

loans.use: to buy fabrics

loans.name: Busara's Group

texts.en:
Busara is the treasurer of this group. She is 39, divorced, and has three sons, one of whom attends the Art Academy and two of whom attend school. Busara works as a cook in the canteen. Her monthly salary is 4,500 soms. Busara is requesting a loan to pay for her older son’s tuition at the Art Academy. In the future, all her plans concern her sons. She wants to provide them with a good education and she wants to see all of them get married.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused microfinance institution in Kyrgyzstan. MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly), and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135. If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to pay for her son's tuition at the Art Academy.

loans.name: San

texts.en: San is 67 years old, married, and has two children.  They reside in Takeo Province, Cambodia. She is engaged in a business of selling traditional cakes, earning an income of $2.50 per day to help cover family expenses. The family is also assisted by her husband who is an electronic repairman, earning an income of $5 per day. Their standard of living has improved since San and her husband have had these businesses. San is requesting a loan of $1,000 to purchase a motorbike for her children to commute to work. This is her second loan from CREDIT, a partner of Kiva.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike for her children to commute to work.

loans.name: Sajida's Group

texts.en:
Sajida stays at home and takes care of her family. She is a very hardworking lady and performs her work with full devotion. Sajida is the mother of three children. All of them are very young and haven't started their education yet. 

She is married by status and her husband operates a paint and polish business. He paints buildings and polishes furniture, windows, doors, etc. He has been operating this business for many years and has vast experience in it. 

She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her cousin who also lives with her and is involved in the painting and polishing business. With the loan, he will buy paint boxes and polishes to improve the condition of his business. This will help him fulfill the demands of his clients and improve his business. 

Sajida feels a great level of happiness by helping others. She is hopeful that an investment will be a productive one for her cousin. 

This is her first loan application to Asasah. 

Note: In the photo, the lady raising her hand is Sajida.

loans.use: to buy paint and polish for a painting & polishing business

loans.name: Mathew

texts.en:
Mathew is 37 years old, married, and has five children, all of whom attend school. He is a dairy farmer from Kitale town in western Kenya. Matthew has been farming for the last 14 years and employs one farmhand. He also earns additional income from his agrovet shop in the same town. Apart from dairy farming, Mathew also practices small-scale farming of maize and beans.

Matthew is requesting a loan through Juhudi Kilimo of 46,800 KES to purchase and insure a dairy cow. The proceeds from the sale of milk will boost the family's income and this will improve their livelihood. His primary challenges have been fluctuation in the market prices of milk and lack of enough dairy feeds. He hopes to venture into zero grazing and double his milk production in future.

loans.use: to purchase and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Sal

texts.en:
Sal, 32, is married and resides with her two children in Takeo Province, Cambodia. She sells food, earning an income of $2.50 a day to help cover the family’s expenses. Her husband also rents speakers and microphones, earning an income of $5 a day. Their standard of living has improved since Sal and her husband started these businesses.

Sal is requesting a loan of $1000 to purchase more speakers and microphones to rent. This is her second loan from CREDIT, a Kiva partner.

loans.use: to buy more speakers and microphones to rent.

loans.name: Savy

texts.en:
Savy, 50, is married and resides with her three children in Takeo Province, Cambodia. She farms, earning $1.50 a day to help cover the family’s expenses. Her husband is a construction worker who earns $2.50 a day. Their standard of living has improved since Savy and her husband have worked in these businesses.

Savy is requesting a loan of $700 to purchase groceries to help one of her children expand their business. This is her first loan from CREDIT, a Kiva partner.

loans.use: to purchase groceries to help one of her children expand their business.

loans.name: Barkat's Group

texts.en:
Barkat is 39 years old, married, and has five children: the eldest works in a factory, the second eldest helps her husband in his business. The youngest one is studying in class at fourth level while the remaining two stay at home. 

Barkat herself is a housewife; she stays at home and manages the household. 

Her husband has a construction supplies business. He provides construction material to his clients at very reasonable rates. 

She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah to improve her husband's business. With the loan, he will buy construction supplies such as cement, bricks, sand, and stones which will help him fulfill client orders on time and earn better profits. 

Barkat is hopeful that her husband will be able to get positive results from his business by investing this loan in it, which will in turn help her family to live better. 

She is a new loan user and this is her first loan application to Asasah. 

Note: In the photo, the lady raising her hand is Barkat.

loans.use: To buy construction supplies

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is thirty years old and single. She has a mixed farm in Kitale in western Kenya which produces sugarcane, maize and sweet potatoes, all sold locally. She has been in the farming business for five years and employs four farmhands. Rose also runs a hardware shop in the same location. She says that unpredictable weather conditions and diseases have been her major difficulties.

Rose has requested this loan of 31,200 KES through Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow. The extra income from this loan will be invested in her other projects and also improve her livelihood.

Rose plans to expand her dairy farming by acquiring at least three more dairy cows and venture into poultry farming in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Nargiza's Group

texts.en:
Nargiza is 25 and married to a hairdresser. Along with her husband, she is raising their two-year-old daughter, who goes to kindergarten. Nargiza is the treasurer of this group.

Three years ago Nargiza saved 3,000 KGS and started to sell foodstuffs near the house. At the moment, her monthly profit is 7800 KGS. With money received from her loan Nargiza wants to purchase construction materials to build a shop.

In the future Nargiza plans to increase turnover of her stock and hopes that her business will progress successfully.

About Mol Bulak Finance:

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused microfinance institution in Kyrgyzstan. MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only microfinance institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials

loans.name: Bolortsetseg

texts.en:
Bolortsetseg is 31 years old and lives with her husband and baby in Erdenet, the third largest city in Mongolia. They married last year and have a small family house. Bolortsetseg's parents help them by looking after their baby and giving them a chance to work and earn some money. She is a very hardworking woman.

Since 2008, Bolortsetseg has been selling food in her shop. Now she is planning to increase her inventory with the summer season coming and June first’s Children’s Fun Day. The loan she is taking will be used to buy more food to sell.

Bolortsetseg’s dream is to give a good education to her son and make him a good man.

loans.use: to buy more food to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Kaneez's Group

texts.en:
Kaneez is married with four children. Her husband operates a grocery store in the community market. Through his store, he sells daily use items like cooking oil, spices, sugar etc. He is very good in dealing and earns good profits from his business. 

She herself is a housewife as well as a working lady. She manages her household and also operates a clothes-making business at her home. She does this work to supplement the income of her family. She receives orders from her neighboring clients and earns good money by completing them on time. 

Kaneez has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband's business. With the loan, he will buy groceries in bulk to put into his store. He has been operating this business for the past five years and Kaneez hopes that an investment will help him in making his business better and provide a better financial life to the family. 

She is a regular loan user and this is her third loan application to Asasah. In previous loan years, she has maintained a good credit behavior and never missed any meetings.

loans.use: To buy inventory for a grocery store business

loans.name: Taivanjargal

texts.en: Mr.Taivanjargal is 35 years old and lives with his wife and only daughter in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. They live in a ger, a traditional Mongolian Nomadic tent. His daughter, Khulan aged 10, studies at the local secondary school. His wife is currently unemployed and she is persistently looking for a job. Taivanjargal runs a taxi business and it is the only source of family income at the moment. He has been running this business for 7 years. The loan Mr.Taivanjargal is taking will be used to buy spare parts to service his car which he uses for his taxi business.

loans.use: To buy spare parts to service his family car which he uses for his taxi business.

loans.name: Sharon Rose

texts.en:
Sharon Rose is 35 years old and is a married woman with 3 children. Her oldest child is 15 while the youngest is only 2. Sharon Rose's husband works as a farmer and a driver.

Sharon Rose is also a farmer. She helps her husband till their land in the town of Banga, South Cotabato. She grows rice and corn. She also raises pigs in their backyard. Sharon Rose works hard to do her part in sustaining her family. She applied for a loan to purchase fertilizers and pig feed. Sharon Rose wants to earn more and save for her children's future.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and pig feed

loans.name: Uulkan's Group

texts.en:
Uulkan is the leader of this group. She is 49 and, unfortunately, she is a widow. She takes care of three children: two daughters and a son. The older daughter studies at university and the other children are at school. Uulkan works as a teacher at the local school. Six years ago she saved 10 000 soms from her salary and purchased a calf and two sheep. Since then, Uulkan has been breeding farm animals. With the loan she wants to purchase additional cattle for breeding. In the future Uulkan wants to increase the number of cattle and save some money to purchase a vehicle, but her main purpose is to provide her children with a good education.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase cattle

loans.name: Safarboy

texts.en:
Safarboy is a hardworking and responsible father of four children. He is a carpenter. Safarboy buys building materials from the market and makes doors, windows, walls and kitchens. He also repairs floors, ceilings and roofs. He has many regular customers. Safarboy would like a loan of 10,000 TJS to purchase building materials to expand his business and prepare good, high quality products.  


More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes being a key post along the Silk Road and maring the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. Even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To buy building materials

loans.name: Jamila's Group

texts.en:
Jamila is a housewife and maintains her household by staying at home. 

Her husband sells quilts. Jamila has four children. She is bringing them up with good care and discipline. 

She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah to help her husband in his business. He will use the loan to buy quilts which will help him complete orders on time and earn better profits. 

Jamila hopes that an investment will bring positive changes to his business and he will be able to improve the living conditions of his family. 

She is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her third loan application. In previous loan years, she has maintained good credit behavior and never missed any meetings.

loans.use: to buy quilts for resale

loans.name: Vivian

texts.en: Vivian is a 40-year-old married woman. She has 2 children aged 12 and 10. Vivian is a farmer and a hog-raiser. She grows rice and corn. She also raises pigs in her backyard. Vivian sells her harvest and fattened pigs at her town's market. Vivian wants to earn more to better support her family.

loans.use: to purchase pig feed, fertilizers and other farm inputs

loans.name: Emily

texts.en:
Emily is a dairy farmer from Litein town in the Rift valley Kenya. She has been farming for fifteen years and sells her milk locally. She also earns additional income from her small-scale farming of tea which she sells to the local market.

Emily has made a loan request of 50,000 Kes to purchase a dairy cow. The extra income from the sale of milk will help her pay school fees for her five children. She faces the challenge of not enough dairy feed which affects her production. She hopes to increase the number of her dairy cows and plant enough dairy feed in the near future.

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow.

loans.name: Yulchi

texts.en:
Yulchi is a hardworking man who is married and has nine children. His wife cultivates potatoes. Yulchi started his business by growing potatoes and wheat. On his 2 hectares of land he grows agricultural crops. He also does animal husbandry. He has 5 cattle and 21 sheep. He plans to build more room for his family with the additional profits from the loan. Yulchi would like a loan of 6,000 TJS to buy fertilizers to grow potatoes and wheat.

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes being a key post along the Silk Road and marking the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. Even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To buy fertilizers

loans.name: Margery

texts.en:
Margery is 40 years old and married with three children.

Margery works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari (variety) store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy more grocery items to sell.

Margery has borrowed and repaid two loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the sari-sari (variety) store for 10 years and also earns an income from pig fattening.

Margery aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more grocery items to sell.

loans.name: Angeles

texts.en:
As a married parent of six children, Angeles works hard to support her family.

She has a fruit vending business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from pig fattening. 

Angeles is borrowing PHP 13,000 through NWTF to buy more fruits to sell in her stall.

Angeles has been sustaining her business activities through her past four loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more fruits to sell in her stall.

loans.name: Edgardo

texts.en:
Edgardo is a 58-year-old married man who lives in the town of Banga, South Cotabato.

Edgardo has had a sari-sari (variety) store for almost 20 years. He sells soft drinks, biscuits and other various products. He also owns a small parcel of land that he cultivates to grow rice.

Edgardo has requested a loan and plans to use it to purchase rice seeds and items to sell such as canned goods and sugar. Edgardo hopes to expand his store in the future.

loans.use: to purchase rice seeds and items to sell such as canned goods and sugar

loans.name: Humaira's Group

texts.en:
Humaira is a seamstress, sewing clothes for her neighboring clients which earns her reasonably good profits. She learned about this art from her mother before her marriage. 

She is also a very good housewife and meets her household responsibilities very well. She is 29 years old and has a little child. She takes care of him well, bringing him up with good care and discipline. 

Her husband is 31 years old and is a carpet weaver. His products are in demand in the market and he earns a good amount of income from his business. 

Humaira has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband's business. With the loan, he will buy thread and weaving tools for weaving carpets which will help him make a better income. 

She is hopeful that an investment will help her husband increase his profits and allow her family to live a better life financially. 

She is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her third loan application. In previous loan years, she has maintained a good credit behavior and never missed any meetings.

loans.use: To buy thread and weaving tools for carpet weaving

loans.name: Gulsada's Group

texts.en:
Gulsada is the treasurer of this group. She is 48 and is married to a farmer. Together they have raised a daughter and a son. The daughter, 26, is handicapped and the son, 23, helps his parents with housework. The family has been engaged in cultivating agricultural products since 1993. By selling part of the harvest Gulsada earns 3,000 soms each month. With the loan she wants to purchase 200 liters of fuel, which is needed for work in her field. She will use part of the loan to hire labor. In the future Gulsada hopes to obtain a good harvest. She wants to make some money to improve her family’s living conditions.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase fuel and hire labor for field work

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Laarni

texts.en:
Laarni is 34 years old and is married. She has 3 children aged 12, 11 and 5. Her husband works as an auto mechanic.

Laarni owns and manages a sari-sari (general) store. She sells biscuits, bread and other products. She wants to sell gasoline because she said the location of her house is accessible to motorists. She also started a chorizo business and sells her product to locals.

Laarni plans to use the loan to purchase more items to sell, such as gasoline, and to invest in her chorizo business. Laarni hopes for her family to have better living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase more items to sell, such as gasoline, and to invest in her chorizo business

loans.name: Abdujabbor

texts.en:
Abdujabbor is 38 years old. He is married and has four children. His wife is a housewife. He sells men’s clothes in the market called “Khair” in  Vahdat city. He has been in this business for seven years and has much experience. Abdujabbor would like a loan of 8,000 TJS to purchase new, fashionable men’s clothes to expand his business and attract many new clients. He thanks all lenders who will support him and allow him to improve his family’s living conditions.  

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes being a key post along the Silk Road and marking the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To buy new, fashionable men’s clothes

loans.name: Nawal

texts.en:
Nawal is 56 years old, hard-working, and widowed. She still has two young men living with her, one of whom is a worker. 

Nawal is known for her beautiful hand-made embroideries, such as traditional dresses, pillow covers, and other items. She has been running her business at home for more than 10 years now, and has been successfull by having regular customers and attracting new ones by word of mouth. 

Now Nawal is applying for a loan to buy a plotting machine that will help her quicken her production process, and to buy more fabric and material.

loans.use: to buy a plotting machine and more fabric

loans.name: Ul

texts.en: Ul, aged 68, is married and resides with her children in Takeo Province, Cambodia. She has a child. She is engaged in grocery sales, earning an income of $3 per day to help cover the family expenses. The family is also assisted by her husband who is a motorbike repairman, earning an income of $4 per day. Their standard of living has been improved since Ul and her husband have had these businesses. Ul is requesting a loan of $1,200 to purchase ducks to raise for resale. This is her fourth loan from CREDIT, a partner of Kiva.

loans.use: to buy ducks to raise for sale

loans.name: Zohir

texts.ru: Зохир проживает в районе Муминобод города Куляб. Возраст, 59 лет. Женат. Имеет 10 детей. Жена, домохозяйка. Две сыновей находятся в Российской Федерации. Сам он имеет высшее образование, инженер технолог. По профессии проработал 20 лет. На сегодняшний день он занимается торговлей. Он у себя дома открыл продуктовый магазин. В этой области он уже 10 лет. Кредит берет для ремонта магазина и увеличения ассортимента товара.
texts.en: Zohir lives in Muminobod district of the city of Kouliab. Age, 59 years. Married. 10 children. His wife is a homemaker. Two of his sons are in the Russian Federation. Zohir has a college degree; he is a technology engineer. He has worked in his field for 20 years. At present he is in retail. He opened a grocery store in his home. He has been in this business for 10 years. He is taking out a loan to renovate his store and increase his stock.

loans.use: to renovate his grocery store and increase his stock

loans.name: Mutabarkhon

texts.en:
Mutabarkhon is a hardworking businesswoman. She is married and is the loving mother of four children. Her husband is an entrepreneur. She has been engaged in clothing sales. She sells national clothes in the market called “Khair”. Mutabarkhon has been in this business for 15 years and she has broad experience. She has regular customers and a good income. She would like a loan of 8,000 TJS to purchase new, national clothes which will  enable her to attract new customers.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes being a key post along the Silk Road and marking the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. Even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To buy new clothes to sell

loans.name: Colita

texts.en:
Colita is 38 years old and married. She has four children and one is in school. Colita works very hard to provide for them.

Colita runs a sari-sari (variety) store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy more stock to sell.

Colita has been in this business for three years and sells a variety of items such as bread, rice and other miscellaneous items. 

In the future Colita would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Elizabeth works hard to support her family.

She has a sugarcane farming business in the Philippines and also earns an additional income from her sari-sari (variety) store. Elizabeth is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to  buy fertilizer for her sugarcane farming business.

Elizabeth has been sustaining her business activities through her past seven loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to repair and renovate her family home.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her sugarcane.

loans.name: Shaker

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 35 years old, married, and has three children.

Shaker has had a shop for fixing car air conditioners since 1985. He has a long experience and has a good reputation and he is well known in his area.

He is requesting a loan of $3000 to make a sliding door and to buy an auto air conditioner compressor. He is aiming to gain more profits so he can improve his family’s quality of life.

loans.use: To make a sliding door and to buy an auto air conditioner compressor.

loans.name: Rosalina

texts.en:
Rosalina is 62 years old and married.

She earns a living by farming sugarcane in the Philippines. Rosalina is borrowing PHP 25,000 through NWTF to buy fertilizer and pay for the laborers' salaries.

Rosalina has been farming her sugarcane business for 12 years and also earns an additional income from her sari-sari (variety) store.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream of expanding her business and renovating her family home.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pay for the laborers' salaries.

loans.name: Boldbaatar

texts.en:
Mr.Boldbaatar is 23 years old and lives with his wife and 2 children in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. 
Boldbaatar is a professional carpenter and he works for “ Oak Hill Custom Carpentry” company. His wife works for the same company as a tailor. 
Currently they live in Boldbaatar’s parents' old house. Boldbaatar is planning to renovate the house and, therefore, he needs to buy the necessary building materials. The loan will be used to buy 8000 bricks, 2 windows, an entrance door, 5 bags of sands and other building materials to renovate his parents' old house.

loans.use: To buy materials to renovate his parents' old house where he lives

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To make a sliding door and ceramic flooring for his shop.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase chickens and chicken feed, and to construct a chicken unit.

loans.name: Ruby

texts.en:
Ruby, 35, is married and has three children. Two of them are in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Ruby has a general store business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 19,000 loan through NWTF to buy items like canned goods, groceries, etc., to sell in her general store.

Ruby has been in this business for 11 years.  

In the future, Ruby would like to save enough money to purchase a fishing boat.

loans.use: to buy items to sell in her general store

loans.name: Khul

texts.en: Khul, aged 52, is married and resides with her children in Takeo Province, Cambodia. She has two children. She is engaged in rice wine selling, earning an income of $3 per day to help cover the family expenses. The family is also assisted by her husband who is a traditional musician, earning an income of $2 per day. Their standard of living has improved since Khul and her husband have had these businesses. Khul is requesting a loan of $1000 to produce more rice wine to sell. This is her fourth loan from CREDIT, a partner of Kiva.

loans.use: to produce more rice wine to sell

loans.name: Ninfa

texts.en:
As a married parent of seven children, Ninfa works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from farming sugarcane. 

Ninfa is borrowing PHP 25,000 through NWTF to buy a new diesel motor and to repair her fishing boat.

Ninfa has been sustaining her business activities through her past 15 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to buy more farm land.

loans.use: to buy a new diesel motor and to repair the fishing boat.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Marissa

texts.en:
Marissa works hard to support her family. She is married and has a fishing business in the Philippines.

Marissa requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

Marissa has been in this business for 10 years.

In the future, Marissa would like to save enough money to purchase another fishing boat.

loans.use: to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

loans.name: Vahan

texts.en:
Vahan lives with his wife and three sons, two of whom are serving in the army and will join the family business once they are back home. 

Vahan is engaged in agriculture. He keeps livestock and cultivates land and an orchard. 

The population in the countryside has drastically decreased, with most men leaving the country for work opportunities abroad, and it is vital for the community to retain its local population.  

Vahan would like to increase the livestock and cultivate more land. With the requested loan, he plans to purchase livestock and potato seeds. In this way, Vahan will increase his income and ensure better living conditions for his family as well as business income for his sons.

loans.use: to pay for livestock and seeds.

loans.name: Eloisa

texts.en:
Eloisa works hard to support her family. She is married and has a general store business in the Philippines. Eloisa has been in this business for 12 years.

Eloisa requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell.

In the future, Eloisa would like to save enough money to purchase a fishing boat.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell.

loans.name: Juan

texts.en:
Juan is 50 years old and married. He has four children.

Juan works hard to provide for his family. He has been running a general store for 10 years and also earns an income from his trisikad transport (a  bicycle with a passenger seat attached to the side).

He requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy items for his general store and tools for his trisikad transport.

Juan has borrowed and repaid seven loans from NWTF before this loan.

Juan aspires to save enough money so he can afford to purchase a new motorcycle.

loans.use: to buy items for his general store and tools for his trisikad transport.

loans.name: Delia

texts.en:
As a married parent of six children, Delia works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines and also earns an additional income from food vending, charcoal sales and raising pigs.  

Delia is borrowing PHP 25,000 through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell in her general store business.

Delia has been sustaining her business activities through her past 19 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy farm inputs like seeds and fertillizer

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
Emma is 42 years old, married, and has 11 children. Six of the children are in school.

Emma is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. She has been raising pigs for 10 years now and has borrowed three times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

She has requested a PHP 16,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds, medicines and vitamins for her pigs.

In the future, Emma would like to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feed, medicines and vaccines for her pigs.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy calves and cultivate the land.

loans.name: Gleceria

texts.en:
Gleceria is single and has a firewood business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 3 years and works hard to support her family. 

Gleceria requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy firewood to sell.

In the future, she would like to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy firewood to sell

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Sokhum

texts.en: Sokhum, aged 54, is married and resides with her children in Takeo Province, Cambodia. She has two children. She is engaged in grocery selling, earning an income of $3 per day to help cover the family expenses. The family is also assisted by her husband who is a traditional musician, earning an income of $7 per day. Their standard of living has improved since Sokhum and her husband have had these businesses. Sokhum is requesting a loan of $600 to purchase more groceries to stock the store. This is her second loan from CREDIT, a partner of Kiva.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to stock her store

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter has been practicing mixed farming for 30 years now and employs one farmhand. His farm produces tea, vegetables and tomatoes which he sells through Kenya Tea Development Authority and to the local market. He earns additional income from his business in the same location.

Peter has requested a loan of 60,000 Kes through Juhudi Kilimo to purchase water pumps and pipes. He says that, with the pumps and pipes, he will be assured of continuous production during the dry seasons. His biggest challenge has been the unstable market for his vegetables. He plans to increase his output by acquiring more land for farming. He further comments that farming has been simplified by access to financial services from Juhudi Kilimo.

loans.use: To purchase water pumps and pipes.

loans.name: Aghvan Mkrtchyan

texts.en:
This client is engaged in agriculture. He keeps livestock and cultivates land. He would like to develop other branches of agriculture, too. In particular he plans to develop beekeeping. With the requested loan, the client plans to purchase beehives and a special sort of potato seeds. The business development will allow him to increase his income and will improve his family’s living conditions. 

The client lives with his wife. His two sons are serving in the army.

loans.use: to pay for beehives and seeds

loans.name: Neang

texts.en:
Neang, age 62, is married and resides with her family in Takeo Province in Cambodia. She has one child.  Neang has a business as a weaver and earns an income of $3 per day to help cover her family's expenses. The family is also assisted by her husband who works as a farmer, earning an income of $1 per day. Their standard of living has improved since Neang and her husband have had these businesses. 

Neang is requesting a loan of $500 to purchase more raw silk to expand her current business. This is her first loan from CREDIT, a Kiva partner.

loans.use: to buy more silk for her weaving business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more shoes and open another business premise

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is a forty-year-old single mother of four shool-going children.  She lives in her own house in Fort Portal, Uganda.  The responsbility of looking after the family rests solely on her.  She lives in a semi-permanent house with her children.  Her desire is to build a permanent house and educate her children.   

Elizabeth has been tailoring for fourteen years.  She is happy with her skill and with it she has been able to pay school fees for her children by tailoring school uniforms for various institutions.  Her challenge is having limited capital to meet the increasing demand.  Her desire is to own a school.  Elizabeth needs this loan to buy uniform materials for sewing.

loans.use: To buy sewing materials

loans.name: Gulom

texts.en:
Gulom is a hardworking married man. His wife is a housewife and does not work outside the home.    Gulom works as a taxi driver to make a living to provide for his family’s needs.  He works from early morning until late at night.  He services the route between Kanibadam and Khujand, and earns a good daily income of about 100 – 150 TJS.  

Gulom would like to get a loan of 1000$ USD to convert his vehicle to (compressed natural) gas.  That way, he will save more money since the price of (natural) gas is cheaper than the price of petrol.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: to install gas equipment

loans.name: Nicholas

texts.en:
Nicholas is 41 years old.  He is married to Miriam and they have one child who is 4 years old.  He contributes to the family income by running a retail trading business.  He has been in this business for 2 years and earns an income of KES 7,500 per month.

Nicholas is taking out his first loan after being introduced to KADET by a KADET staff member.   He wants to use this loan to buy stock of flour, sugar and cooking fat.  His hope is to educate his child and improve their living standard.

loans.use: to buy stock of flour, sugar and cooking fat

loans.name: Bayarsaikhan

texts.en:
Bayarsaikhan is 39 years old.  He lives with his wife and 3 children in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia.  His 3 children attend a local secondary school.  Bayarsaikhan’s family live in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent. 

Bayarsaikhan has been running a transportation business since 2000 using his minibus. His wife works with him as a cashier.  He carries people on routes where there is no public transport.   Each year, he must renew his permit to carry a passengers.  Bayarsaikhan's route lies between two big outdoor markets, therefore he always has a full-load of passengers.
