Two years ago Bayarsaikhan bought the plot of land where he now lives and he is planning to build a house on it. The loan he is taking out will be used to buy the necessary building materials to start his family house building project.

loans.use: to buy materials to build his house

loans.name: Lilian

texts.en:
Lilian is a married woman with 2 children. She is 40 years old and runs a sari-sari store business.  Lilian sells items like canned sardines and noodles to the people in her community. She also sells prepaid mobile loan credits. Lilian wants to sell rice as well.

Lilian is requesting a loan of 18000 PHP to buy more items to sell, such as canned goods and rice.

In the future, Lilian hopes to expand her sari-sari store.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to cultivate potatoes

loans.name: Joan

texts.en:
Joan is a twenty-four-year-old married woman with one child.  She lives in her own house in Fort Portal in Uganda.  She has four dependents and is married to an engineer who also contributes to the welfare of the family.  

Joan sells clothes for a living and has been in business for four years.  Her business is profitable despite challenges in irregular sales due to rains.  Her desire is to have a sheltered shop and stop vending in the open.  Joan intends to use the loan to buy clothes to resell.

loans.use: To buy more clothes to resell

loans.name: Maxwel

texts.en: Maxwel is 22 years old and single.  He makes and sells doughnuts (mandazi) and samosas in his cafeteria.  He has employed one person in his business.   Maxwell has benefited from Faulu Kenya because he is able to save his money and access loans easily.  He hopes be financially stable and start a family in the future.  He has requested a loan for 20,000 KES to buy wheat, cooking fat and charcoal.

loans.use: To buy wheat, cooking fat and charcoal

loans.name: Julita

texts.en:
Julita is a married woman with two children. She is 42 years old and has had a sari-sari (variety) store business for 15 years.

Julita sells items like detergent, soaps and shampoos to the people in her community. She also sells slippers. She sometimes helps her husband till their rice farm that her husband mainly manages.

Julita is requesting a loan of 14,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) to buy more items to sell, such as canned goods and noodles.

In the future, Julita hopes to expand her sari-sari store. She also wants for her family's living conditions to improve.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell, such as canned goods and noodles.

loans.name: Aide Plus Group

texts.en:
Aide Plus is a community bank of 12 owners of small businesses chaired by André. Its members are jointly liable for loans granted by Kiva through the MFI HOPE DRCongo to grow their businesses.

André, 45, is married. He sells loaves of bread in his area. He became a micro-entrepreneur in 2009. André is loyal client who received already seven loans from the microfinance institution HOPE DRC and fully repaid them. He intends to use the next loan to purchase some more baskets of loaves of bread to resell in order to reinforce his working capital. Currently, he earns a profit of $75 a week. His ambition is to open a bakery in his environment. André has six children whose ages vary between 2 and 15 years old.

loans.use: to increase the inventory of his business by purchasing some more baskets of loaves of bread to resell in order to reinforce his working capital.

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en: Emmanuel is a 32-year-old married man with a child. He is living in his own semi-permanent house in Fort Portal, Uganda. He has been a motorcycle driver and also a part-times teacher for five years now. After realizing that the meager salary of a primary teacher could not support his family, he bought a motorcycle, and he is proud of the benefits he's reaping. He has a challenge of mechanical breakdowns, and his desire is to own at least three motorcycles. Emmanuel needs the loan to buy a motorcycle.

loans.use: To buy a motorcycle for the transport business.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en: This client is trading in clothing and shoes from a rented booth at the city market. She wishes to sell more clothes and increase her working capital. With the requested loan, the client plans to purchase clothing and increase the trade. With the loan’s help, she will get more income and will be able to pay for her daughters’ education and ensure a better future for them. The client lives together with her three daughters.

loans.use: to pay for clothing

loans.name: Phal

texts.en:
Phal, age 37, is married and resides with his family in Takeo Province, Cambodia. He has seven children.  

Phal is engaged in a hammock business, earning an income of $6 per day to help cover his family's expenses.   The family is also assisted by his wife, who is a farmer and earns an income of $2 per day.  Their standard of living has improved since Phal and his wife have had these businesses. 

Phal is requesting a loan of $1000 to purchase a motorbike with a trailer attached to transport hammocks to sell. This is his first loan from CREDIT, a KIVA partner.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike with a trailer

loans.name: Rose

texts.en: Rose sells bananas, onions, paste and fruits.  She is 32 years old, married, and has 3 children  – 1 of them go to school.  Rose borrowed a loan to stock more bananas, onions, paste and fruits to sell.  She hopes to expand her business in the future with the extra profits.

loans.use: stock more bananas, onions, paste and fruits to sell

loans.name: Don De Dieu Plus Group

texts.en:
“Don de Dieu Plus” is a group of 11 smallbusiness owners chaired by Colette. Its members are jointly liable for loans granted by Kiva to grow their businesses.

Colette is 51 years old.  She is a widow and is the mother of four children between 14 and 32 years old.  All of them go to school.   Colette has a soft drinks business which she started in 2001.  Her business brings in US$20 per week.  Colette is a hardworking woman who has demonstrated some abilities in business such as organization and good management. She is a loyal client of IMF HOPE RDC and has previously received eight different loans which she has correctly repaid.  

Colette is requesting a new loan to help her increase the inventory of her goods in order to meet the high demand for soft drinks in her community. She is confident in her business. She knows how to attract her customers by offering what they need and like. She is also diplomatic when she talks to her clients.  Colette’s medium-term plan is to open a soft drinks facility in her area.

loans.use: to buy softdrinks to resell

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Deo

texts.en:
Deo is a hardworking thirty-year-old married man.  He lives with his two children in a semi-permanent house in Fort Portal, Uganda. He is the sole  breadwinner for the family.  His desire is to buy land and expand his farm.  

For three years, Deo has been providing motorcycle transport for a living.  He started as a street vendor and later bought a motorcycle.  He has challenges in the poor road network that causes many accidents.  His desire is to buy at least four motorcycles so as to spread his risks.  Deo needs the loan money to buy a motorcycle.

loans.use: buy a motorcycle for his transport business

loans.name: Dickson

texts.en:
Dickson is 29 years old.  He is married and has two children.  He has been a farmer for the past three years.   Having paid his previous loan well, Dickson has applied for his third loan with KADET LTD  to buy farm supplies such as seeds and fertilizer.  With the profits generated, he plans to pay school fees for his children and re-invest the rest in farming.   His dream is to be a well-known farmer. 

Dickson is a diligent man who makes effort to attain better results, despite limited resources.

loans.use: buy farm supplies such as seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Bayarkhuu

texts.en:
Bayarkhuu is 53 years old.  She lives with her husband and a son in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. They live in “ger”, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent, on a relative’s plot of land.  Her husband has lung cancer and stays at home and her son is studying in college. 

Since 2005, Bayarkhuu has been sewing covers for gers and selling them to customers at the market. In the beginning she was renting a sewing machine but now she has her own sewing machine which she bought.  In recent years, Bayarkhuu has started to receive more and more orders from her clients.  She is planning to buy textile materials for her business to grow her income by producing more products. 

Bayarkhuu is a hardworking woman. Her dream is to buy a plot of land and to educate son to the university.

loans.use: buy more materials to sew ger covers

loans.name: Mahabat's Group

texts.en:
Mahabat is the leader of this group. She is 32 years old and is married to a farmer. Together with her husband, she brings up a daughter and a son. Their son, 9, is studying at school and their daughter is of pre-school age (under seven). 

In order to earn money for the family, Mahabat takes orders and sews Kyrgyz national blankets and pillows.   At the moment, her husband is working in construction, therefore most of the agricultural work fall on Mahabat’s shoulders.  

Mahabat’s has applied for this loan because she needs funds to purchase 100 liters of fuel and some sheep for breeding. In the future, she wants to improve her family’s living conditions.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: purchase fuel for field work and sheep for breeding

loans.name: Merma

texts.en:
Merma is a married woman with a 3-year-old child. She is 29 years old and has had a sari-sari store business for 5 years.

Merma sells items like canned tuna and sardines, biscuits and soaps to the people in her community. She is requesting a loan of 12000 PHP to buy more items to sell, such as canned goods and rice.

In the future, Merma hopes to improve her business and have her own capital.

loans.use: buy more items to resell

loans.name: Abdul

texts.en:
Abdul is a thirty-seven-year-old married man with nine children.  They live in a semi permanent house in Fort Portal, Uganda.  He is the sole breadwinner for his family.  His dream is to educate his children to attain degrees as minimum qualification.  

Abdul works as both a carpenter and a motorcycle rider and has been in these businesses for twelve years.  He faces challenges in the irregularity of sales.   His desire is to have at least five motorcycles and also to improve his furniture shop.  Abdul needs a loan to buy a motorcycle.

loans.use: buy a motorcycle

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: purchase farm supplies

loans.name: Sokly

texts.en: Sokly, age 33, is married and resides with her children in Takeo Province, Cambodia. She has two children. She is engaged in a business as a farmer, earning an income of $1.60 per day to help cover the family expenses. The family is also assisted by her husband, who is a construction worker who earns an income of $2.80 per day. Their standard of living has been improved since Sokly and her husband have had these businesses. Sokly is requesting a loan of $1,200 to purchase a motorbike for her children to commute to work. This is her first loan from CREDIT, a partner of Kiva.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike for her children to commute to work.

loans.name: Romulo

texts.en:
Romulo is a married man with two children, aged 20 and 17. He is 55 years old and has had a sari-sari (variety) store business for 20 years.

Romulo sells items like noodles, coffee and spices to the people in his community. He also sells assorted fish. He buys directly from fishermen and he goes around the community to sell fish. Romulo is requesting a loan of 30,000 Philippines pesos to buy more items to sell, such as coffee and rice. He also plans to buy more assorted fish to resell.

In the future, Romulo hopes to expand his store. He also wishes to see his children finish college and be successful.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell, such as coffee, rice and fish.

loans.name: Maimuna

texts.en: Maimuna sells paste, onions, bananas and passion fruit. She is 37 years old, married and has 6 children, none of whom go to school. Maimuna took a loan to stock more paste, onions, bananas and passion fruit to sell. She hopes to expand her business, in the future, with the extra profits.

loans.use: to stock more paste, onions, bananas and passion fruit to sell.

loans.name: Exode Plus Group

texts.en:
Thérèse, aged 61, is married and is the Chairwoman of the Community Bank named “Exode Plus”. This group consists of 12 members united in solidarity to receive loans from Kiva through IMF HOPE RDC with the goal of developing their businesses. 

Thérèse started her business in 2003. She has been running a restaurant located east of the city of Kinshasa. She is a loyal client of IMF HOPE RDC and has already received five different loans and repaid them properly. She intends to use the next loan to increase the stock of her restaurant by buying 1 sack of flour, 2 sugar bags and beans with the aim of increasing her profits. Each day, her business brings in a profit of $10. 
Her ambition is to open a big restaurant in her neighbourhood. Thérèse has seven children aged between 25 and 45. Two of them are students.

loans.use: to increase her restaurant stock by buying flour, beans and other goods

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Lydiah

texts.en: Lydiah is 31 years old and a single mother of one. She runs a cyber cafe to earn a living. She has been in the business for nine years and has employed one person. Her dream and aspiration is to open a computer training college. She has requested 20,000 Kes to buy a computer and a generator.

loans.use: To buy a computer and a generator

loans.name: Aizat's Group

texts.en:
Aizat, 29, is the treasurer of this group. Her husband works as a security guard in a bank. Together they bring up four daughters. The two older daughters study at school while the others are preschool age (under seven). To earn additional money to meet the family needs Aizat, together with her husband,  cultivates agricultural products. They own one hectare of land which can be used for growing potatoes. To realize their plans, the family needs additional financial funds. With the loan, Aizat will purchase 200 liters of fuel and four tons of potato seeds. In the future, she hopes to get a good harvest.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase fuel and potato seeds

loans.name: Kimoun

texts.en: Kimoun, age 25, is married and resides with her one child in Takeo Province, Cambodia. She is a farmer, earning an income of $1 per day to help cover the family expenses. The family is also assisted by her husband who is a construction worker, earning an income of $5 per day. Their standard of living has improved since Kimoun and her husband have had these businesses. Kimoun is requesting a loan of $700 to purchase two cows to help plow rice fields. This is her first loan from CREDIT, a partner of Kiva. Kimoun appears in the photograph preparing lunch for her family.

loans.use: to buy two cows to help plow rice fields

loans.name: Ketevan

texts.en:
Ketevan is a farmer from the village of Idumala, South Georgia. She is 39 years old and lives with her husband, Ramaz, 15-year-old daughter, 7-year-old son and her parents-in-law. Ramaz serves in the army of the country and earns approximately 900 laris per month. Ketevan is a teacher in the village school. She is paid 150 laris per month. Ramaz and Ketevan are running the business activities of the family. In particular, they grow potatoes, haricot and maize on a family-owned 0.75 hectare agricultural plot. The harvested vegetables are sold at the local market. Also, Ketevan and her mother-in-law run a family-owned dairy farm, consisting of two milk cows and 20 goats. Ketevan produces cheese and sells it locally. Their total income from agriculture is approximately 400 laris per month.

With the requested loan, the family plans to diversify its business activities. In particular, they will purchase a mini-bus. It will be rented to a local driver and will carry passengers between two towns of East Georgia (Saguramo and Tbilisi) and bring additional income to the family. Ketevan and Ramaz will use the increased income for the education of their children, as well as to finance other current expenses of the family.

loans.use: to purchase a mini-bus for business purposes.

loans.name: Phally

texts.en: Phally, aged 43, is married and resides with her children in Takeo Province, Cambodia. She has three children. She is a hairdresser, earning an income of $5 per day to help cover the family expenses. The family is also assisted by her husband who is a motor-taxi driver, earning an income of $6 per day. Their standard of living has improved since Phally and her husband have had these businesses. Phally is requesting a loan of $1000 to purchase more hairdressing equipment to improve her current business. This is her fourth loan from CREDIT, a partner of Kiva.

loans.use: to buy more hairdressing equipment

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy farm inputs

loans.name: Regina

texts.en: Regina sells beans and groundnuts. She is 39 years old, married and has 6 children, 4 of whom go to school. Regina borrowed a loan to stock more beans and groundnuts to sell. She hopes to expand her business with the extra profits in the future.

loans.use: to stock more beans and groundnuts to sell.

loans.name: Sabira's Group

texts.en:
Sabira is the leader of this group. She is 69 and is married to a farmer. Together with her husband, who is a pensioner, she has raised five daughters and three sons. All her children are married and live with their families. Only the youngest son lives with his parents (under the Kyrgyz traditions the youngest son’s family lives with the parents). To make additional money to meet their needs, the family breeds cattle. They have been doing it for twenty years, so this family has a lot of experience in this sphere. With this loan, Sabira wants to purchase three farm animals for breeding and construction materials for repairing the house.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase three farm animals for breeding

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase farm supplies and livestock

loans.name: Shadrack

texts.en: Shadrack is 25 years old and is single. He sells shoes to earn a living. He has been in this business for almost six years. He also supplies sweets to retail shops for extra income. He really appreciates the business training conducted by Faulu Kenya because he has learnt skills for operating his business. Shadrack is determined to grow his business to a wholesale operation in the future. He has requested 20,000 Kes to buy a whistle and an amplifier for playing sound tracks so as to attract customers.

loans.use: To buy a whistle and an amplifier to attract customers

loans.name: Habiba

texts.ru: Хабиба жительница района Шахритус. Ей 52 года. Она замужем. У нее 6 детей. Она предоставляет услугу. Арендует помещение, где открыла салон свадебных платьев. В этой области она уже 8 лет. Кредит берет для покупки новых видов свадебных платьев. Она хочет увеличить ассортимент своего товара.
texts.en: Habiba lives in the Shahrituz Region. She is 52 years old. Married, with six children. She provides a service. She rents a store in which she opened a bridal salon. She has been in this business for eight years already. She is taking out a loan in order to buy new styles of wedding gowns. She would like to increase her stock.

loans.use: to buy new types of wedding  gowns

loans.name: Avenir Plus Group

texts.en:
Benz is the leader of the Community Bank “Avenir Plus”, which is composed of 6 members united in solidarity to receive loans from Kiva through MFI HOPE RDC with the goal of developing their businesses. 

Benz runs a telephone booth and is a photographer in his area which is located west of Kinshasa. He began his business in 2000. With hard work and determination, his business has prospered. Benz is now well known and liked in this area. He has already received eight MFI HOPE DRC loans and fully repaid them. His business has prospered and the loans he has received have helped him to rent a well located business place. He makes $40 profit each week. 

With the next loan, Benz intends to purchase more prepaid cards to meet customer demand and generate additional profits. His ambition is to open a cellular phone shop. He is 39 years old and is married. He is the father of two children aged 4 and 8. The oldest attends school.

loans.use: to buy more prepaid cards to meet customer demand and generate additional profits

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Mugume

texts.en: Mugume is a forty two year old married woman with eight children living in her own semi permanent house in Fort Portal Uganda.Her husband is a tailor and thier dream is to educate their children up to university. For twenty years she has been selling clothes, she started with 100,000 but she currently has working capital of two million shillings. She has a challenge of the rainy season since she operates from an open place and her dream is to own a boutique. Mugume needs the loan to purchase clothes for sell.

loans.use: To purchase clothes for sell.

loans.name: Gulbarchyn's Group

texts.en:
Gulbarchyn is the leader of this group. She is 34 and is married to a farmer. Together they bring up three daughters and two sons. The daughters are at school while the sons are of preschool age (under seven). To earn money to meet the family budget, Gulbarchyn opened a kiosk near the house and started to sell convenience goods. She started with the initial investment of 30 000 soms and now her monthly profit is 10 000 soms. She applied for the loan because she needs additional funds to increase product turnover. With the loan Gulbarchyn wants to purchase one pack of sugar, three packs of macaroni, ketchup, soda and other goods. In the future she plans to start building a nice grocery store.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase stock such as sugar, macaroni and soda

loans.name: Yang

texts.en: Yang, aged 48, is married and resides with her four children in Takeo Province, Cambodia. She raises pigs, earning an income of $1 per day to help cover the family expenses. The family is also assisted by her husband who is a rice wine producer, earning an income of $2 per day. The family's standard of living has been improved since Yang and her husband have had these businesses. Yang is requesting a loan of $1200 to purchase a motorbike for the children to commute to work. This is her first loan from CREDIT, a partner of Kiva.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike for her children to commute to work.

loans.name: Milka

texts.en:
Milka is 33 years old, married to Mburu and they have four children. She has practised farming in Ndunyu Njeru for the last 12 years.
  
She was introduced to KADET LTD by one of her friends. This will be her seventh loan after she repaid all her previous loans well and in good time. She plans to use the loan amount to buy eight calves and fatten them for resale.

In the future, Milka hopes to become a leading supplier of cows in the Ndunyu Njeru area.

loans.use: to buy eight cow calves and fatten them.

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia is 44 years old, married to Joseph and they have 2 children. She has practised farming in Ndunyu Njeru town for the past 18 years.

She was introduced to KADET LTD by one of our field officers and this will be her second loan from KADET. She repaid her previous loan of KES.10,000 well and in good time. She plans to use the loan to buy onion seeds and fertilizer and also to pay for labour.

In the future, Lydia hopes to become a leading farmer in Ndunyu Njeru area.

loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Jovanis

texts.en: Jovanis is a 47-year-old widow with four children, living in her own semi-permanent house in Fort Portal, Uganda. She is solely charged with the responsibility of looking after her children and her desire is to see them through school. She sells used clothes and has been in business for eight years. She started with 300,000 but she currently has working capital of 800,000/=. She faces the challenges of seasonal changes and the rainy season is very inconvenient for her since she operates in an open place. Her dream is to own a boutique. Jovanis needs a loan to buy clothes to sell.

loans.use: To buy clothes to sell.

loans.name: Floreta

texts.en:
Floreta  is from the village of Looc, Libertad Sapang Dalaga Misamis Occidental. She is 54 years old, married, and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Floreta owns and operates a fishing business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from harvesting and selling farm-raised fish in the local community. Floreta has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 1,000 PHP a month.

In 2011, Floreta joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Floreta is requesting a loan of 4,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional fingerlings to raise. This loan will be Floreta's first loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has seven branches covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherpeople, and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional fingerlings to raise

loans.name: Mabongisi Ya Nkolo Plus Group

texts.en:
Rebecca is the leader of the Community Bank named “Mabongisi ya Nkolo Plus” which means “God’s Plan” in English. It is composed of 5 members united in solidarity for receiving Kiva loans with the goal of developing their businesses.

Rebecca is 34 years old and the mother of four children whose ages vary between 3 and 9. Three of them attend school. Rebecca operates a general store. She has been active in her business since 1990.  She joined one of Hope’s groups (a DRCongo Microfinance Program) in 2010, and has received five loans. Thanks to Hope’s loans, Rebecca’s business has prospered and it generates a profit of $80 per week. She intends to use the next loan to increase her inventory by buying cans, sacks of rice, sugar and milk to resell at a profit to increase income. As there is high demand, her ambition is to open a larger store in her area.

loans.use: to increase stock by buying cans, sacks of rice, sugar and milk and reselling them at profit.

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Bonface

texts.en: Boniface is 41 years old, married and has two children. To earn a living, he does farming. He has been farming for six years. He hopes to expand his business in the future. Being a member of Faulu Kenya, he previously serviced a loan which he used to boost his business. He has requested 20,000 Kes to buy seeds, farm chemicals and pipes for irrigation.

loans.use: To buy seeds, farm chemicals and pipes for irrigation.

loans.name: Richel

texts.en:
Richel  is from the village of Looc, Libertad,Sapang Dalaga Misamis Occidental. She is 28 years old, married, and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Richel owns and operates a fishing business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from harvesting and selling  fish in the local community. Richel has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month.

In 2010, Richel joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Richel has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from GDMPC.  Richel is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional fish for sale. This loan will be Richel's third loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has seven branches  covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherpeople, and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional fish to sell.

loans.name: Tuzigame Group

texts.fr:
Pascaline est une commerçante âgée de 34ans qui habite au chef lieu de la Province de Kayanza située au Nord du Burundi. Elle  fait le commerce de produits alimentaires comme la farine de maïs mais aussi vend des habits et autres articles depuis 6 ans et elle est en même temps cultivatrice. Elle est mariée a Ernest Nduwayo lui-même commerçant d’habits et ont 6 enfants âgés respectivement de 14ans, 12ans, 10ans,7ans,5ans et 1an 6mois qui étudient. Elle a fait ses études jusqu’en 6e année primaire. 

Elle demande le crédit Kiva pour  augmenter son capital et agrandir son activité pour réaliser de grands bénéfices. Elle espère que son business va croitre considérablement pour lui permettre d’assurer les besoins élémentaires familiaux 
 
Elle est membre  du groupe  communautaire« Tuzigame».
texts.en: Pascaline is a 34-year-old shopkeeper who lives at the chief place in the province of Kayanza, situated to the north of Burundi.  She has sold not only food products, such as corn flour, but also clothes and other articles for 6 years and at the same time, works as a cultivator.  She is married to Ernest Nduwayo, himself a clothing shopkeeper, and they have 6 children, aged respectively 14 years old, 12 years old, 10 years old, 7 years old, 1 year old, and 6 months old, who are being educated.  She studied until her 6th year of primary school.  She is asking Kiva for a loan to augment her capital and increase the size of her business in order to make large profits.  She hopes her business will grow considerably in order to allow her to ensure that her family's basic needs are met.  She is a member of the group "Tuzigame."

loans.use: to augment his capital and to increase his business in order to make large profits.

loans.name: Pauline

texts.en:
Pauline is 50 years and is married to Stanley who works in a power station. They are blessed with three children aged 22, 24 and 27 who are all in college.

Her primary business is rental houses but she also sells clothes, both new and second hand. She has been doing this for five years and earns a monthly income of KES.16,500.

This is her seventh loan cycle from KADET LTD and she has a good credit history. She will use the funds to buy more clothes and also to buy paint for her rental houses.

Pauline hopes to own a fashion house in the future.

loans.use: To buy more clothes and paint for her rental houses

loans.name: Lutfiyamo

texts.ru: Лутфиямо проживает в районе Муминобод. Возраст, 36 лет. Замужем, имеет двоих детей. Ее муж занимается пчеловодством. Сама она имеет средне – специальное образование, она садовод. По специальности работает 10 лет. А также она занимается растениеводством. При доме имеет не большой участок земли, где выращивает овощи. Кредит берет для закупа минеральных удобрений и расширения своей деятельности.
texts.en: Lutfiyamo lives in the Muminobod region. She's thirty-six years old, married and has two children. Her husband works as a beekeeper and Lutfiyamo has had vocational training as a gardener. She's worked in this area for ten years. There's a big plot of land near her house, where she grows vegetables. She's asking for a loan in order to buy some mineral fertilizers and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase mineral fertilizers and expand her business

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane, 45, is married to Cyrus. They are blessed with two children aged 27 and 19.

She sells second-hand clothes and has been doing this for two years. The business earns her a monthly income of KES 19,290.

This is her second loan from KADET Ltd., and she has successfully settled her previous loan. She will use the funds to buy two bales of clothes for resale.

She intends to use the anticipated profits to buy new clothes for sale and hopes to educate her children and operate a big fashion shop.

loans.use: To buy more clothes for resale.

loans.name: Maha

texts.en: Maha is a 42-year-old mother of six children. She is married to Abdullah, a building contractor, and she lives in a rented house in Marka. In order to help her husband financially, Maha started a small retail business selling clothes at home. She has been doing this for two years now, and she wants to continue to develop it so, in time, she can open her own store for selling clothes. To be able to do so, Maha has applied for a loan to add more fashionable clothes to her collection and make more space at home for her to grow her business until she has the required amount of money to open her own store.

loans.use: to add more fashionable clothes to her collection and make more space at home for her to grow her business.

loans.name: Nargis' Group

texts.en:
Nargis is a widow. Her husband died a few years ago. She has given birth to six children. Her eldest son works in a vegetable market and the next two are tailors by profession. Her remaining children stay at home. Nargis couldn't educate them due to limited financial resources. 

Nargis has applied for a loan from Kiva's partner, Asasah, to financially assist her second son. He is 24 years old and an expert in men’s clothes sewing. He has good business sense and behaves very professionally with his customers. With the loan, he will buy a new sewing machine which will help him produce quality work in a short period of time. He started this business five years ago and Nargis is confident that an investment will help him improve his business further.

loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine for a tailoring business.

loans.name: Edwin

texts.en:
Edwin lives in the village of Solinog, Calamba Misamis Occidental. He is 23 years old, married and has two school-aged children. For the last three years, he has made a living by providing transportation services and earns about 2,000 PHP a month.

Earlier this year, Edwin joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his life and ability to engage in business. He is applying for his second loan, for 5,000 PHP, to buy tires and accessories. He will to use the additional revenue he earns to improve his business. 

About GDMPC:
GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has seven branches covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fishermen and women and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partners to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to buy tires and accessories for a transportation business.

loans.name: Justus

texts.en:
Justus is 26 years old and single. He operates Neema Bookshop so as to earn a living. He also offers computer services such as printing and photocopy. He runs the business with one employee. He also runs a mobile phone money-transfer business so as to supplement his income.  

He was able to start the business after getting a loan from Faulu Kenya. He is requesting 20,000 KES to buy printing machines, a digital camera and text books.

loans.use: To buy printing machines, a digital camera and text books.

loans.name: Bwanya Plus Group

texts.en:
Victor is a chairman of the community bank named “Bwanya Plus,” which is composed of eight microentrepreneurs united in solidarity to obtain loans from Kiva through the MFI HOPE DRC with the goal of developing their businesses. 

Victor sells timbers at the market located in the eastern area of Kinshasa. He has been in business since 1984. He has acquired solid experience in this area. Currently, through his sales, Victor makes about $50 per week. 

His plans are to use the next loan to purchase some more timbers to resell in order to increase his income and achieve his dream of one day  opening a larger timber facility in his area. 

He is a trustworthy client of the MFI Hope DRC, having six times received and properly repaid loans. 

Victor is 50 years old, married and the father of 12 children whose ages vary between 4 and 22. Nine of them go to school.

loans.use: to purchase more timbers to resell at profit.

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John has been in the shoe-making and shoe-repair business for four years, and he earns a profit of KES 5,000 per month. 

He is 47 years old and married to Pricilla, and they have two children. 

His business is in Dandora, which is very highly populated area, and he is just few kilometers from city center.

He was introduced to KADET Ltd. by a KADET staff member and he is borrowing his first loan from KADET. He plans to use it to buy raw materials like thread and unprocessed leather for making shoes. The anticipated profits will be re-invested into the business.

He desires to grow his business and offer his children the best education.

loans.use: To buy  raw materials like thread and unprocessed leather for making shoes.

loans.name: Pau

texts.en:
For three years Paul has been running a barber shop as a primary business, and he also sells shoes as a secondary business in Mathere North, Nairobi. 

He is 21 years old, single and very hardworking. He earns a profit of KES. 8,000 per month.

He learned about KADET Ltd. through a friend, and he is applying for his first loan of KES 20,000, with which he plans to buy more stock of shoes for sale.

In the future, he hopes to grow his businesses and become a prominent businessman.

loans.use: To buy more stock of shoes for resale.

loans.name: Kaze Ii Group

texts.fr:
Faustin est un commerçant âgé de 54ans qui habite au chef lieu de la Province de Ruyigi située à l’Est du Burundi. Il  fait le commerce de chèvres depuis 15 ans et il est en même temps cultivateur. Il est marié a Léa  elle-même cultivatrice et ont ensemble 3 enfants qui étudient. Il a fait ses études jusqu’en 6e année primaire. 

Il demande le crédit Kiva pour  augmenter son capital pour acheter de grandes quantités de chèvres a revendre afin de réaliser de grands bénéfices. Cette activite lui permet d’assurer les besoins élémentaires familiaux et la scolarité de ses enfants. 
 
Elle est membre  du groupe  communautaire« Kaze II».
texts.en:
Faustin is a 54 year-old merchant residing in the regional capital of the Ruyigi district, in eastern Burundi. He has been trading goats for 15 years, while also being a farmer. He is married to Lea Nizigiyimana, herself a farmer, and they have three children together, who are students. He went to school up to the sixth grade of primary school.

He is requesting a Kiva loan to increase his capital in order to purchase great numbers of goats for resale, so that he can make a large profit. This activity makes it possible for him to provide for his family's basic needs and his children's school expenses.

He is a member of the "Kaze II" community group.

loans.use: to increase his capital to buy numerous goats for resale in order to make a large profit.

loans.name: Kiyal's Group

texts.en:
Kiyal is the leader of this group. She is 28 and divorced. She is bringing up a son who is 7 and who studies at school. 

Kiyal is engaged in cultivating agricultural products. Seven years ago, with an initial investment of 10 000 KGS, she started to grow strawberries. Selling the strawberries, she earns approximately 40,000 soms during the summer season. This profit made it possible for her to purchase a fridge, a vacuum cleaner and a gas stove. These household appliances helped Kiyal to improve her living conditions. 

With money received from the loan, she wants to purchase more strawberries in the local villages and then resell them in the city at the higher price. 

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---
This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line: people (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only microfinance institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase strawberries for resale.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is 39 years old and the single mother of two children. 

She has practiced farming in Ndunyu Njeru town for the last 10 years.    

She was introduced to KADET Ltd. by one of her friends, and this will be her first loan.

She plans to use the loan amount to open a retail shop. She will start by buying basic consumer goods like flour, rice and cooking fat in bulk for resale. 

In the future, Jane hopes that her retail shop will grow to a wholesale shop.

loans.use: To open a retail shop.

loans.name: Ochirsukh

texts.en:
Ochirsukh is a 23-year-old man who lives with his girlfriend in his parents' neighborhood in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia.  He lives in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent. His parents are pensioners and he looks after them. His business income is the main source of his family's living.

Ochirsukh likes photography and runs a photo studio. He was doing it while studying at Science and Technology Institute. He has graduated Institute as a bachelor of IT, but he is still running his photo studio. 

He is planning to do some improvements to his studio, to buy a new photo printer and recruit his girlfriend as his assistant. The loan Ochirsukh is taking will be used to buy a new photo printer and to do some face lift to his photo studio.

loans.use: To buy a new photo printer and to do some face lift to his photo studio to attract more clients.

loans.name: Naseem's Group

texts.en:
A caring & supportive lady, Naseem supports her family financially with her  clothes-making business. She does this work for her neighboring clients. She is very skillful and receives a good number of orders every month. The earnings she makes help pay the utility bills. 

She has five children, all of whom are enrolled in a local school. Her husband is a plumber and provides sanitation repair services to his customers. 

Naseem has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband, who will use it to buy tools. This will allow him to provide better quality service to his clients and earn more profit. 

He has been operating this business for the past five years and has a good name in his region for the quality of his services. Naseem hopes that after the loan investment, he will be able to expand his business further. 

This is her first loan application to Asasah. She hopes that it will be a profitable experience for her family. 

Note: In the photo, the lady with a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Naseem.

loans.use: To buy tools for a plumbing business

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is 35 years old, married to Lilian, and they have one child. 

John runs a barber shop as his primary business and also sells clothes to customers who are mostly area residents in Mathare estate in Nairobi.

He is applying for his second loan from KADET Ltd., which he plans to use to buy more stock  of clothes for resale. He will use the anticipated profit to improve his family's standard of living.

In the future, he plans to work hard and ensure that his business grows. Eventually he would like to set up a retail shop.

loans.use: To buy more stock of clothes for sale.

loans.name: Tolibjon

texts.ru: Толибчон проживает в городе Куляб. Возраст, 24 года. Женат. Имеет 5 детей. Он живет вместе с родителями. Его жена домохозяйка. Сам он занимается торговлей на рынке. У него имеется магазин, где он продает телевизоры и DVD. Вместе с ним работает его брат. Этим видом деятельности Толибчон занимается 7 лет. Кредит берет для приобретения новых моделей телевизоров.
texts.en: Tolibjon lives in the city of Kulob. He's twenty-four years old, married and has five children. His wife is a stay-at-home mom; they live with his parents. Tolibjon has a store at the market, where has sold TV's and DVD's with his brother for the last seven years. He's requesting a loan to buy new models of TV's.

loans.use: to purchase new television sets

loans.name: Zurab

texts.en:
Zurab, 54, is a farmer from the village of Sakasheti, in the Gori district. He lives with his wife Larissa, their 29-year-old daughter, and their 22-year-old son. 

All the family members are involved in agriculture. In particular, they have nine hectares of agricultural land, where tomato, cabbage, wheat and appletrees are grown. All harvested vegetables are sold to the wholesalers. Also Zurab owns a tractor and truck, which is used in his farm for tilling the land and transportation of vegetables and fertilizers. 

With the requested credit Zurab will purchase fuel for the tractor and fertilizers. All this will be used for tilling and fertilizing the land. Some part of the credit will be paid to the hired workers, which will help the family in cultivation. After the cultivation vegetables will be sown. 

Zurab's family hopes that they will have a good season and will harvest quality vegetables. Part of the income will be reinvested in the farm and the other part will be used for house renovations and the purchase of new furniture.

loans.use: to purchase fuel and fertilizers for tilling and fertilizing the land and to pay agricultural workers

loans.name: Germanita

texts.en:
Germanita is from the village of Talisay, Gingoog City. She is 75 years old. Germanita is married and has one adult child. 

To make a living, Germanita sells ready-to-wear clothing, detergents and shoe products. Germanita has been engaged in her business for over 15 years and earns approximately 12,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Germanita joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. Germanita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 14,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory and for working capital. 

Germanita is requesting a new loan of 17,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional blouses and t-shirts. This will be the fifth loan taken out by Germanita from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:
HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional blouses and t-shirts for resale.

loans.name: Ganbat

texts.en:
Mr.Ganbat is 33 years old, lives with his wife and son in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. He is a taxi driver. His family live in their own small house in Ulaanbaatar.  In 2005, his family moved to Ulaanbaatar from the province in search of a better life and since then he has been driving a taxi. His wife is unemployed at the moment and she is planning to attend a course to develop and improve her skills and then find a job. His wife planting vegetables on their own land plot at the moment.

The house where Ganbat's family live is very old and cold during the winter. Ganbat is planning to renovate his house while warm season is coming. He is hardworking and handy man. The loan he is requesting will be used to buy necessary building materials to renovate his house by laying insulation materials to floor, walls, and roof, fixing windows and doors, and making the house warmer and well insulated.

loans.use: To buy necessary insulation and building materials to renovate his house by laying insulation materials to floor, walls, and roof, fixing windows and doors, and making the house warmer and well insulated

loans.name: Rosa

texts.en:
Rosa is from the village of Kidahon, Malinao, Gingoog City. She is 46 years old. Rosa is married and has 6 school-aged children. To make a living, Rosa owns and operates a specialized retail store. The main source of income for the business comes from buying and selling coconuts and bananas in the local community. Rosa has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Rosa joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rosa has successfully repaid a previous loan of 11,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory and increase working capital. Rosa is requesting a new loan of 14,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional coconuts and bananas. This loan will be the 4th loan taken out by Rosa from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional coconuts and bananas

loans.name: Janeth

texts.en:
Janeth is from the village of San Isidro, Medina, Misamis Oriental. She is 33 years old. Janeth is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Janeth owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. The main source of income for the business comes from buying and selling canned goods, snack foods, shampoo, soap and beverages in the local community. Janeth has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 7,500 PHP a month for these activities. In the picture is Janeth and her daughter.

In 2010, Janeth joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Janeth has successfully repaid a previous loan of 11,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory and increase working capital. Janeth is requesting a new loan of 14,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products like canned goods and beverages. This loan will be the 4th loan taken out by Janeth from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products like canned goods and beverages

loans.name: Bikorwa Group

texts.fr:
Odette est une commerçante âgée de 36ans qui habite la Commune de Rugombo à l’Ouest du Burundi. Elle  fait le commerce de restaurant depuis 2 ans alors qu’elle faisait le commerce de détail avant de commencer cette activité. Elle est mariée et mère de 4 enfants âgés respectivement de 15ans, 13ans, 7ans et 3ans. Trois sont à l’école. Elle a fait ses études jusqu’en 5e primaire. 
 
Elle demande le crédit Kiva pour  augmenter son capital et agrandir son activité pour réaliser de grands bénéfices. Elle espère que son business va croitre considérablement pour vivre plus aisément et acheter une parcelle pour construire sa propre maison. 

Elle est membre  du groupe  Communautaire« Bikorwa».
texts.en:
Odette is a 36-year-old merchant residing in the township of Rugombo in western Burundi. She has been in the restaurant trade for two years, and was in retail before starting this activity. She is married and a mother of four: her kids are respectively 15, 13, 7 and 3 years old. Three of them attend school. Her own education went up to the fifth grade of primary school.

She is requesting a Kiva loan to increase her capital and extend her activity to make large profits. She hopes for her business to grow considerably, so that she can live more easily and purchase a lot on which to build her own house.

She is a member of the "Bikorwa" community group.

loans.use: to increase his capital and make a large profit.

loans.name: Erian

texts.en:
Erian is from the village of Malibud, Gingoog City. She is 29 years old. Erian is single. To make a living, Erian owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. The main source of income for the business comes from buying and selling canned goods, snack foods, beverages, shampoo, soap, candies and biscuits in the local community. Erian has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 8,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Erian joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Erian has successfully repaid a previous loan of 14,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory and increase working capital. Erian is requesting a new loan of 17,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional canned goods, snack foods and beverages. This loan will be the 5th loan taken out by Erian from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional canned goods, snack foods and beverages

loans.name: Ismoil

texts.ru: Исмоил проживает в районе Восе. Ему 40 лет. Он женат. У него четверо детей. Он занимается торговлей на рынке. Имеет торговую точку, где продает мужскую одежду (футболки, рубашки, брюки). Этим видом деятельности занимается шесть лет. Кредит берет для покупки летних брюк и футболок.
texts.en: Ismoil lives in the Vose region. He's forty years old, married and has four children. He's a salesman at the market. He has an outlet where he sells men's clothes, such as: T-shirts, pants, jackets, etc. He's been doing this for the last six years and is asking a loan in order to buy some summer pants and T-shirts.

loans.use: to buy summer pants and T-shirts

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is from the village of Pahindong, Medina, Misamis Oriental. She is 45 years old. Teresita is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Teresita owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. The main source of income for the business comes from buying and selling canned goods, snack foods, beverages, shampoo, soap and biscuits in the local community. Teresita has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Teresita joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Teresita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 11,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory and increase working capital. Teresita is requesting a new loan of 14,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products like canned goods, beverages and snack foods. This loan will be the 4th loan taken out by Teresita from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products like canned goods, beverages and snack foods

loans.name: Asteria

texts.en:
Asteria is from the village of Tup-on, Gingoog City. She is 57 years old. Asteria is married and has 8 adult-aged children. To make a living, Asteria owns and operates a specialized retail store. The main source of income for the business comes from buying and selling coconuts for copras in the local community. Asteria has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 9,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Asteria joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Asteria has successfully repaid a previous loan of 11,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory and increase working capital. Asteria is requesting a new loan of 14,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional coconuts for copras, as well as charcoal. This loan will be the 4th loan taken out by Asteria from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional coconuts and charcoal

loans.name: Jesus

texts.en:
Jesus is from the village of Sta. Ines, Talisayan, Misamis Oriental. He is 57 years old. Jesus is married and has 7 adult-aged children. To make a living, Jesus owns and operates a tailoring business. The main source of income for the business comes from providing general  alteration and tailoring services to local community members. Jesus has been engaged in his business for over 16 years and earns approximately 12,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 1995, Jesus joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jesus has successfully repaid a previous loan of 13,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional tailoring equipment, such as needles and threads. Jesus is requesting a new loan of 14,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional fabrics and materials. This loan will be the 4th loan taken out by Jesus from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand his business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional fabrics and materials

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia is from the village of South Poblacion, Medina, Misamis Oriental. She is 53 years old, married, and has two adult children. To make a living, Lydia owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from buying and selling canned goods, snack foods, detergents, shampoo, soap, and beverages in the local community. Lydia has been engaged in her business for over eight years and earns approximately 12,000 PHP a month.

In 2010, Lydia joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lydia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 14,000 PHP from HSPFI, which was used to to purchase additional inventory and acquire working capital. Lydia is requesting a new loan of 17,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional canned goods, candies, and snack foods. This loan will be Lydia's fifth loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional canned goods, candies, and snack foods

loans.name: Thubelihle Group

texts.en:
Nicholine is 62 years old and widowed. She has 7 children between the ages of 19 and 42 years. She cares for four relative. She runs a retail business in Empangeni in Kwa Zulu Natal, South Africa. In the photo she is pictured raising her right hand.

Nicholine has been in her business for 20 years. She sells red meat and church uniforms. She sells from her home and at flea markets. She says that the main challenges to her business are customers that buy on credit and fail to pay on time. She also faces a challenge of not having enough money to buy inventory.

She requested this loan through Women’s Development Businesses and Kiva. She will us the loan to buy fabrics for church unifroms and red meat to sell. She says that the extra income from this loan will help her improve her business in the long run. She would like to buy a car for her business. In the future, she hopes to see her business grow.

In her comments she adds that WDB has helped her a lot and they must continue helping other.

loans.use: to buy fabrics for church uniform and red meat

loans.name: Simon

texts.en:
Simon is a 59-year-old farmer from the village of Variani in the Gori district. He lives with wife Matiko and his mother. Simon's mother is 88 years old and retired. 

Simon and Matiko earn a living with agricultural activities. They have three milk cows, whose milk is used for cheese production. The cheese is sold to dairy product retailers. 

Also the family owns three hectares of land, where cabbage, tomato and wheat are grown. Harvested vegetables and corn are sold to local wholesalers. Simon has a mini-tractor which is used in his farm. The total average monthly income of the family, including Simon's mother's pension, amounts to 1000 Laris. 

With the credit received from Credo Simon will purchase fertilizer and fuel for the tractor. He will also pay the workers who will help him till and fertilize the land. Simon and Matiko hope that after fertilizing they will get a larger and better quality harvest, which will be sold to the wholesalers for a higher price. 

With the profits received this season Simon plans to purchase a better tractor for his farm. With this tractor he will also work in neighborhood farms and earn extra income. It will positively influence the income of the family. In the future Simon and Matiko plan to renovate their house.

loans.use: to purchase fuel and fertilizer, and to pay for farm labor

loans.name: Trust And Pay Group

texts.en:
Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT), a partner of Kiva.org in Makeni in northern Sierra Leone, is very please to present to you the members of the “Trust and Pay” group. These are small scale entrepreneurs who have come to SMT/Kiva lenders to seek for a loan of SLL 500,000.00 each, in order to invest in their respective businesses. 

Baindu is the leader of this group. Baindu is a 33-year-old, married woman with three children. Two of her children are in primary school and one is in secondary school. Baindu sells bulgur wheat and rice and has been doing this business for many years now. With the help of this loan, Baindu will invest in her business by buying bags of bulgur wheat and bags of rice to add to her business.

loans.use: to buy bags of bulgur wheat and bags of rice to add to her business.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Zenzele Group

texts.en:
Sithembile is a 33-year-old single woman. She has 2 children, 4 and 9 years old. In the photo, she is pictured raising her right hand. 

Sithembile runs a clothing business in Kwa Zulu Natal of Empangeni, in South Africa. She explains that she has been in this business for two years. Her main business challenge is dealing with customers who do not want to pay on time after they purchase clothes on credit. In addition, she does not have a proper shelter from which to sell her goods. She also receives income from the government's child support grant.

Sithembile requested this loan through Women’s Development Businesses (WDB) and Kiva to buy clothes for resale. She says that the loan will help her generate profit and improve life for her and her children. She will use the extra income to help take care of her family. In the future, she sees her business growing. She thanks WDB and Kiva because their loan interest is much less than loan sharks (mashonisa).

loans.use: To buy clothes for resale.

loans.name: Zumratbi

texts.ru: Зумратби проживает в районе Восе. Возраст, 43 года. Замужем, имеет одного ребенка. Образование-среднее. Занимается торговлей на рынке района. Она занимается продажей женской одежды. В основном она продает национальные платья, штаны, платки, и ткани. Кредит берет для покупки тканей и новых видов национальных платьев.
texts.en: Zumratbi lives in Vose. She is 43 years old, married, and has one child. She has a high school education.  She trades in the local market. She sells women’s clothing.  Primarily she sells traditional dresses, trousers, scarves, and fabrics. She is taking out a loan to buy fabrics and new styles of traditional dresses.

loans.use: to buy fabrics and new styles of traditional dresses.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy newer equipment for making cotton candy

loans.name: Joash

texts.en:
Joash is 27 years old, and supports three members of his family. He buys and sells milk in Languse trading centre and has been in the business for a period of one year, earning a monthly income of KES 4,500.

Joash has taken a loan of KES 10,000 from KADET LTD. This is his first term loan and he intends to use the amount to pay the milk suppliers and also to improve his business. The profits will be used to purchase a plot of land and to improve his business.

He hopes to improve the welfare of his family.

loans.use: To pay the milk suppliers.

loans.name: Consolata

texts.en:
Consolata is a 39 year old single lady. She is a mother of three children, aged between five months and six years. She is a very hard working business lady who runs a butcher shop as a primary business. She also offers outside catering services as a secondary business. She earns an income of KES 15,000 per month.

Consolata learned about KADET LTD through a friend and this is her first loan. She plans to use the loan to buy a deep freezer. This will make it possible for her to store the meat for a longer period of time. The profits generated from the proceeds of this loan will be used to improve her family's living standard.

In the future she hopes to expand her business and supply meat in large quantity.

loans.use: to buy a  deep freezer.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is 52 years old and he is married to Alice, a farmer who also contributes to the family income. Joseph is also a farmer and he has been growing pineapples for about 22 years.  He gets an income of about KES.13,000 Kenyan shillings per month.

He is taking out his second loan from KADET after having repaid the previous one successfully. He wants to use the loan to buy more pineapples for sale. 

He hopes to grow cash crops and improve his family's living standards.

loans.use: to use the loan to buy more pineapples for sale.

loans.name: Hala

texts.en:
Hala, 21, is a very ambitious mom who lives with her two kids and her husband Rami who is a carpenter in Al Zarqa. 

Hala turned a part of her house into a small grocery store three years ago. Most of her neighbors comes to buy from her since she is the closest to them, and she has been providing them with the products they need. She uses kindness in dealing with her customers. 

Hala has applied for a loan to buy more products that people are asking for, so she can get the profit she needs to open a bigger grocery store outside her house.

loans.use: To buy more products that people are asking for

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria is 66 years old, she has practiced farming in Ndunyu Njeru town for the last 30 years.  

She was introduced to KADET by one of our field officers and this will be her first loan. She plans to use the loan amount to buy seeds and fertilizer and pay for labor. She normally sells her produce at the local market

In future, Maria hopes to practice farming on a larger scale and become a leading farmer in the Ndunyu Njeru area.

loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Marsel

texts.en:
Marsel was born in Ljevan City in 1982. He is married and has a five year old son and a two year old daughter. His wife stays at home and takes care of their children.  

Since 2000 Marsel has been running his own business. He produces shoes in his home’s basement and sells them in the Ljevan market and distributes his shoes to other businessmen. Also Marsel takes orders for shoes production. He sells ready-made shoes from a rented stall in the Ljevan market. Marsel purchases materials and domestically produced shoes from Yerevan.  

Thanks to his business profit Marsel has able to keep his young family and he bought necessary furniture for his home. This is Marsel’s 5th loan from Nor Horizon and now he is asking for a 750.000 AMD loan to buy shoes assortment to resell and to buy materials (leather, shoe soles, etc.) for his shoes production.

loans.use: To buy shoe assortments to resell and to buy materials (leather, shoe soles, etc.) for his shoes production.

loans.name: Siham

texts.en:
Siham is 41 years old. She has been married for 10 years now and has four kids. She started sewing and tailoring clothes and curtains at home two years ago to support her husband and the family's financiA. situation. During these two years, Siham has managed to gain a good number of customers. Now, Siham has applied for a loan to buy another tailoring machine to help increase her productivity and enable her to serve her customers on time. 

Since Siham is a conservative person, her husband agreed to be in the photo instead of her.

loans.use: to buy another sewing machine.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en: Jane sells groundnuts, beans, and onions. She is 45 years old, married, and has four children, although none of them go to school. Jane is borrowing a loan to stock more groundnuts, beans, and onions to sell. She hopes to expand her business in the future with the extra profits.

loans.use: Stock more groundnuts, beans and onions to sell.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en: Rose sells sugar, cooking oil, rice, and fish. She is 46 years old, married, and with two children. One of the children goes to school. Rose is borrowing a loan to stock more sugar, cooking oil, rice, and fish to sell. She hopes to expand her business in the future with the extra profits.

loans.use: stock more sugar, cooking oil, rice, and fish to sell.

loans.name: Balimaya Group

texts.fr:
