Composé de cinq femmes, les membres du groupe BALIMAYA sont tous des femmes mariées  qui  vivent majoritairement dans des familles polygames avec leurs maris, co-épouses, frères, sœurs, et enfants. Elles ont une moyenne d’âge de 38 ans et  5 enfants. Ces femmes résident dans la ville de Bougouni, quartier Hèrèmakono – Nord, région de SIKASSO république du Mali. 
Par des relations traditionnelles et de mariages ces clientes se sont connues. Pour consolider leur relation, elles entreprennent des activités génératrices de revenus. Avec l’intention d’augmenter leur chiffre d’affaire et mieux satisfaire les clients, elles ont adhéré à l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso. Elles sont à leur cinquième prêt de groupe, les précédents n’ont pas l’objet de mauvais remboursement. 
La cliente Bassira, présidente du groupe compte acheter avec son nouveau prêt, 5  sacs de 50 kg d’oignons, 100 kg de graine de dah, 150kg de graines de Néré, 100kg de graine d’arachide et une quantité importante de feuilles vertes de baobab très appréciées dans la sauce africaine. Tous les produits sont achetés auprès des fournisseurs des villages environnants de la ville pour être revendus ensuite dans le grand marché de BOUGOUNI, en détail et au comptant à une clientèle composée essentiellement de femmes. Elles comptent obtenir un bénéfice de 25 000 FCFA par mois qui sera utilisé selon elles dans leurs activités.
texts.en: Made up of five women, the Balimaya group members are all women who live, for the most part, in polygamous families with their husbands, co-spouses, brothers, sisters and children.  They are 38 years old on average and have 5 children.  These women reside in the town of Bougouni, in the Hèrèmakono-North neighborhood, of the Sikasso region of the Republic of Mali.  These clients met one another through traditional relationships and marriages.  In order to consolidate their relationship, they started revenue-making businesses.  With the intention of growing their sales and better satisfying their clients, they joined the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance credit institution.  They are on their fifth group loan, with previous loans not being subject to poor repayment.  The client Bassira, the president of the group. expects to use her new loan to buy 5 bags of 50 kg of onions, 100 kg of dah seeds, 150 kg of Néré seeds, 100 kg of peanut seeds and an important quantity of green baobab leaves, which are valuable in African sauces.  All of the products are bought from suppliers in villages surrounding her town to be resold at the large market of Bougouni, at retail and for cash to a customer base essentially made up of women.  They expect to make a profit of 25,000 FCFA per month to be used as they wish in their businesses.

loans.use: to purchase spices.

loans.name: Benkadi Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe BENKADI est composé des femmes mariées qui ont une moyenne d’âge de 34 ans et 4 enfants. Elles vivent dans des familles conjugales traditionnelles élargies avec leurs frères, sœurs, coépouses, enfants et époux. Ces femmes résident dans le quartier Dialanikoro de la ville de BOUGOUNI, (troisième région administrative de la république du Mali).
A travers les relations de commerce et de parenté elles se sont connues. 
Dans l’intention de faire des stocks en traitant avec les grossistes, elles ont décidé d’adhérer à l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso et ont à leur première expérience. Elles comptent utiliser leurs prêts pour faire le commerce de chaussures, de friperies et avec Oumou, le commerce des ustensiles de cuisine
Avec ce prêt Oumou, compte acheter, 5 paires de tasses INOX, 10 douzaines de cuillères, 4 paquets de verre à boire, auprès des fournisseurs de BOUGOUNI. Elle effectue sa vente en détail et en gros, au comptant et à crédit, dans le petit marché de Torakabougou. 
Avec ce prêt Oumou compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 15.000 FCFA  qui sera  réinvesti dans l’activité.
texts.en: The Benkadi group is made up of married women who are 34 years old on average and have 4 children.  They live in large traditional conjugal families with their brothers, sisters, co-spouses, children and spouses.  These women reside in the Dialanikoro neighborhood of the city of Bougouni (3rd administrative region of the Republic of Mali).  They know one another through commercial and parental relations.  With the intention of stocking up through the services of wholesalers, they have decided to join the Soro Yiriwaso micro-finance institution and are on their first loan.  They expect to use their loans to run a  shop selling shoes, frippery, and in Oumou's case, cooking utensils.  With this loan, Oumou expects to buy 5 pairs of INOX cups, 10 dozen spoons, and 4 packages of drinking glasses from the suppliers of Bougouni.  She will make her sales at retail and at wholesale, for cash and for credit, in the small market of Torakabougou.  With this loan, Oumou expects to make a monthly profit of 15,000 FCFA which will be re-invested in her business.

loans.use: to purchase cooking utensils.

loans.name: Tessito Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe est créé le 10 juillet 2002. Il est composé de 07 femmes issues du même quartier. Leur activité principale est le petit commerce.

Madame KHADY qui est à gauche de la photo levant la main est responsable de groupe. Elle est âgée de 36 ans. elle est Mariée et mère de quatre enfants et de trois autres qui lui sont confiés par proches.

Elle fait un petit commerce de légumes. Elle a une bonne expérience dans ce domaine d'activité pour avoir pratiquée depuis environs trois ans.

Ce prêt lui permettra de financer son activité de vente de légumes.

Son objectif est de soutenir son mari dans la prise en charge de la famille.
texts.en:
This group was created July 10, 2002. It is composed of seven women who come from the same neighborhood. Their main activity is retail.

Khady, on the left side of the picture with the raised hand, is the group's leader. She is 36 years old. She is married and a mother of four children, with three others who have been left in her care by relatives.

She retails vegetables. She has significant experience in this business, since she has been active in it it for about three years.

This loan will allow her to finance her vegetable retail activity.

Her objective is to support her husband in providing for the family.

loans.use: to purchase vegetables for resale.

loans.name: Benkan Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe BENKAN est composé de cinq femmes toutes mariées ayant une moyenne d’âge de 32 ans et 5 enfants. Elles vivent dans des familles conjugales traditionnelles élargies avec leurs frères, sœurs, coépouses, enfants et époux. Ces femmes résident dans le quartier de Dialanikoro de la ville de BOUGOUNI, (troisième région administrative de la république du Mali). Ces  femmes se sont connues par des relations de commerce, de parenté et de voisinage. 
Dans le souci d’avoir un fonds de roulement et faire des achats au comptant, elles ont décidé d’adhérer à l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso et cela pour faire le commerce d’habits, de chaussures et de poissons fumés avec Dadon. Elles sont à leur premier prêt de groupe avec Soro Yiriwaso. 
Avec ce  prêt Dadon compte acheter, 4 paniers moyens de poisson fumé au grand marché de BOUGOUNI avec les fournisseurs venus de Mopti (cinquième région administrative de la république du Mali), ensuite elle revend  en détail, au comptant et à crédit, dans le marché de Bougouni à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes. 
Avec ce prêt Dadon espère réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 20.000 FCFA  qui sera réutilisé dans leurs activités.
texts.en:
The Benkan group is composed of five married women who average 32 years of age, with five children. They live in traditional extended families, with their brothers, sisters, co-wives, children and husbands.  They live in the Dialanikoro district of the town of Bougouni, the third administrative region of Mali. They know each other through business activities as well as family and neighborhood contacts. 
In order to secure working capital and be able to buy their goods for cash, they have decided to join the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance institution. They sell clothing, shoes, or smoked fish as for example, Dadon does. They  are on their first group loan with Soro Yiriwaso.  

Dadon plans to use her loan to buy four mid-size baskets of smoked fish at the big market of Bougoni, from vendors coming from Mopti (the fifth administrative region of Mali). She later retails for cash and on credit at the Bougoni market, to a customer base composed of both men and women.

Dadon plans to achieve an average monthly income of 20,000 West African Francs, which will be reinvested in her business.

loans.use: to buy smoked fish

loans.name: Danaya Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe DANAYA est composé des femmes mariées qui ont une moyenne d’âge de 34 ans et 4 enfants. Elles vivent dans des familles conjugales traditionnelles élargies avec leurs frères, sœurs, coépouses, enfants et époux. Ces femmes résident dans le quartier Dialanikoro de la ville de BOUGOUNI, (troisième région administrative de la république du Mali).
A travers les relations de commerce et de parenté elles se sont connues. 
Dans l’intention de faire des stocks  et de traiter avec les grossistes, elles ont décidé d’adhérer à l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso et cela pour la première fois. 
Avec ce prêt Diatou  compte acheter, 500Kg de maïs, 400kg de petit mil et 200kg de fonio auprès des fournisseurs des villages environnants de Bougouni. Elle effectue sa vente en détail, au comptant et à crédit, dans le grand marché de Bougouni. 
Avec ce prêt Diatou compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 15.000 FCFA  qui sera réinvesti dans l’activité.
texts.en:
The Danaya group is made up of married women who on average are 34 years old and have 4 children. They live in enlarged traditional married family homes with their brothers, sisters, co-wives, children and husbands. These women live in the Dialanikoro neighbourhood of the town of Bougouni, (the third administrative region of the republic of Mali).
They met through family and business ties.
With the intention of making stock reserves and dealing with wholesalers, they decided to join the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance institution and this for the first time.
With this loan Diatou hopes to buy 500kg of corn, 400kg of pearl millet and 200kg of fonio from the suppliers of the villages surrounding Bougouni.She makes her sales as retail, for cash and credit in the big market in Bougouni.
With this loan Diatou plans to make a monthly profit of 15.000 FCFA which she will re-invest in her business.

loans.use: purchase cereals

loans.name: Djatoyerela Group

texts.fr:
DJATOYERELA est un groupement de quatre femmes toutes mariées ayant en moyenne 30 ans, 2 enfants et vivant dans des familles nucléaires avec leurs époux et enfants  à BOUGOUNI dans le quartier Dialanikoro (troisième région administrative de la république du Mali). 
Les membres du groupe DIATOYERELA se sont connus à travers des liens de  parenté et de voisinage. 
Dans l’idée de trouver un fonds de commerce pour satisfaire leurs clientèles, elles ont décidé d’adhérer au programme de crédit de l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso.  Elles utilisent les prêts pour faire le commerce de céréales, d’articles divers et  avec Djénéba pour faire le commerce d’habillements.  Elles sont à leurs cinquièmes prêts  et tous les quatre prêts précédents ont été remboursés correctement.
Avec ce nouveau prêt Djénéba compte acheter,  15 complets (pantalons et chemises) pour garçon, 10 douzaines de complets pour enfants et  15 complets pour filles. Elle s’approvisionne à Bamako chez les grossistes et effectue sa vente en détail, à la maison et au marché, en espèce et à crédit à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes.
Avec ce prêt elle espère réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 17 500 FCFA  qu’elle compte réinvesti dans l’activité.
texts.en:
Djatoyerela is a group of four women who are all married, and are on average 30 years old with two children. They live in nuclear families with their husbands and children in Bougoni in the Dialanikoro neighbourhood (third administrative region of the republic of Mali) 
The members of the Diatoyerela group met through family and neighborhood ties.
With the aim of finding a business  to satisfy their customers, they decided to join the Soro Yiriwaso credit programme .They use the loans to conduct trade in cereals and various products and Djénéba sells clothing. This is their fifth loan, the four previous loans were repaid correctly.
With this new loan Djénéba intends to purchase 15 suits (trousers and shirts) for boys, 10 dozen suits for children and 15 suits for girls. She buys her stock at Bamako from wholesalers and sells her merchandise retail, from home or at the market, for cash or credit to a clientele of men and women.
With this loan she hopes to make a monthly profit of 17 500 FCFA which she will reinvest in her business.

loans.use: purchase clothing

loans.name: Kefa

texts.en:
Kefa is a 37-year-old mom; she and her husband Ayed have four children. Kefa wanted to find a way to help her husband support the family, since she decided to stay at home and be a housewife. 

She found a good opportunity five years ago to open a vegetables and fruits store and let her husband work there, and that's what she did. The store is known for its fresh fruits and vegetables and is located in a good area where it can serve a lot of people. 

Now Kefa has applied for a loan to expand the store, and open another store in another area. 

Ayed, her husband, appears in the picture since Kefa is a conservative person.

loans.use: To expand a fruits and vegetables store

loans.name: Seu

texts.en:
Seu is 49 years old and married.  She resides with her three children in Takeo Province, Cambodia.  She produces hand-made brooms, earning an income of $2 per day that helps cover her family's expenses.  Her children also contribute financially, earning $3 each per day.  Since Seu and her children started their businesses, the family's standard of living has improved. 

Seu requests a loan of $500 to purchase a motorbike for her children to commute to work. This is her second loan from Kiva partner CREDIT.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike for her children to commute to work

loans.name: Chanda

texts.en:
Chanda, 22 years old, is married and resides with her child in Takeo Province, Cambodia.  She is employed at a local garment factory, earning $3 per day that helps cover her family's expenses.  Her husband, a construction worker, also helps support the family with an income of $3.50 per day. The family's standard of living has improved since Chanda and her husband have commenced their work. 

Chanda requests a loan of $1000 to purchase a motorbike, which will help her husband operate his business more efficiently. This is her second loan from Kiva partner CREDIT.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike for husband to operate his business more efficiently.

loans.name: Raida

texts.en:
Raida is 30 years old and married, with two children.  Neither of her children go to school.  Raida sells sugar and cooking oil.  

Raida requests a loan to stock more sugar and cooking oil to sell.  She hopes to expand her business in the future with the extra profits.

loans.use: stock more sugar and cooking oil to sell.

loans.name: Sovanara

texts.en:
Sovanara, 35 years old, is married and resides with her three children in Takeo Province, Cambodia.  Sovanara sells food, earning an income of $3 per day that helps cover her family's expenses. Her husband is a musician and rents speakers for parties, earning an income of $3 per day. Their standard of living has been improved since Sovanara and her husband started their businesses. 

Sovanara requests a loan of $500 to purchase musical instruments to start a new business with her musical group.  This loan is her second from Kiva partner CREDIT.

loans.use: to buy musical instruments to start a new business.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary is 30 years old, married, with 4 children and 1 of them goes to school. She sells sugar and cakes. Mary borrowed a loan to stock more sugar and cakes to sell.  She hopes to expand her business in the future with the extra profits.

loans.use: Stock more sugar and cakes to sell.

loans.name: George

texts.en:
George is 45 years old and married to Jane.  They have seven children, all of whom attend school.  He runs a retail shop in Kibwezi County where he sells tires to motor vehicle owners in the area.  He has been involved in this business for nine years and earns KES 15,000 per month. 

George was introduced to Kiva parnter KADET Ltd. by a friend who is a registered member of KADET.  He requests KES 30,000 loan to buy more tires for resale.  This loan will be his first from KADET.

In the future, George plans to grow his business, become a leading tire dealer, and own commercial plot.

loans.use: To purchase more tires for resale.

loans.name: William

texts.es:
William  tiene 36 años de edad, es un hombre trabajador y alegre que vive en el caserío Maravillas (comunidad rural en vías de desarrollo) ubicado en el distrito de Mochumi- Lambayeque.

La actividad que desarrolla William  es el servicio de transporte público. Desde hace 10 años él cuenta con una mototaxi (moto que tiene una cabina, en la parte posterior, donde se pueden transportar pasajeros) desde la cual realiza su labor.

William cuenta con clientela fija en la zona, debido al buen humor que este contagia la competencia que tiene no le  afecta en nada. 

William solicita a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1500 nuevos soles que destinará en la compra de un motor para mejorar el funcionamiento de su unidad vehicular. Esto le permitirá a William seguir haciendo sus recorridos sin mayores problemas y por ende seguir obteniendo ganancias.

William ya ha trabajado con nuestra entidad.
texts.en:
William is 36 years old and is a happy hard working man who lives in the community of Maravillas ( a rural community in the process of development), a district of Mochumi-Lambayeque.

William works in the public transport sector and for more than 10 years he has been relying on a motortaxi ( motorcycle with a cabin in rear that allows passenjer transport), to work.  William can count on reliable clientele in the area due to his contagious sense of humor. The competition he has does not worry him at all.  William is soliciting a loan from  Edpyme Alternativa for 1500 nuevos soles ($550 USD) which would be used towards the puchase of a motor to improve the working condition of his vehicle.  This will help William continue his routes without major problems and therefore continue gaining an income.

William has previously worked with our entity.

loans.use: to purchase a motor

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase silk threads in a variety of colors.

loans.name: Hilario

texts.es:
Hilario es un cliente de 27 años de edad. Es un joven emprendedor y trabajador que vive en casa de sus padres en el distrito de José  Leonardo Ortiz en Lambayeque.

Hilario se dedica a brindar el servicio de mototaxi. Este es un servicio muy popular que se da en las pequeñas comunidades del Perú. La mototaxi es una moto que cuenta con una cabina en la parte trasera donde se pueden transportar pasajeros. Hilario tiene experiencia en esta actividad y es un trabajador bastante conocido en su sector que cuenta con clientela fija.

El dinero que Hilario obtiene de su trabajo, lo reparte entre él y sus padres. Actualmente Hilario y su familia desean mejorar su vivienda  para tener un mayor confort, es por ello que Hilario solicita a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles que le permitirá apoyar a sus padres en las mejoras del hogar.

Él estaría muy agradecido de concedérsele el crédito pues estos arreglos son algo que realmente su familia necesita.
texts.en:
Hilario is a young entrepreneur of 27 years of age. He lives in his parents' home in the district of José Leonardo Ortiz in Lambayeque.

Hilario provides a very popular mototaxi service in the small villages of Peru. The mototaxi is comprised of a motorbike with a cabin attached to the back which can be used to transport passengers. Hilario has a lot of experience in this field. He is quite well known in his community and has a stable client base.

Hilario divides the income he receives from his mototaxi business between himself and his parents. They would like to improve their home to make it more comfortable, which is why Hilario has applied to Edpyme Alternativa for a loan of 1000 nuevos soles which will help him to support his family while they make home improvements. 

Hilario is very grateful for the loan that he has been granted as these home improvements are very much needed by his family.

loans.use: to make home improvements.

loans.name: Mercedes Maritza

texts.es:
Maritza tiene  35 años de edad,  vive con su esposo y dos menores hijos en una comunidad rural en vías de desarrollo del distrito de Tambogrande- Piura.  

La actividad que desarrolla Maritza es la venta de golosinas, gaseosas y comida, esta actividad la realiza desde hace 4 años en su propio domicilio. Cuenta con clientela ya establecida en la zona y Maritza tiene muchos deseos de expandir su negocio.

Maritza solicita a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles que destinará en la compra de mercadería para surtir su bodega, esto le permitirá tener mayores ganancias que podrá ahorrar para, poco a poco, ir expandiendo su negocio, lo cual es su meta.

Maritza ya ha trabajado con nuestra entidad y su anterior crédito lo canceló puntual y responsablemente. Ella goza de buenas referencias personales y crediticias.
texts.en:
Maritza is 35 years of age and lives with her husband and two small children in the developing rural community of Tambogrande in Piura.  

Maritza has sold sweets, soft drinks and food for the last four years in her own home. Maritza has a stable client base in her community and would like to expand her business.

Maritza has applied to Edpyme Alternativa for a loan of 1000 nuevos soles which she will use to buy products to keep her store well stocked. This will allow her to earn a higher income so she can save and bit by bit achieve her goal of expanding her business.

Maritza has already worked with Edpyme Alternativa and she has proven herself to be responsible by paying her previous loan on time. Maritza has good personal and financial references.

loans.use: to purchase sweets and soft drinks.

loans.name: Cindy Jhanetly

texts.es:
Cindy  es una joven trabajadora de 22 años de edad con muchos deseos de superación pues es madre de un bebé de 9 meses al cual le desea dar todas las comodidades que pueda. Ella vive con su hijo y su novio, quien es albañil, en una casa ubicada en el distrito de Mórrope – Lambayeque. La comunidad donde Cindy vive es una zona urbana en vías de desarrollo que cuenta con servicio de energía eléctrica y agua potable.

La actividad que realiza Cindy es la venta de golosinas y bebidas en un pequeño puesto que ha ubicado en la puerta de su domicilio. Ella vende principalmente bebidas gaseosas, néctares, bebidas hidratantes, entre otros.

Con el préstamo que Cindy solicita a Edpyme Alternativa ella podrá surtir su puesto con productos de higiene, útiles, y otros abarrotes como arroz, azúcar y aceite. De esta manera Cindy podrá ofrecer mayor diversidad de productos que satisfagan las necesidades de sus clientes y así crecerá en su actividad. 

El préstamo solicitado es de 1000 nuevos soles. Ella estaría muy agradecida de concedérsele pues le ayudaría a mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia, en especial  la de su bebé.
texts.en:
Cindy is a hard-working, 21 year-old woman who has a great desire to get ahead in life.  She is the mother of a 9 month-old baby who she would like to provide with all the comforts that she can.  She lives with her son and her boyfriend, who is a construction worker, in their home which is located in Mórrope district - Lambayeque.  Cindy lives in a community which is located in a developing urban area which benefits from electricity and piped water.  

Cindy's business activity is selling candies and drinks from a small stall that she has set up by her front door.  She mainly sells sodas, nectars, sports drinks, etc.

Cindy will use the loan that she has requested from Edpyme Alternativa to stock her stall with hygiene products, essentials and groceries such as rice, sugar and oil.  In this way, Cindy will be able to offer a greater variety of products that will satisfy the needs of her customers.  This will enable her to grow in her business.

Cindy has requested a loan for 1,000 Peruvian soles.  She is very grateful for her loan since it will help her to improve her family's quality of life, especially that of her baby.

loans.use: to buy new products for her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy accessories and to have maintenance work carried out on his motorcycle

loans.name: Maria Flor

texts.es:
María tiene 36 años de edad, vive con su esposo y 3 menores hijos en una comunidad rural perteneciente al distrito de Tambogrande – Piura.

María se dedica a la crianza de ganado ovino y  porcino. Actualmente cuenta con 15 ovinos y 10 cerdos que cría y engorda para comercializarlos en el mercado local. María ayuda a su esposo, con las ganancias obtenidas, en los gastos del hogar. Su esposo es agricultor y existe una buena relación familiar.

María solicita a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles que destinará en la compra de alimento balanceado para el engorde de sus ovejas y cerdos. Pues esto le permitirá venderlos a mejores precios y así obtendrá mayores ganancias que le permitirán mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
María is 36 years old.  She lives with her husband and three dependent children in a rural community in Tambogrande district - Piura.  

María raises sheep and pigs.  She currently has 15 sheep and 10 pigs which she raises and fattens in order to sell them in the local market.  María uses the profits from her business to help her husband with their household expenses.  Her husband is a farmer and they have a good family relationship.

María is requesting a loan for 1,000 Peruvian soles from Edpyme Alternativa which she will use to buy balanced feed with which to fatten her sheep and pigs.  This will allow her to sell her animals at a better price and thereby make more profits which will allow her to improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to buy balanced feed for her animals

loans.name: Hermes

texts.es:
Hermes es un cliente de 48 años de edad, vive con su esposa y sus dos menores hijos en una comunidad rural ubicada a 8 Km. Del distrito de Tambogrande –Piura.  El lugar donde vive Hermes no cuenta con los servicios básicos de luz, agua y desagüe y  esto es lo que lo motiva a mejorar su calidad de vida.

Hermes se dedica a la crianza y venta de ganado ovino. Actualmente cuenta con 22 ovejas a la cuales cría hasta tener el tamaño y peso ideal para comercializarlas al mejor precio en el mercado local. Adicionalmente,  Hermes es agricultor. Cuenta con una parcela, herencia de su padre, en la cual siembra mango y limón. Hermes cosecha limón semanalmente y la venta de este le genera buenas ganancias, pues cuenta con clientela establecida en su zona.

Hermes solicita a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles que destinará en la compra de alimento balanceado para su ganado. Así como, en la compra de abonos y fertilizantes para su cultivo de limón. Esto le permitirá mejorar las condiciones de ambas actividades.

Hermes ha trabajado con nuestra entidad y ha cancelado puntualmente sus pagos. Este crédito le sería de gran utilidad y él estaría muy agradecido de concedérselo.
texts.en:
Hermes is a 48 year-old client who lives with his wife and two dependent children in a rural community which is located 8km from Tambogrande district - Piura.  Hermes does not have basic services of electricity, water and sewerage.  This is what motivates him to improve his quality of life.  

Hermes raises and sells sheep.  He currently has 22 sheep which he raises until they reach an ideal size and weight and then sells for the best price possible in the local market.  Hermes is also a farmer.  He has a plot of land, which he inherited from his father, where he grows mangos and lemons.  He harvests his lemons every week and his sales make him good profits as he has an established customer base in his area.

Hermes is requesting a loan for 1,000 Peruvian soles from Edpyme Alternativa which he will use to buy balanced feed for his animals.  He will also buy manures and fertilizers for his lemon crops.  This will allow him to improve both businesses.

Hermes has previously worked with our institution and repaid loans on time.  This loan will be of great use to him and he is very grateful to be receiving it.

loans.use: to buy animal feed and fertilizers for his crops

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “RENOVACION”; La socia vive en el distrito de Huanchac; en la provincia de Cusco,  departamento del Cusco.

La  socia tiene 46 años de edad y La socia es conviviente y tiene 3 hijos; La socia  es comerciante minorista. La socia trabaja vendiendo escabeche en el mercado de San Pedro, la socia vende este riquísimo plato frio hecho a base de pollo cocido con cebollas, zanahorias, arvejas, yuca y en trozos grandes macerados en vinagre y aceite de oliva; este plato se puede comer a toda hora, la socia requiere el crédito en esta ocasión para invertir en la compra de insumos para la elaboración de este riquísimo plato. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de insumos para la elaboración de su escabeche.

La socia valora y agradece infinitamente el crédito que le otorgarán y de este modo podrá  mejorar su calidad de vida, así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo estipulado.
texts.en:
The memberm 46, is a member of the “Renovación” (Renewal) communal bank.  She lives in Huanchac District in Cusco Province and Cusco Department.

She has a spouse and three children.  She is a retailer.  She works selling “escabeche” in the San Pedro market.  She sells this delicious cold dish made from chicken pieces cooked with onions, carrots, peas and manioc soaked in vinegar and olive oil.  This dish can be consumed at any time.  She needs the loan on this occasion to invest in ingredients to prepare this delicious dish.  She requests the loan to buy escabeche making ingredients.

She values and is infinitely grateful for the granted loan which will allow her to improve her quality of life; she also commits to repay in a timely fashion.

loans.use: to buy ingredients to make escabeche.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.es:
Elizabeth es una mujer trabajadora de 47 años de edad. Ella vive junto a sus padres en el distrito de Ferreñafe- Lambayeque, en la zona rural de este. 

Elizabeth se dedica a la comercialización de libros y toda clase de útiles de escritorio, esta actividad la realiza desde de su vivienda. Elizabeth tiene este negocio desde hace 3 años y este le ha permitido desarrollarse personalmente.

Elizabeth solicita a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 2500 nuevos soles para comprar un lote de mercadería, pues los libros que ella vende son de buena calidad y por lo tanto su precio es elevado. Además los útiles de escritorio tienen una gran demanda en su negocio y por ello necesita destinar parte del préstamo en la compra de esta mercadería.

Este préstamo le seré de gran utilidad a Elizabeth, quien es un cliente recurrente y fidelizada  de nuestra entidad.
texts.en:
Elizabeth is a hard working, 47-year-old woman living with her parents in the rural part of Ferreñafe District, Lambayeque.

Elizabeth sells books and all kinds of office supplies at home.  She’s had this business for three years and it has allowed her to develop personally.

Elizabeth is asking Edpyme Alternativa for a 2500 new sol loan to buy one lot of merchandise because the books she sells are of good quality so their price is high.  Besides, the office supplies are in high demand in her business so she needs to devote part of the loan to buy this merchandise.

This loan will be of great use for Elizabeth who is a recurrent, faithful client of our firm.

loans.use: to buy books and office supplies.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy barnyard fowl and nutritionally balanced feed.

loans.name: Carolina

texts.es:
Carolina es una madre soltera D. 29 años D. edad. Ella es una mujer emprendedora que lucha día a día para darles las comodidades necesarias a sus 2 hijos. Esta familia vive en una comunidad rural del distrito D. Olmos en Lambayeque.

La actividad  a la que Carolina se dedica es la venta D. prendas D. vestir. Esta actividad la realiza desD. hace 4 años en su domicilio y recorriendo los alrededores D. su comunidad. Cuenta con clientes fijos que le hacen constantes pedidos y están contentos con el servicio que ella brinda.

Carolina solicita a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito D. 1500 nuevos soles que utilizará para la compra D. prendas D. vestir que le permitirán renovar su mercadería y  cumplir con los pedidos D. su clientela.

Carolina desea realizar mejoras en su hogar y el crédito solicitado le permitirá aumentar sus ventas para realizarlos. Ella es un cliente antiguo para nuestra entidad  y sus créditos los ha cancelado puntualmente.
texts.en:
Carolina, aged 29, is a single mother. She is an enterprising woman who struggles every day to proviD. her two children with all they need. The family lives in a rural community in the district of Olmos in the province of Lambayeque.

Carolina sells clothes. She has carried out this activity for four years so far, both at home and walking from door to door in her neighborhood. She has regular customers with constant demands and they are pleased with the provided service.

Carolina applies for a loan of 1500 new soles from the microfinance institution Edpyme Alternativa, which she will use to buy clothes and renew her inventory in order to satisfy the demand of her customers.

Carolina wants to make improvements in her house. The requested loan will enable her to increase her sales and earn the necessary means. She is a long-standing client of Edpyme Alternativa and has repaid her previous loans on schedule.

loans.use: to buy clothes to renew her inventory.

loans.name: Cinthya Johanna

texts.es:
Cinthia de 30 años, vive en un cantón llamado Playas uno de los lugares turísticos del Ecuador con una diversa dimensión de mariscos. Su esposo trabaja como controlador de bus de transporte intercantonal. Es consultora de comesticos y ventas de bisuterías.

Comenzó hace un tiempo atrás trabajaba con la mama en la venta de comesticos y bisuterías un día ella se caso y decidió abrir su propio negocio con un préstamo que hizo compro ropa para aumentar sus ingresos y complementar mas sus negocio . Actualmente es consultora de comesticos y vende ropa de toda ocasión. Vende sus productos como perfumes y cremas a 25 por unidad, labiales y lociones a 12 por unidad y ropa para damas a 16 por ropa. Con la ayuda del préstamo desea comprar mas productos como perfumes, blusas para mujer, labiales , diferente mercadería para aumentar sus ingresos. Las metas de Cinthia y su esposo es poner un local para la venta de bisutería y comesticos y una pequeña papelería paras tener ingresos para terminar de construir su vivienda y dar la colegiatura de su hija.
texts.en:
Cinthia is 30 years old and lives in a subdivision named Playas which is one of Ecuador's tourist sites with a diverse selection of seafood. Her husband works as an inter-subdivision bus driver. She is a cosmetics consultant and also sells costume jewelry.

She used to work with her mother selling cosmetics and costume jewelry. When she married she decided to open her own business and with a loan she bought clothing to increase her profits and compliment her business. Currently, she is a cosmetics consultant and she sells clothing for all occasions. She sells her products such as lotions and creams for 25 per unit, lipsticks and lotions for 12 per unit and clothing for women at 16 per piece. With the help from this loan she wants to buy more products such as perfumes, women's blouses, lipsticks and different merchandise to increase her income. Cinthia and her husband's goals are to have a store to sell costume jewelry and a small grocery and stationary store so that they can have income to finish building their home and to pay for their daughter's tuition.

loans.use: to purchase perfumes, shirts, blouses, lipsticks and lotions.

loans.name: Baloon Group

texts.en:
M. is in his late 20s, is single with one small child. For the past two years, he has been a fishmonger. He works from 8:00 in the morning until 10:00 at night and is able to earn a fair monthly profit.

This will be M.'s seventh loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. He has used his previous loans to increase his sales, start selling chips, and also to buy a motorcycle. He has successfully repaid all of his loans. 

M. will share this loan with his loan group. The group is called “Baloon” and has 18 members who will hold each other accountable for paying back their loans.

He will use his portion of this group loan to buy more fish and chips to sell. In the future, his dream is to buy a tricycle (bajaji).

loans.use: to buy more fish and chips to sell

loans.name: Sanumaya

texts.en:
Sanumaya is 45 year old and married, with two children who are 16 and 20 years old.  In 2001, she established her grocery business.  She supoorts her family by working seven days a week and 10 hours a day.  

Sanumaya has already received and successfully repaid five loans from Kiva partner Patan BPW.  She will use the current loan to buy grocery goods for her business.  In the future, Sanumaya plans to improve her family's economic condition.  She thanks you for your support.  

About pasal, small groceries in Nepal:

In the Kathmandu Valley, small grocery stores, called pasal, are an important part of the local economy.  Fresh produce, milk, and staples such as rice, lentils, and flour are purchased daily for cooking in the home.  Owners of small grocery stores use Kiva loans to increase their purchasing power and profit margains.  By keeping inventory strong and purchasing in larger amounts, owners of these small stores are able to increase profitability.  While a typical pasal might be no more than 100 sq. feet, they are always full of bargaining customers, incoming produce, and shrewd businesswomen.

loans.use: to buy grocery goods for her shop

loans.name: Jagathmaya

texts.en:
Jagathmaya is 50 years old and married, with three children who are 15, 17 and 19 years old.  In 2000, she established her mushroom farming business.  She supports her family by working seven days a week and four hours a day.  

She has already received and successfully repaid two loans from Kiva partner Patan BPW.  She will use the current loan to buy seeds and fertilizer for her agricultural business.  In the future, Jagathmaya plans to improve her family's economic condition.  She thanks you for your support. 

About Nepali Agriculture:

Over 70% of Nepal's economy is based on agriculture.  Typically, Nepali households grow crops on small plots of terraced land.  Rice (bhat), lentils (daal), and vegetables (thakari) are the staples of the Nepali diet.  With a Kiva loan, BPW's borrowers are able to purchase greater amounts of seed and fertilizer.  With more seeds and fertilizer, a borrower is able to grow cash crops to be sold in the local market.  Such crops allow households to move beyond subsistence and provide much-needed cash income throughout the year.

loans.use: to buys seeds and fertilizer for her mushroom farming business.

loans.name: Cecilia Isabel

texts.es:
Cecilia de 37 años, vive en una zona peri-urbana en el Fortín de Guayaquil, es soltera y tiene dos hijos de 11 y 5 años que estudian en colegios particulares.

Empezó su actividad hace un tiempo atrás como profesora en un escuela y tuvo la oportunidad de poner su propia escuela. Su trabajo lo realiza con 5 profesores y el horario es de 6H00 am a 13H00 pm. Con la ayuda del préstamo quiere adecuar su escuela haciendo mas ampliar para después de un tiempo hacerlo en colegio y aumentar el grupo de alumnados que tienes y así tenerlos mas cerca de ella y que sean unos profesionales.
texts.en:
37-year-old Celia lives in a peri-urban area of el Fortín de Guayaquil. She is single and has two children who are 11 and 5 years old and study in private schools.
She began her business awhile ago as a school teacher and had the opportunity to set up her own school.  She works with 5 teachers, and the schedule is from 5am to 1pm. With the help of the loan she hopes to renovate her school, making it bigger, in order to one day include secondary studies and increase the student population, so that she can keep them closer to her and help them become professionals.

loans.use: to buy construction materials for her school: cement, sand and paint.

loans.name: Ayidokpo Group

texts.fr: Le groupe AYIDOKPO est composé de seize personnes qui habitent la même agglomération et qui exercent la même activité. C'est la première fois que ce groupe sollicite l'aide financier de ALIDé, afin d'élever le niveau de leur activité. Le représentant du groupe, du nom de Véronique est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Véronique est née en 1962 au  Bénin. Véronique est veuve et vit seule avec ses enfants au Bénin. Véronique a quatre enfants tous scolarisés dont deux sont encore à sa charge. Afin de subvenir à ses besoins et à ceux de ses enfants, Véronique vend depuis vingt ans de la tomate fraîche. A côté de cette activité, Véronique vend  aussi de l’huile de palme au Bénin. Véronique s’approvisionne également au Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaire et son revenu, Véronique sollicite  ensemble avec son groupe, un premier crédit.
texts.en:
The AYIDOKPO group consists of sixteen people who live in the same area and practice the same activity. This is their first time seeking financial assistance from ALIDé to bolster their activity. 

The group’s representative is Veronique, seen in the photo with her hand raised. She was born in Benin in 1962. Veronique is a widow who lives alone with her children in Benin. She has four children, all of whom have received schooling. Two are still in her care. 

To support herself and her children, Veronique started selling fresh tomatoes twenty years ago. As a secondary activity, she also sells palm oil in Benin, where she acquires her stock. 

Veronica, together with the other group members, is seeking this first loan to achieve customer satisfaction and increase her profits.

loans.use: to buy cans of palm oil and baskets of fresh tomatoes

loans.name: Celia

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “RENOVACION”; La socia vive en el distrito de Huanchac; en la provincia de Cusco,  departamento del Cusco.

La  socia  Celia, la socia  tiene 38 años de edad y La socia es soltera; La socia  trabaja en una institución religiosa, ella es evangélica y su organización se llama Perú para Cristo, la socia es misionera y también realiza bellos trabajos en costure ría, la socia también sabe de piñatería para fiestas infantiles y todo tipo de manualidades, la socia  según la temporada realiza diversos trabajos, ella ahora requiere el crédito para poder invertir en la compra de materiales de costura, la socia desea comprar hilos, agujas, telas, botones y otros para tener e implementar su costurera. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de materiales.

La socia valora y agradece infinitamente el crédito que le otorgarán y de este modo podrá  mejorar su calidad de vida, así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo estipulado.
texts.en: Celia is a member of the communal bank Renovación. She lives in the district of Huanchac, located in the province and department of Cusco. Celia is 38 years old and single. She is a missionary, working with "Peru for Christ", a protestant religious institution. She also realizes beautiful sewing works and makes piñatas (*) for children's parties and all other kinds of handicraft, depending on the season. Celia applies now for a loan to invest in sewing materials. She wants to buy yarn, needles, fabrics, buttons and other items to keep her sewing business running. She values the granted loan and is infinitely grateful for it. It will improve her quality of life. Celia commits herself to repay the loan according to the agreed schedule. (*) Translator's note: A piñata is a hollow figure made of cardboard or from a clay pot lined with colored paper. Filled with fruit, candy, toys, etc. and hung up at parties, people take turns to stand in front of them blindfolded and try to break them with a stick. (Source: The Oxford Spanish Dictionary)

loans.use: to invest in the purchase of sewing materials.

loans.name: Benkadi Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe BENKADI est composé de femmes toutes mariées ayant une moyenne d’âge de 32 ans et 4 enfants. Elles vivent dans des familles conjugales traditionnelles élargies avec leurs frères, sœurs, coépouses, enfants et époux dans le quartier Torakabougou de la ville de BOUGOUNI, (troisième région administrative de la république du Mali). Ces  femmes se sont connues par des relations de commerce, de parenté et de voisinage. 
Dans le souci d’avoir un fonds de roulement et faire beaucoup d’achats, elles ont décidé d’adhérer à l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso avec qui elles sont à leur deuxième prêt et le premier a été remboursé correctement. Elles comptent utiliser ce prêt pour faire le commerce de savons, d’habits et de mangues avec Korotoumou. 
Avec ce  prêt Korotoumou, la présidente du groupe, compte acheter, 5 sacs de 100 Kg de mangues non mûre et 2 sacs de 100Kg de mangues mûre dans les différentes plantations de mangues de Bougouni et environnants.  
Elle effectue sa vente en ambulant  et au petit marché de Torakabougou, en détail et en gros, au comptant et à crédit, à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes. 
Avec ce prêt Korotoumou espère réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 15.000 FCFA  qui sera réutilisé dans leurs activités.
texts.en:
Benkadi Group ("Harmony") is composed of married women who, on average, are 32 years old and have four children. They live with their siblings, cowives, children and husbands in traditional extended families in Torakabougou, a neighborhood of the city of Bougouni (third administrative region of the Republic of Mali). They came to know each other through ties of business, kinship and neighborhood.

Faced with the need to increase their working capital and boost their activity level, the group members decided to join the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso. This is their second loan, the first one having been repaid on schedule. They will use the loan to trade with soap, clothes and mangoes (the latter is Korotoumou's activity).

Korotoumou, who chairs the group, intends to use this loan to buy 5 sacks of 100 kilograms of unripe mangoes and 2 sacks of 100 kilograms of ripe mangoes from the various mango plantations in Bougouni and in nearby villages. She sells her fruits hawking through the streets and at the little market in Torakabougou, for cash or credit, to a clientele made up of women and men.

Thanks to this loan, Korotoumou expects to make an average profit of 15,000 CFA francs a month, which will be reinvested in her business.

loans.use: to buy fruits.

loans.name: Danaya Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe DANAYA est composé de quatre femmes toutes mariées, ayant une moyenne d’âge de 40 ans et 6 enfants. Elles vivent dans des familles conjugales traditionnelles élargies avec leurs enfants, époux et coépouse. Ces femmes résident à Torakabougou l’un des quartiers de la ville de BOUGOUNI, (troisième région administrative de la république du Mali). Elles se sont connues par des relations de commerce, de parenté et de voisinage. 
Dans le souci de mieux satisfaire leurs clientèles et d’augmenter le niveau de leurs activités, elles ont décidé d’intégrer l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso et cela  pour faire la restauration, le commerce des glacières, des tasses  thermos et le commerce d’arachide avec Adiara. 
Elles sont à leurs deuxièmes prêts de groupe et le prêt précédent a été remboursé correctement. 
Avec ce nouveau prêt Adiara compte acheter, 4 sacs de 100 kg de graines d’arachide. Elle s’approvisionne sur place à BOUGOUNI et auprès paysans des villages environnants pour ensuite faire sa vente en détail, au comptant et à crédit au grand marché de BOUGOUNI à une clientèle composée généralement de femmes.
Avec ce prêt elle espère réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 17 500 FCFA  dont une partie sera utilisée pour rembourser le prêt et le reste sera  réinvesti dans l’activité.
texts.en:
Danaya Group ("Confidence") is composed of four married women who, on average, are 40 years old and have six children. They live with their children, husbands and cowives in traditional extended families in Torakabougou, one of the neighborhoods of the city of Bougouni (third administrative region of the Republic of Mali). They came to know each other through ties of business, kinship and neighborhood.

Faced with the need to increase their working capital and boost their activity level, the group members decided to join the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso and finance their activities in catering and trading with iceboxes, thermos cups and groundnuts (the latter is Adiara's activity). This is their second loan, the first one having been repaid on schedule.

Adiara intends to use this new loan to buy 4 sacks of 100 kilograms of groundnuts in Bougouni and from farmers in nearby villages. She retails the products at the great market in Bougouni, for cash or credit, to a clientele mostly made up of women.

Thanks to this loan, Adiara expects to make an average profit of 17,500 CFA francs a month. She will use it to repay the loan, and any amount left will be reinvested in her business.

loans.use: to buy groundnuts.

loans.name: Maritza Del Socorro

texts.es: Maritza se dedica a la venta de comida. Tiene más de 10 años en este negocio, pues siempre ha demostrado ser una persona responsable. Inicio este medio de vida por la necesidad de sufragar los ingresos de su hogar, ya que siempre le ha gustado trabajar y ganarse la vida de una forma humilde. El motivo del financiamiento es para la compra de granos básicos, verduras, utensilios de cocina, leña entre otras cosas. a pesar de los desafíos que enfrenta como son de salud ya que tiene dolores fuertes de rodillas y esto la deja muy enferma, pero Martiza sabe que tiene que levantarse para poder obtener algo de ganancia para comer y pagar su deuda.
texts.en: Maritza operates a food catering business.  She's owned the business for more than 10 years and it's proof of just how responsible a businesswoman she is.  She started the business because she needed an income to pay her bills.  She likes working and she can pay her own way because she's always lived modestly.  Maritza is applying for a loan so that she can buy supplies--vegetables, cooking utensils, firewood, etc.--for her business.  Although she faces challenges--terrible pain in her knees, for example, that make her sick--she knows that she has to get up every day to work and make the money she needs to live.

loans.use: to buy supplies for her food catering business.

loans.name: Ramita

texts.en:
Ramita is 31 years old and married, with one 5-year-old child.  In 2005, she established  her grocery store business.  She supports her family by working 7 days a week and 10 hours a day.  

Ramita has already received and successfully repaid one loan from Kiva partner Patan BPW.  She will use the current loan to buy grocery goods for her shop.  In the future, Ramita plans to improve her family's economic situation.  She thanks you for your support.  

About pasals, small grocery stores in Nepal:

In the Kathmandu Valley, the small grocery stores, called pasal, are an important part of the local economy.  Fresh produce, milk, and staples such as rice, lentils, and flour are purchased daily for cooking in the home.  Owners of small grocery stores use Kiva loans to increase their purchasing power and profit margains.  By keeping inventory strong and purchasing in larger amounts, owners of these small stores are able to increase profitability.  While a typical pasal might be no more than 100 square feet, they are always full of bargaining customers, incoming produce, and shrewd businesswomen.

loans.use: to buy grocery goods to sell.

loans.name: Faida Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe FAIDA est composé de quatre femmes toutes mariées ayant une moyenne d’âge de 36 ans et 5 enfants. Elles vivent dans des familles conjugales nucléaires avec leurs enfants et époux. Ces femmes résident dans le quartier de Torakabougou de la ville de BOUGOUNI, (troisième région administrative de la république du Mali). Ces  femmes se sont connues par des relations de commerce, de parenté et de voisinage. 
Dans le souci d’avoir un fonds de roulement consistant, elles ont décidé d’adhérer à l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso et cela pour faire le commerce d’habits, de chaussures et de tissus  avec  Awa. 
Elles sont à leurs troisièmes prêts de groupe et les deux précédents ont été remboursés correctement. 
Avec ce  prêt Awa compte acheter, 10 pièces de pagnes de wax et 5 pièces de pagnes REAL de motif différents. Elle s’approvisionne auprès des grossistes de Bamako pour les revendre  en détail, au comptant et à crédit, dans le marché de Bougouni à une clientèle composés de femmes et d’hommes. 
Avec ce prêt Awa espère réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 25.000 FCFA  qui sera réutilisé dans leurs activités.
texts.en:
Faida Group ("Plentiful") is composed of four married women who, on average, are 36 years old and have five children. They live with their children and husbands in nuclear families in Torakabougou, a neighborhood of the city of Bougouni (third administrative region of the Republic of Mali). They came to know each other through ties of business, kinship and neighborhood.

Faced with the need to have sufficient working capital, the group members decided to join the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso and finance their activities of trading with clothes, shoes and fabrics (the latter is Awa’s activity). This is their third loan, the previous two loans having been repaid on schedule.

Awa intends to use this loan to buy 10 units of wax pagnes (colorful African cloth) and 5 units of "Real" pagnes with different patterns from wholesalers in Bamako. She retails her fabrics at the market in Bougouni, for cash or credit, to a clientele made up of women and men.

Thanks to this loan, Awa expects to make an average profit of 25,000 CFA francs a month, which will be reinvested in her business.

loans.use: to buy pagnes.

loans.name: Sabaly Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe SABALY est composé de quatre femmes toutes mariées, ayant une moyenne d’âge de 30 ans et 2 enfants. Elles vivent dans des familles conjugales nucléaires avec leurs enfants et époux. Ces femmes résident dans le quartier Torakabougou de la ville de BOUGOUNI, (troisième région administrative de la république du Mali). Elles se sont connues par des relations de commerce, de parenté et de voisinage. 
Dans le souci de mieux satisfaire leurs clientèles et d’augmenter le niveau de leurs activités, elles ont décidé d’intégrer l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso et cela  pour faire de la restauration et le commerce d’arachide grillée avec Marama 
Elles sont à leur deuxième prêt de groupe et le prêt précédent a été remboursé correctement. 
Avec ce nouveau prêt Marama qui est la présidente du groupe, compte acheter, 4 sacs de 100 kg de graines d’arachides. Elle s’approvisionne sur place à BOUGOUNI et auprès paysans des villages environnants pour ensuite faire sa vente, après la grillade,  en détail, au comptant et à crédit au grand marché de BOUGOUNI à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes.
Avec ce prêt elle espère réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 15 000 FCFA  qui sera intégralement réinvesti dans l’activité.
texts.en:
The group SABALY is composed of four women, all married, who average 30 years of age, and two children each. The women live in nuclear conjugal families, with their children and husband. And they reside in the Torakabougou district of the city of BOUGOUNI (3rd administrative region of the Republic of Mali). They know one another through ties of commerce, kinship, and community. 

Concerned about further satisfying their customers and increasing the level of their businesses, the group members decided to join the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso in order to do commerce in food service and in roasted peanuts, as is the case with Marama. They are on their second group loan. The previous loan was repaid properly.

With this new loan, Marama, who is the group's president, intends to buy four 100-kg sacks of peanuts. She gets her supplies locally in BOUGOUNI from peasant farmers in the surrounding villages. And then she sells the peanuts retail after having roasted them. She accepts cash or credit from a customer base composed of women and men at the main market of BOUGOUNI. With this loan, she hopes to make a monthly profit of 15,000 francs CFA that will all be reinvested in her business.

loans.use: to buy roasted peanuts

loans.name: María Luz

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “RENOVACION”; La socia vive en el distrito de Huanchac; en la provincia de Cusco,  departamento del Cusco.

La  socia  Maria, la socia  tiene 50 años de edad y La socia es separada; La socia  tiene 4 hijos  los cuales ya son independientes, La socia alterna sus actividades del hogar con la administración y atención personal de sus tienda de abarrotes, la socia desea implementar dicha tienda y poder comprar mercadería llamados productos de primera necesidad; arroz, azúcar, fideos, leche, aceite y otros, la socia tiene su tienda desde hace 8 años atrás y le va muy bien, ella desea el crédito para poder comprar los diferentes productos y de este modo implementar su tienda de abarrotes para poder proveer a sus clientes. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de mercadería.

La socia valora y agradece infinitamente el crédito que le otorgarán y de este modo podrá  mejorar su calidad de vida, así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo estipulado.
texts.en:
María Luz is a member of the communal bank Renovación. She lives in the district of Huanchac, located in the province and department of Cusco.

María is 50 years old, separated and the mother of four children who live already on their own. María alternates her activities between household chores and personally attending her grocery store. She wants to stock up her store and buy goods called basic necessities: rice, sugar, noodles, milk, oil, etc. María has had her grocery for eight years and is doing very well. She wants this loan to buy the various needed products, stock up her inventory and be able to meet her customers' needs.

María values the granted loan and is infinitely grateful for it. It will improve her quality of life. She commits herself to repay the loan according to the agreed schedule.

loans.use: to invest in the purchase of staple goods for her grocery store.

loans.name: Sop Sa Jëker Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité Sop Sa Jëker fait partie du Banc villageois de Artillerie 2; il est composé de 16 femmes qui sont parentes et amies qui habitent le même quartier. Il est créé depuis le 28 mars 2008.L'activité principale que mènent les femmes est le petit commerce de divers produits.



Aminata est la responsable de groupe, elle est âgée de 37 ans,mariée et a cinq enfants en charge dont un neveu. Elle mène une activité de vente de bouillie à domicile et a une expérience de plus de dix ans dans ce domaine.Sur la photo elle debout est à l'extrême droite habillée en tenue wax sombre.


Son prêt lui permettra de renforcer son activité de commerce pour réaliser beaucoup de revenus.


Elle souhaite avec ses bénéfices construire une maison pour ses enfants. Les charges familiales sont au compte de son mari.
texts.en:
Solidarity group Sop Sa Jëker belongs to the Artillerie 2 Banc villageois. The group is made up of 16 women who are either related or are friends, and who live in the same neighborhood. The group was set up on March 28, 2008.

The women's main activity is small-scale retail in various products. Aminata is the leader, she is 37 years old, married and responsible for five children, one of whom is a nephew. She has been selling "bouillie" (a type of gruel) from her home and has more than ten years' experience. In the photo, she standing at the far right dressed in a dark wax-cloth dress. The loan will allow her to increase her business in order to make a lot of income. With her profit, she hopes to build a house for her children. Her husband is responsible for the family's expenses.

loans.use: to buy millet to make "bouillie" (a type of gruel) to sell

loans.name: Carmen Maria

texts.es: Carmen Maria es una persona muy responsable, esta es la primera vez que realiza financiamientos. Ella se dedica a brindar el servicio de costura, desde hace más de 20 años, que trabaja en este medio de vida. Dio inicio por cuenta propia desde joven ya que la necesidad mantener a su familia la ha obligado a salir adelante. Este crédito que solicita es para la compra de hilos, telas, zipper, botones, tijeras, aceite para engrasar la maquina ella es una persona que ha sabido satisfacer la demanda de la prendas de vestir que sus clientes le solicitan. Sueña con incrementar su negocio cada día más.
texts.en: Carmen Maria is a very responsible person and this is her first loan. She has been a seamstress for over 20 years. Carmen Maria began her work on her own from a young age since she needed to support her family and it helped her to get ahead. This loan will be used to buy threads, fabrics, zippers, buttons, scissors and oil for the sewing machine. Carmen Maria has been able to meet her customers’ demands for her clothing since they like them. She dreams of increasing her business each day.

loans.use: buy threads, fabrics, zippers, buttons, scissors and oil for the sewing machine.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy electrical appliances for her house

loans.name: Huatajata Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “HUATAJATA” iniciará el ciclo número dos en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Germán Busch.  Está compuesta por nueve integrantes, la asociación comunal está dirigida por una mesa directiva a la cabeza de la señora  Alejandrina.   Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: comercio, producción y servicio 
 
La señora Alejandrina indica que es el segundo año que integra una asociación comunal en Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de una promotora. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de tejido de mantas que viene trabajando hace dos años atrás, negocio que aprendió de amiga.

El crédito que sacará ahora es para el aumento de mercadería (compra de flecos y lana) los que comprarán de la feria 16 de julio (lugar comercial de la ciudad de El Alto) y los venderá en la misma feria los jueves y domingo. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar en lo posible a su familia, pues ella es casada y tiene ocho hijos.

En la fotografía podemos observar que la señora Josefa no aparese, ya que no es permitido por su cultura
texts.en:
The nonprofit “Huatajata” began their second loan with Pro Mujer, as a part of Germán Busch’s focal group. The group is made up of nine members; the communal bank is run by a board headed by Mrs. Alejandrina. The businesses of the members of the communal bank are varied since they are in the sales, production and service sectors.

Mrs. Alejandrina says that this is the second year that she has been a part of the Pro Mujer Communal Bank, as she was invited to join by a promoter. At present, she has worked for two years weaving blankets, a trade that she learned from a friend.

The loan is to increase her merchandize (to buy fringes and wool) which will be bought at the 16th of July fair (a marketplace in the city of El Alto) and will be sold in the same market on Thursdays and Fridays. This work will allow Mrs. Alejandrina to have more income to support her family since she is married and has eight children.

In the picture we can see that Mrs. Josefa is not pictured since it is not allowed by her culture.

loans.use: buy merchandize like fringes and wool.

loans.name: Hounsi Jeannette

texts.fr: Née en 1962 au Bénin, Hounsi Jeannette, est mariée à un Comptable du nom de Michel. Le couple a trois enfants, tous à charges et scolarisés. Hounsi Jeannette et son mari subviennent ensemble aux divers besoins du ménage. Hounsi Jeannette a fréquenté l’école jusqu’au secondaire. Pour faire face aux diverses charges de sa famille, Hounsi Jeannette mène comme activité depuis une vingtaine d’année la vente de bouteilles, de pétrole et des cartes de recharge téléphoniques à son domicile. De façon secondaire, Hounsi Jeannette achète des produits de mercerie qu'elle vend à son domicile. C’est au Bénin et au Nigéria, État voisin du Bénin, que Hounsi Jeannette achète ses produits. En vue d’agrandir son activité et de mieux satisfaire sa clientèle, Hounsi Jeannette sollicite un septième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Hounsi Jeannette a bien remboursé les crédits obtenus  précédemment.
texts.en:
Born in Benin in 1962, Jeannette Hounsi is married to an accountant named Michel. The couple have three dependent children who have all received schooling. Jeannette and her husband handle together the various household responsibilities. 

Jeannette attended school up to the secondary level. To cover family expenses, she started selling bottles, kerosene, and telephone recharge cards from her home about twenty years ago. As a sideline, she buys sewing supplies which she also sells from her home. Jeannette gets her merchandise in Benin and also in Nigeria, a country neighboring Benin. 

Jeannette is seeking a 7th loan from ALIDé to expand her business and better serve her customers. She correctly repaid all previous loans.

loans.use: to buy bottles, cans of kerosene, and telephone recharge cards

loans.name: Motimaya

texts.en:
This is 50 year-old Motimaya. She is married and has 3 children aged 26, 22 and 20. In 2000, she established her tea shop business. Working 7 days a week and 10 hours a day, she supports her family. She has already received, and successfully repaid, 2 loans from Patan BPW. She used her most recent loan to buy food materials for her shop. In the future, Motimaya plans to uplift the economic conditions of her family. She thanks you for your support. 

Whether on the streets of Kathmandu, or in the villages outside of the capital, tea shops are places of business and meeting in Nepal. Called a chiya pasal, these tea shops make a sweet, milky tea that can be purchased for a few cents a cup. With a Kiva loan, BPW's borrowers are able to keep their store shelves stocked while increasing their profit margins by buying in greater volume.

loans.use: to buys food materials

loans.name: Jounx Sellers Group

texts.en:
Meet with members of the “Jounx Sellers” group from Kenema, a city in eastern Sierra Leone. They are all local entrepreneurs who have come to SMT, a partner of Kiva, to apply for a loan of SLL 500,000 for each. With the help of this loan, they will be able to expand their businesses, make more sales and consequently improve on their living conditions. 

Ibrahim is the leader of this group. The 29-year-old is married to a housewife and they have a baby. Ibrahim has been a businessman for 6 years now. He sells shoes. With his share of this loan, he will buy different kinds of shoes, in large quantities, to add to his business.

loans.use: to buy different kinds of shoes, in large quantities, to add to his business.

loans.name: Celestina

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “RENOVACION”; La socia vive en el distrito de Huanchac; en la provincia de Cusco,  departamento del Cusco.

La  socia  Celestina, la socia  tiene 55 años de edad y La socia es casada; La socia  tiene 4 hijos, La socia alterna sus actividades del hogar con la administración y atención personal de sus tienda de abarrotes, la socia desea implementar dicha tienda y poder comprar productos de primera necesidad; arroz, azúcar, fideos, leche, aceite entre otros, la socia tiene su tienda de abarrotes y también se dedica  a la venta de productos de belleza por catalogo, ella trabaja vendiendo a sus amistades  y lleva sus catálogos y ofrece los productos de belleza una vez  que el llegan los pedidos ella los distribuye y al cabo de 2 semanas va a cobrar, los clientes le suelen pagar de a pocos o en dos partes es por eso que ella desea contar con un dinero para pagar en una sola y poder esperar cuando sus clientes le cancelen, la socia desea invertir el préstamo que le otorgaran en la compra de productos de belleza y almacenar para ir vendiendo de a pocos. La socia solicita el préstamo del crédito para invertir en la compra de productos de belleza para la venta.
 
La socia valora y agradece infinitamente el crédito que le otorgarán y de este modo podrá  mejorar su calidad de vida, así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo estipulado.
texts.en:
This member belongs to the communal bank "RENOVACION".  She lives in the district of Huanchac in the province and department of Cusco.

Celestina, 55, is married and has four children.  She alternates her daily activities with managing and attending to her grocery store.  To stock her business she wants to buy basic needs products such as rice, sugar, pasta, milk, and oil, among other items.  She also sells beauty products by catalogue to her friends on a credit basis, collecting payment every two weeks.  Since some of the customers pay a little at a time or in two payments, she needs to have cash to pay for her orders all at once and not have to wait for her customers to pay.  She wants to use the loan to buy beauty products that she will store and sell little by little.  

Celestina is very grateful for the loan which will help her improve her lifestyle, and she is committed to paying it back on time.

loans.use: To buy beauty products.

loans.name: Lobiko Plus Group

texts.en:
Marie-Josée, is the chairwoman of the Community Bank named “Lobiko Plus”, which is composed of 16 microentrepreneurs. These members are united for the same goal: to grow their businesses by loans received from Kiva through IMF HOPE RDC. 

Marie-Josée is 63 years old. Her main activity is to sell pagnes, which are women’s wrapping clothing, in DRCongo. She buys the pagnes in bulk and resells them, at a profit. She sells her products daily at the market in his area, located north-east of Kinshasa. 

Marie Josée started her business in 1991. She is a trustworthy client of the MFI HOPE RDC, having five times obtained and correctly repaid loans. Her next loan will allow her to buy 25 pagnes, to increase her sales, in order to make a better profit. Marie-Josée makes a profit of about US$100 per week. The aim of this loan is mainly to increase Marie Josée's profit so she can buy food and also reinforce her business. She is a widow and the mother of eight children, aged between 23 and 40 years old.

loans.use: to increase the inventory of her business by buying 25 pagnes and reselling them at profit.

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Epifania

texts.es: Epifania tiene 23  años, vive en compañía de su esposo y sus 2 hijos en una casa alquilada. Aprendió las técnicas agrarias y ganaderas desde que era una niña, y esto es agracias a sus padres que le enseñaron esta actividad, hoy se ha convertido en su principal fuente de ingresos. Es así que su labor consiste en alimentar y engordar a los animales vacunos y ovinos para luego venderlos a un precio mayor que cuando lo adquirió. Su esposo es quien la ayuda en este negocio, él se dedica al traslado de los animales hasta la feria ganadera, lugar donde los exhibe para su venta. De las ganancias que percibe lo invierte en la agricultura, puesto que en su pueblo natal tiene sus extensos terrenos para cultivo, por lo que significa otra fuente de ingreso más. Ahora su prioridad es aumentar su capital de trabajo (animales), porque a mayor capital es mejor la ganancia, meta que se ha propuesto alcanzar, por ello necesita de su apoyo para cumplirlos.  Es la segunda vez que tiene un crédito con MFP, por lo que promete ser puntual en sus pagos, además se muestra agradecida por la confianza hacia su persona. Con el crédito solicitado, lo invertirá en la compra de más carneros.
texts.en: Epifania is 23 years old; she lives with her husband and 2 children in a rented home. She has worked in agriculture and cattle raising from a very young age thanks to her parents who taught her and today it serves as her main source of income. Epifania works feeding and fattening her animals, cattle and sheep, to sell them at a higher price than what she paid in the beginning. Her husband helps her in the business; he transports the animals to the cattle dealer market where he shows and sells them. Epifania’s profits will be invested back in agriculture which is why in her native town she has vast plots of land which means she has another source of income. At present, her priority is to increase her work capital (animals) because the more animals that she has, the more earnings she acquires which is Epifania’s goal. This is her second loan with MFP which is why she is committed to make her payments on time, she is also very grateful for the trust given to her. The loan will be used to buy more sheep.

loans.use: buy more sheep.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy raw materials like rice, beans, sugar, corn, bullion powder, oil and sorghum since winter season is coming .

loans.name: Faith Ii Group

texts.en:
Meet with members of the “Faith II” group from Kenema, a city in eastern Sierra Leone. They are all local entrepreneurs who have come to SMT, a partner of Kiva, to apply for a loan of SLL 500,000 for each. With the help of this loan they will be able to expand their businesses, make more sales and consequently improve their living conditions. 

Messie is the leader of this group. The 31-year-old is married to a businessman and they have 4 children. Messie has been a businesswoman for 8 years now. She sells cassava roots. With her share of this loan, she will buy bags of cassava roots in order to expand her business size and quality.

loans.use: to buy bags of cassava roots in order to expand her business size and quality.

loans.name: Consentidas Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “CONSENTIDAS” iniciará el ciclo número uno en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Germán Busch.  Está compuesta por diez integrantes, la asociación comunal está dirigida por una mesa directiva a la cabeza de la señora  Lidia.   Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: comercio, producción y servicio 
 
La señora Lidia indica que hace doce años que integra una asociación comunal en Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de una amiga. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de confección de bayetas que viene trabajando hace doce años, empezando el mismo con el primer préstamo.
 
El crédito que sacará ahora es para comprar tela polar, para la elaboración de sus productos. Este material lo adquirirá de la Plaza La Paz (lugar comercial de la ciudad de El Alto) y lo comercializará en las ferias del deparetamento de La Paz y su mamá lo vende en el departamento de Santa Cruz. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar en lo posible a su familia, pues ella es casada y tiene tres hijos.

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el consultorio y las capacitaciones.
texts.en:
The nonprofit, “The Spoiled Ones” will begin their ninth loan with Pro Mujer as a part of Germán Busch’s focal group. The communal bank is made up of ten members and it is run by a board headed by Mrs. Lidia. The businesses that the members of the bank have are all different as they are in the market, production and service fields.

Mrs. Lidia has been a member of a communal bank with Pro Mujer for over twelve years since she was invited by a friend. At present, she makes baize, work that she has being doing for twelve years and started with her first loan.

The loan that Mrs. Lidia needs will be used to buy polar fleece to make her products. This material will be bought at Plaza La Paz (a marketplace in the city of El Alto) she will sell her items in the markets of the La Paz department and her mother will sell them in the Santa Cruz department. Her job allows her to have enough resources to support her family as much as possible since she is married and has three children.

When asked what she enjoys of Pro Mujer she says that she likes the space and the resources.

loans.use: buy polar fleece.

loans.name: Grissel Janina

texts.es: La Señora Grissel Janina tiene 37 años, su estado civil es casada, esta Señora tiene 2 hijos que viven con ella, sus deseos son de prosperar en el negocio que tiene actualmente ya que este es el que le ha ayudado a salir adelante porque le ha proporcionado que sus hijos puedan estudiar. La actividad económica a la que se dedica es una pulpería, la ubicación de su negocio es en su humilde vivienda, hace más de 15 años, que se dedica a esta actividad. Ella inicia este negocio porque tenía que proporcionarles a sus hijos el alimento diario. El financiamiento es para capital de trabajo destinado para la compra de granos básicos, fósforos, café, golosinas, refrescos, pan, detergentes galletas y sopas.
texts.en: Mrs. Grissel Janina is 37 years old; she is married and has 2 children that live with her. She dreams of getting her business to succeed since it has helped her get ahead and given her children the opportunity to go to school. She has had a convenience store for over 15 years located in her home and Mrs. Grissel began the business to be able to give her children their daily meals. The loan is for work capital, to buy basic grains, matches, coffee, candy, refreshments, bread, detergents, cookies and soups.

loans.use: buy basic grains, matches, coffee, candy, refreshments, bread, detergents, cookies and soups.

loans.name: Happiness Group

texts.en:
In the photo are members of the “HAPPINESS” group. They are small scale businesswomen based in Kenema, a city in eastern Sierra Leone. This is the first loan these entrepreneurs are accessing from SMT/Kiva lenders. With this loan, they will be able to expand their businesses, make more profit and consequently improve their standards of living. 

The leader of this group is Aminata. Aminata is 32 years old. She was born in a place call Blama. Currently, she is residing in Kenema, together with her husband and 3 children. Her husband is a businessman and her children are attending primary and secondary schools, respectively.
