Aminata sells a variety of items locally called “Hausa market” – hair dye, "solfor", “tirro” (used to paint the eyes), “donny” (locally made body cream), etc. She has been a businesswoman for 20 years now. With her share of the loan, Aminata is going to buy Hausa-market-items in bulk to add to her business.

loans.use: to buy Hausa-market-items in bulk to add to her business.

loans.name: Lestter Mauricio

texts.es: El señor Lestter Mauricio tiene 45 años, además tiene 2 hijos y ellos han sido para él la inspiración de su vida. Su trabajo es el brindar el servicio de transporte. Hace 5 años aproximadamente, que se dedica a este negocio y aunque es un oficio cansado, peligroso y agotador, ha sabido desempeñarse excelentemente. Esta vez Lestter solicita un préstamo que le ayude a sufragar gastos en el mejoramiento y mantenimiento de su vehículo e invertir en materia prima para la compra de llantas, focos, caja de cambios y asientos. Su deseo es tener un ingreso y obtener otro negocio.
texts.en: Mr. Lestter Mauricio is 45 years old, he has 2 children and they have been his life’s inspiration. He has worked in transportation for about 5 years and although it is tedious, dangerous and tiring he has known how to work through it excellently. Lestter needs the loan to aid the costs of improving and maintaining his vehicle and invest in raw materials, to buy tires, light bulbs, gear shifts and seats. His dream is to have an income and to have a different business.

loans.use: buy tires, light bulbs, gear shifts and seats.

loans.name: Gem Yalla Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité est créé le 10 juillet 2002. Il est composé de 06 femmes qui habitent dans le même quartier.

Madame FATOU qui est à gauche de la photo levant la main est responsable du groupe. Elle est âgée de 46 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de deux enfants. Elle a aussi en charge quatre autres enfants de ses frères.

Elle mène l'activité de vente et d'achat de divers produits (balais, huile de palme, légumes etc) dans les marché de la ville. Elle capitalise une bonne expérience dans ce domaine pour l'avoir pratiquée depuis plus de cinq.

Ce prêt lui permettra de financer son activité de petit commerce de balais, d'huile de palme, de légumes etc..

Son objectif est d'appuyer son mari dans l'amélioration des conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
The solidarity group was created on July 10, 2002 and is made up of six women who live in the same neighborhood.

Madame Fatou (raising her hand on the left) is the leader of the group. She is 46 years old, married, and the mother of two children. She also takes care of four nephews. She buys and sells various products (brooms, palm oil, vegetables, etc.) at the city market. She has more than five years' experience in this business. 

This loan will allow her to finance her business selling brooms, palm oil, vegetables, etc. Her goal is to help her husband improve the family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy brooms, palm oil, vegetables and other items.

loans.name: Inseparables Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “INSEPARABLES” iniciará el ciclo número uno en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Germán Busch.  Está compuesta por ocho integrantes, la asociación comunal está dirigida por una mesa directiva a la cabeza de la señora  Maribel.   Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: comercio, producción y servicio 
 
La señora Maribel indica que es la primera vez que integra una asociación comunal en Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de una amiga. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de producción de pantalones que viene trabajando hace mucho tiempo, con la compra de máquinas.
 
El crédito que sacará ahora es para comprar tela (para la elaboración de pantalones). Este material lo adquirirá de la ciudad de La Paz  y lo comercializará en las ferias de forma ambulante. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar en lo posible a su familia, pues ella vive en concubinato y tiene dos hijos.
texts.en:
The nonprofit, “The Inseparables,” will begin their first loan with Pro Mujer as a part of Germán Busch’s focal group. The communal bank is made up of eight members and it is run by a board headed by Mrs. Maribel. The businesses that the members of the bank have are all different; they are in the market, production and service fields.

Mrs. Maribel says that this is the first time that she is a part of a communal bank with Pro Mujer as she joined by a friend’s invitation. At present she has a business making pants which she has done for many years when she bought the sewing machines.

Her loan will be used to buy fabric (to make pants) that she will buy in the city of La Paz and will sell the finished product in various markets as a street vendor. This work will allow Mrs. Maribel to make enough to support her family as much as possible since she lives with her partner and has two children.

loans.use: buy fabric.

loans.name: Progressive Group

texts.en:
In the photo are members of the “Progressive” group. They are small scale business people based in Kenema, a city in eastern Sierra Leone. This is the first loan these entrepreneurs are accessing from SMT/Kiva lenders. With this loan, they will be able to expand their businesses, make more profit, and consequently improve their standard of living. 

The leader of this group is Lassana. Lassana is 35 years old; he was born in Blama. He is married to a businesswoman and the couple has two children who are attending primary schools. Lassana sells used clothes and has been managing this business for many years now. With his share of this loan, he is going to buy a bale of used clothes to add to his business.

loans.use: to buy a bale of used clothes to add to his business.

loans.name: Felix Manuel

texts.es: Félix Manuel se dedica a la venta de frutas y verduras, los cuales comercializa en el mercado. Hace más de 21 años que se dedica a esta actividad principalmente para ganarse la vida.  Poco a poco ella fue obteniendo la experiencia necesaria, hasta llegar a tener el negocio que ahora posee. El crédito será invertido en la compra de frutas y verduras, entre lo que se destaca las naranjas, melones, sandias, bananos y repollos   ya que desea comprar ahorita que los precios han estado un poco bajos. Su sueño a corto plazo es invertir más en el negocio de tal forma que brinde mayores ganancias.
texts.en: Félix Manuel has sold fruits and vegetables in the market for over 21 years, work that has helped him earn a living. Little by little he worked to get the experience necessary until he was able to have the business that he now owns. The loan will be used to buy fruits and vegetables, mainly oranges, melons, watermelons, bananas and cabbages since he wants to buy them now as the prices have been low. Félix Manuel’s short term dream is to invest in his business more so that he can have more profits.

loans.use: to buy fruits and vegetables, mainly oranges, melons, watermelons, bananas and cabbages.

loans.name: Nelida

texts.es:
Nélida tiene 23 años, vive con sus 2 hijos y su esposo en una casa alquilada. L. actividad agraria lo aprendió desD. que era una niña, y hace 4 años ha incursionado en L. venta D. animales. Es así que estos animales lo adquiere en una etapa no mayor D. los 6 a 8 mese D. nacidos para su alimentación integral, y así conseguir el peso exacto para su venta. Su esposo es quien L. ayuda mucho en este negocio, pues D. requiere D. esfuerzo para el bien y porvenir D. sus dos pequeños hijos. Al cabo D. un tiempo, son exhibidos éstos animales en L. feria ganadera que se realiza cada fin D. semana. Por otro lado también se dedica al cultivo D. papa y maíz, que luego D. meses están listos para su recolección y venta. Su mayor motivo para continuar en ambas actividades es poder darle lo mejor a sus hijos, por tanto su mayor anhelo es tener su casa propia en L. ciudad. Ante esto espera D. su apoyo económico para poder comprar más animales como un toro y ovejas. Este es su segundo crédito en MFP, pero espera D. su aporte económico para poder concretar sus objetivos. Por otro lado nos manifiesta que el haber trabajado con su grupo comunal le ha permitido aprender sobre invertir y ahorrar su dinero y por ello esta agradecida. 
Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en L. compra D. carneros.
texts.en:
Nélida is 23 years old and lives with her 2 children and husband in a rented house. She learned agriculture since she was a little girl and 4 years ago she started selling animals. Nélida gets animals no older than 6 to 8 months old to feed and gets them to an exact weight to later sell. Her husband helps her a great deal in the business since it requires a lot of work, they work hard for the wellbeing of their two young children. In due course, the animals are shown in a cattle market that takes place every weekend. She also partakes in agriculture, by sowing potatoes and corn, after a few months they are ready to be collected and sold. Nélida’s greatest reason for continuing to work in both fields is to be able to give the best to her children and her biggest wish is to have her own home. She hopes for your financial support to be able to buy more animals like a bull and some sheep. This is Nélida’s second loan with MFP and hopes to have the money to be able to follow through and achieve her goals, she says that working with her communal bank has allowed her to learn more about investing and saving her money and for that she is grateful.

With the loan, Nélida will buy sheep.

loans.use: buy a bull and some sheep.

loans.name: Wologuede Group

texts.fr: Le groupe WOLOGUEDE est composé de douze personnes qui se connaissent de part leur activité et qui habitent la même zone. C'est la première fois que ce groupe sollicite l'aide financier de ALIDé, afin d'élever le niveau de leur activité. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Victoire est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Victoire est née en 1981 au Bénin et est mariée à un certain Emile. Le couple a un  enfant qui est scolarisé et à leur charge. Victoire vit ensemble avec son mari et son enfant. Les diverses charges de la maison sont assurées par le couple. Pour y parvenir, Victoire mène comme activité depuis cinq ans la vente d’oignon. A  côté de cette activité qui lui permet de subvenir à ses besoins et d’assurer les besoins de ses enfants, Victoire vend aussi de l’huile de palme dans une ville du Bénin. Victoire s’approvisionne dans le plus grand marché du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaire et son revenu, Victoire sollicite, ensemble avec son groupe, un premier crédit.
texts.en:
The WOLOGUEDE group consists of twelve people who live in the same area and practice the same activity. This is their first time seeking financial assistance from ALIDé to bolster their activity. 

The group's representative is Victoire, seen in the photo with her hand raised. She was born in Benin in 1981, and she is married to a man named Emile. The couple have one dependent child who attends school. 

Victoire lives with her husband and their child, and the couple handle together the various household responsibilities. To that end, Victoire has been selling onions for five years as a means of earning a living for herself and her family. As a sideline, she also sells palm oil in a city of Benin. Victoire gets her stock at the largest market of Benin. 

Victoire, together with the other group members, is seeking this first loan to achieve customer satisfaction and increase her revenue and profits.

loans.use: to buy bags of onions

loans.name: Deggo Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité est créé le 10 juillet 2002. Il est composé 07 femmes. Elles habitent le même quartier. Leur activité principale et le petit commerce.

Madame YOLLANDE debout à gauche de la photo levant la main est responsable de groupe. Elle est âgée de 48 ans. Elle est Mariée et mère de six enfants. Elle a en charge quatre autres enfants qui lui sont confiés par ses proches.

Elle fait un petit commerce de légumes dans les marchés de la place. Elle a une expérience avérée de ce domaine pour l'avoir exercé depuis plus d'une décennie.

Ce prêt lui permettra de faire la promotion de son activité de vente de légumes 

Son objectif est de subvenir à ses besoins et d'appuyer son mari dans la prise en charge de la famille.
texts.en:
The solidarity group was created on July 10, 2002 and is made up of seven women living in the same neighborhood. Their main business is retail sales.

Madame Yollande (raising her hand on the left) is the leader of the group. She is 48 years old, married, and the mother of six children. She also takes care of four other children who were entrusted to her by friends. 

She does business selling vegetables at the markets in the square. She has more than a decade of experience in this business. This loan will allow her to promote her vegetable-selling business. Her goal is to meet her needs and support her husband in taking care of the family.

loans.use: to buy vegetables to resell.

loans.name: Martha Del Socorro

texts.es: Martha Del Socorro tiene la actividad económica es la venta de mercadería en general. Hace más de 11 años que se dedica a este negocio. Ella tiene 54 años de edad. Ella tiene 3 hijos y trabajan de manera independiente. Su negocio se dio por los deseos de salir adelante con su medio de vida. Ya que tuvo bastante influencia de clientes, y le genero ciertas ganancias y decide invertir un poco más en este negocio. El financiamiento que solicita es para capital de trabajo para la compra de productos como calzado, cosméticos, ropa en general y bolsos Su mayor sueño es ofrecer un buen servicio a sus clientes y proporcionarles mejoras a su vivienda.
texts.en: Martha Del Socorro operates a business selling all kinds of products.  She's operated the business for 11 years.  She is 54 years old and has 3 children.  She works alone.  She started the business because she needed a means to support herself.  She's built a good customer base now, one that generates a steady income, so she's decided to invest a bit in growing the business.  She's applying for a loan so that she can products--footwear, cosmetics, clothing, etc.--that she will resell.  Her goals are to provide a better service for her customers and make improvements to her house.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for her retail business.

loans.name: Women In Action Group

texts.en:
In the photo are members of the “Women in Action” group. They are small scale businesswomen based in Kenema, a city in eastern Sierra Leone. This is the first loan these entrepreneurs are accessing from SMT/Kiva lenders. With this loan, they will be able to expand their businesses, make more profit, and consequently improve their standard of living. 

The leader of this group is Kadiatu. Kadiatu is age 45; she was born in a village call Rotifunk but she is currently residing in Kenema city with her husband and five children. Her husband is a driver and two of her children are attending primary school and three are in secondary school. For 11 years now, Kadiatu has been selling smoked/dried fish. With her share of this loan, she will buy baskets of smoked/dried fish to add to her business.

loans.use: to buy baskets of smoked/dried fish to add to her business.

loans.name: Hippolyte

texts.fr: Né le 13 Août 1971 au Bénin, Hippolyte est marié à Sophie et a trois enfants qui sont tous scolarisés. Le couple assure ensemble les diverses charges de la maison. Hippolyte n’a pas fréquenté l'école. Pour assurer les besoins de sa famille, Hippolyte mène comme activité la vente de produits congelés (poissons, ailerons, etc.) dans sa boutique sise dans son quartier. De façon secondaire, Hippolyte vend divers produits (conserves de tomate, lait, œufs, etc.) dans la même boutique. Hippolyte achète ses produits dans les grandes centres de vente de produits congelés au Bénin. Hippolyte exerce cette activité depuis deux ans déjà. En vue de mieux satisfaire la demande de sa clientèle, Hippolyte sollicite pour la première fois, l'appui financier de ALIDé. Dans l'avenir, Hippolyte désire élargir son champ d’activité par l’ouverture d’une deuxième boutique.
texts.en: Born in Benin on August 13th, 1971, Hippolyte is married to Sophie and a father of three children who all attend school. The couple work together to meet their household’s needs. Hippolyte did not go to school. To cover his family’s expenses, he runs a business selling frozen products (fish, chicken wings, etc.) from his shop, located in his own neighborhood. Hippolyte rounds out his business by selling other various items (canned tomatoes, milk, eggs, etc.) from the same shop. He buys his stock at major frozen goods selling points in Benin. He has been working in this business for two years already. In order to better meet his customers’ demand, Hippolyte is requesting financial support from Alidé for the first time. In the future, he hopes to widen the scope of his business by opening a second shop.

loans.use: to purchase boxes of fish, chicken wings and canned goods

loans.name: Marco Antonio

texts.es:
Marco es un padre de familia de 65 años  de edad, vive con su esposa e hijos en su casa propia que no cuenta con los servicios básicos, su vivienda está ubicada en el caserío de Hualtaco a unos 20 minutos del distrito de Tambogrande, la cual está a unos 40 minutos del departamento de Piura.  Este distrito se caracteriza porque los pobladores desarrollan la actividad agrícola,  ganadería y artesanía.

Marco se dedica  a la agricultura desde hace 15 años, tiene sus propias tierras de cultivo donde  siembra (plantas frutales) mango, limón y maracuya, una vez que lo cosecha lo vende en los diferentes mercados de su distrito y de la ciudad de Piura.  Productos que se consume mucho al diario de todos los pobladores, con los ingresos que obtendrá en la venta de sus productos  podrá mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.

Ha solicitado a Edpyme Alternativa un préstamo de 3000 nuevos soles para la siembra de maíz y la compra de fertilizantes para abonar sus tierras de cultivo y asegurarse de tener una muy buena producción de maíz ya que es nuevo producto que está sembrando y lo que desea es que su negocio siga creciendo como hasta ahora para poder seguir ayudando a su familia y sacar adelante en especial a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Marco, 65, lives with his wife and children in his own house which does not have basic utilities.  It is located in the Hualtaco rural area, about 20 minutes from the district of Tambogrande, 40 minutes from the department of Piura.  The population in this district is mainly involved in agriculture, livestock farming and crafts.

For 15 years Marco has used his own land to grow fruit such as mango, lemon and maracuya.  He sells his produce at the different markets in the district and city of Piura. These fruits are consumed daily by the locals, and he uses the income from his sales to improve his family's lifestyle.

He has requested a loan in the amount of 3,000 PEN through Edpyme Alternativa to plant corn and buy fertilizer for his crop land so he will have a good harvest.  He is planting a new product and wants his business to grow so he can continue providing for his family and helping his children get ahead.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer to improve his corn crop.

loans.name: Felix Juan

texts.es:
Felix es padre de familia de 24 años de edad,  tiene casa propia donde vive con su esposa e hijos,cuenta con servicio de agua y luz, ubicada en el caserío de Yencala Boggiano  que pertenece al departamento de Lambayeque.  Esta zona se dedica a la agricultura, ganadería y comercialización de animales de corral.

Felix se dedica a la crianza y venta de aves de corral (gallinas, patos y  pavos), su corral donde viven sus animales se encuentra en la parte posterior de su casa, los alimenta granos naturales y comidabalanceada.  Posteriormente vende sus animales una vez que hayan llegado a su tamaño y peso ideal en los diferentes mercados de la ciudad de Chiclayo y Lambayeque;  incrementando sus ingresos y obteniendo  cosas que le hacen falta a su familia.  Otra actividad a la que se dedica es a las labores agrícolas.

El crédito que ha solicitado es de 2500 nuevos soles a Edpyme  Alternativa mediante Capital Semilla, será destinado  para la compra de alimentos balanceados para seguir alimentando a sus aves de corral para seguir negociándolo y también para comprar fertilizantes para sus tierras de cultivo,con ambas actividades podrá pagar su préstamo y lo ayudara  a mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.  Felix es una persona trabajadora y muy responsable  que siempre ha sabido salir adelante junto con su familia con la finalidad de seguir mejorando.
texts.en:
Felix, 24, lives with his wife and children in his own house which has running water and electricity.  It is located in the rural area of Yencala boggiano which belongs to the department of Lambayeque.  This area is active mainly in agriculture, livestock farming and small animal sales.

Felix raises and sells hens, ducks and turkeys in a farmyard in back of his house.  He feeds them natural grains and balanced feed.  Once they are fully developed he sells them at the different markets in the cities of Chiclayo and Lambayeque.  This source of income lets him provide for his family.  He also works in other agricultural activities.

He has requested a loan in the amount of 2,500 PEN througy Edpyme Alternativa as seed capital to buy balanced feed for his poultry.  He also wants to buy fertilizer for his cropland.  With both activities he will be able to pay back the loan and improve his family's lifestyle.  Felix is a very hard worker and responsible.  He has always known how to help his family get ahead and lead a better life.

loans.use: To buy balanced animal feed and fertilizer for his cropland.

loans.name: Aliou Sitoe Diatta Group

texts.fr:
le groupe de solidarité  est créé le 19 décembre 2001. Les femmes qui composent se groupe habitent le même quartier. Leur activité principale est le petit commerce.

Madame MAREME est à droite de la photo levant la main et le responsable. Elle est âgée de 58 ans. Elle est Mariée et mère de six enfants. Elle a aussi en charge trois autres enfants confié par ses frères.

Elle s'active dans la vente de tissu teinté. Elle a une très bonne expérience dans ce domaine. Elle pratique cette activité depuis plus de dix ans.

Ce prêt lui permettra de mieux développer son activité afin de participer à l'amélioration des conditions de vie de sa famille et de subvenir à ses besoins
texts.en:
This solidarity group was created on December 19, 2001. The women who make up the group live in the same neighborhood. Their main business is selling various small items. 

Mrs. MAREME, on the right in the photo, raising her hand, is the leader of the group. She is 58, married, and the mother of six children. She is also raising three other children confided to her by her brothers. 

She sells dyed cloth. She has a lot of experience in this field. She has been working in this business for more than 10 years. 

This loan will allow her to develop her business so that she can help improve living conditions for her family and support herself.

loans.use: to buy dyed cloth.

loans.name: Mireya

texts.es: Mireya de 42 años, casada y madre de 3 hijos en las edades de 14 a 20 años, vive  desde hace 25 años, en casa de sus suegros ubicada  en uno de los barrios más populares y alegres de la ciudad, donde la música compartida y el folclor caribe son el escenario propicio de sus habitantes. En este escenario hace 7 años inició su negocio de vender mercancías variadas, experiencia aprendida de su hermana a quien le ayudó durante dos años, cuando no estaba afiliada a empresas que vendían sus productos mediante guías especializadas. Cuando se independizó ya conocía el mercado y la forma de negociar, fue así como ingresó vendiendo mediantes catálogos y llegó a ser coordinadora de equipos de asesores de ventas, donde ha logrado muchos premios por su gestión. Ella comercializa cosméticos, interiores y hasta electrodomésticos menores, ropa y calzado;  con las utilidades obtenidas de este negocio,  Mireya ha logrado apoyar la gestión de su hogar y manejar su propio capital. Sus ventas las realiza a crédito y el dinero no le alcanza muchas veces, para cubrir la demanda de sus clientes que cada día crecen, por eso ella acude a los financiamientos de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo y su credikiva es el tercero, con el cual  comprará medicina natural, productos de belleza y ropa aprovechando los descuentos de productos que en sus manos rotan rápidamente, para poder trasladar los descuentos a las mercancías que vende,  con tal de ofrecerle un buen precio a sus clientes rentables.  Su sueño es tener su casa propia y lograr que sus hijos tengan una educación que les permita ser exitosos en el futuro. Con sus anteriores financiamientos ha fortalecido su negocio y con ello su autonomía y sus buenas relaciones familiares. Mientras Mireya construye su sueños, continua esforzándose por mantener una utilidad no menor del 30% que cada día planea aumentar, mediante un trabajo responsable.
texts.en: Mireya, 42, is married and the mother of 3 children who range in age from 14 to 20.  She has lived in the house of her in in-laws for 25 years.  The house is in one of the liveliest and friendliest neighborhoods of the city where traditional street music frames the everyday life of the inhabitants.  It was there, 7 years ago, that Mireya decided to set up her business selling the kinds of products that her neighbors wanted.  Before that, she helped her sister run a similar business buying products from catalogs and reselling them.  When Mireya struck out on her own, she knew her market and how to run a business.  She sold products that she bought from catalogs and was eventually put in charge of a sales team.  She was a successful leader and received prizes for her management of the team.  She sold cosmetics, decorative products and even small appliances, as well as clothing and footwear.  The earnings from the business have provided her with an independent income.  Mireya normally sells on credit and she can't always stretch her income to cover new orders, so she's applying to Fundacion Mario Santo Domingo for a loan, her third, so that has the working capital she needs to support the business.  She will buy herbal medicines, beauty products and clothing, taking advantage of discounts so that she can pass the savings along to her own customers.  Mireya's goal is to buy a house of her own.  She also wants to provide her children with good educations so that they can be successful in the future.  Prior loans have helped Mireya strengthen her business and become more independent.  She is working hard to reach her goals, working no less than 30% of each day, because that's what it takes to get ahead.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for her retail business.

loans.name: Pabla Petrona

texts.es: Pabla Petrona tiene 45 años, es una mujer luchadora y que le gusta trabajar de manera humilde. Su actividad económica es la venta de cosméticos, hace más de 10 años que inicio con esta actividad con el objetivo de sacar adelante a sus hijos, pues algunas veces no vende muchos productos, pero ella sale de manera ambulante a ofrecerlos. El financiamiento que solicito es para capital de trabajo que será destinado para la compra de polvos, lápiz labial, perfumes, body, cremas y tratamientos. El sueño de Pabla es que sus hijos sigan adelante con este negocio que es su medio de vida.
texts.en: Pabla is a 45-year-old woman who is a fighter and enjoys humble work. She makes a living selling cosmetics, which she started doing more than 10 years ago with the objective to make headway for her children. There were some times she did not sell a lot of products, but she went out to the streets to offer them. She is requesting the loan to purchase powders, lipstick, perfumes, body wash, creams and other treatments. Pabla's dream is for her children to keep moving forward with the business, which is their livelihood.

loans.use: to purchase powders, lipstick, perfumes, body wash, creams and other treatments.

loans.name: Yduvina

texts.es:
Yduvina es una madre de familia de  47 años de edad, vive con su hija en su casa propia la cual cuenta con los servicios de agua y luz, ubicado en el distrito de Pueblo Nuevo  a unos 15 minutos de la provincia de Chepén  y a unas 2 horas de distancia al departamento de La Libertad (Trujillo) .  Estas zonas se caracterizan por su actividad  agrícola, ganadera y turística  que desarrollan sus pobladores.

Ha colocado Yduvinda en la parte de adelante de su casa su tiendad de abarrotes donde vende toda clase de productos para el uso doméstico  (pan, huevos, aceite, leche, atún, lejía, detergente y todo tipo de golosinas, etc), con el negocio que tiene desde hace 4 años en su domicilio trata en lo posible de brindar un mejor nivel de vida para su hija.

Mediante una visita a Edpyme Alternativa trata de adquirir un préstamo de 1500 nuevos soles para abastecer su tienda de más productos y poderles ofrecer a sus clientes con el fin de satisfacer  sus necesidades y de paso incrementar  sus ingresos para su hogar.   Yduvinda es conocida por sus vecinos, por ser una mujer  trabajdora, dispuesta a seguir mejorando en la vida para brindarle lo que desee a su hija.
texts.en:
Yduvina, 47, lives with her daughter in her own house which has running water and electricity.  It is located in Pueblo Nuevo, about 15 minutes from the province of Chepén and two hours from the department of La Libertad (Trujillo).  The local population in these areas is active mainly in agriculture, livetock farming and tourism.

In the front part of her home, Yduvina hs set up a grocery store where she sells all kinds of products for domestic use (bread, eggs, oil, milk, tuna, bleach, detergent and all types of sweets, etc.).  For four years she has been in business trying to provide a better lifestyle for her daughter.

She is requesting a loan in the amount of 1,500 PEN through Edpyme Alternativa to buy products for her store and offer her customers everything they need, in an effort to increase her household income.  Yduvina is known by her neighbors as being a hard-working woman, intent on continuing to improve her lifestyle and giving her daughter all she can.

loans.use: To buy products for her business.

loans.name: Always Faithful Group

texts.en:
In the photo are members of the “Always Faithful” group. They are small scale businesswomen based in Kenema, a city in eastern Sierra Leone. This is the first loan these entrepreneurs are accessing from SMT/Kiva lenders. With this loan, they will be able to expand their businesses, make more profit, and consequently improve their standard of living. 

The leader of this group is Gbassay.  Gbassay is 40 years old; she was born in Bo city, but she is currently residing in Kenema with her three children. Her children are attending primary and secondary schools. Gbassay has been selling fish and palm-oil for many years now. With her share of this loan, she is going to buy the above mentioned items in large quantity to add to her business.

loans.use: to buy fish and palm-oil in large quantity to add to her business.

loans.name: Niakk Jarinu Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité est créé le 10 juillet 2002. Il est composé de 06 femmes habitent dans le même quartier. Elle s'activent dans le petit commerce et ont chacune une étale au marché.

Madame MAMA qui est à gauche de la photo levant la main et le responsable. Elle est âgée de 39 ans. Elle est marié et mère de neuf enfants. Elle a en charge de deux autres enfants confié par ses voisines.

Elle fait de la restauration, spécialement la vente de petit déjeuner au marché. Elle pratique cette activité depuis plusieurs années.

Ce nouveau crédit lui permettra d'acheter assez de condiments pour son activité de vente de petit déjeuné 

Avec les bénéfices générés par son activité elle soutint son mari dans la prise en charge de sa famille tout en renforçant son niveau d'épargne
texts.en:
This solidarity group was formed on July 10, 2002. It is made up of six women who live in the same neighborhood. They are petty traders and each has a stall in the open-air market. 

Mrs. MAMA who is on the left in the photo, raising her hand, is the leader of the group. She is 39, married, and the mother of nine children. She is also raising two other children who were confided to her by neighbor women. 

She sells cooked food, especially breakfasts, at the open-air market. She has been in this business for several years. 

This new loan will allow her to buy enough condiments for her breakfast-selling business. With the profit generated by her business, she helps her husband support their family while also putting more aside in savings.

loans.use: to buy condiments used to prepare breakfasts for sale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase footwear, perfumes, general clothing, handbags, body treatments and sheets.

loans.name: Joel

texts.es:
Joel de 22 años, es soltero, vive con sus hermanos en una casa alquilada que no cuenta con los servicios básicos, ubicada en la zona rural del distrito de Reque que se encuentra a unos 15 minutos de la provincia de Chiclayo.  Zonas que desarrollan la actividad agrícola y ganadería.

Desde hace 3 años Joel y sus hermanos se dedican a las labores agrícolas, alquilan algunos terrenos en la zona donde viven para sembrar verduras y tubérculos para que una vez que lo cosechan puedan ofrecerlos en el mercado Moshoqueque de la ciudad de Chiclayo y con los ingresos que obtegan puedan solventar sus gastos personales.

Al ver que es un buen negocio alque se dedican a creído conveniente solicitar un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 1000 nuevos soles para la compra de fertilizantes para brindar mantenimiento a sus tierras de cultivo en las que sembrará nuevamente para poder seguir teniendo un buen producto para poder ofertarlo a un buen precio y con las ventas poder pagar su crédito y tener una mejor calidad de vida.   Joel es una persona trabajadora, responsable y con muchas ganas deseguir superandose en la vida.
texts.en:
Joel, 22, is single and lives with his brothers in a rented house which does not have basic utilities.  It is located in the rural district of Reque which is 15 minutes from the province of Chiclayo.  The main activities in these areas are agriculture and livestock farming.

For three years Joel and his brothers have been in agriculture, renting land to grow vegetables and tubers to sell at the Moshoqueque Market in the city of Chiclayo.  The income they obtain is to cover their personal expenses.

Seeing that it is a good business, Joel decided to request a loan in the amount of 1,000 PEN through Edpyme Alternativa to buy fertilizer for maintenance of his cropland which he will be planting soon.  He hopes to harvest a good crop and sell it at a good price so he can pay off the loan and lead a better lifestyle.  Joel is very hard-working and responsible, and intent on carving out a better life for himself.

loans.use: To maintain his cropland by buying fertilizer.

loans.name: Sop Coumba Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe est créé le 27 mars 2008, il est composé de 21 femmes qui habitent le même village. Les principales activités que les femmes mènent sont le petit commerce et l'embouche ovine.


Coumba est la responsable du groupe, elle est mariée mère de deux enfants mais a aussi la charge de sa belle-sœur et deux neveux.Elle est habillée en vert debout à droite sur la photo. 

Elle achète les arachides et le niébé dans son village; elle fait la transformation artisanale de l'huile d'arachide et revend ses produits dans les villes voisines. Elle a une expérience de plus de onze ans dans ce domaine.

Avec son prêt elle souhaite acheter des arachides et du niébé en grande quantité pour augmenter ses revenus.

Elle appui son mari et son fils dans les dépenses familiales et renforce son épargne avec les bénéfices réalisés.
texts.en:
This group was created on March 27, 2008 and is composed of 21 women who all live in the same village. Their primary activities are petty trading and raising goats. 

Coumba is the leader of the group. She is married and the mother of two children but is also responsible for her sister-in-law and two nephews. She is wearing green, standing on the right in the photo.  

She buys peanuts and "niébé" (black-eyed peas) in her village. She prepares homemade peanut oil and sells her products in neighboring towns. She has more than 11 years' experience in this field. 

With her loan, she wants to buy large quantities of peanuts and "niébé" so that she can earn more. She helps her husband and her son in supporting the family and will be able to put aside more savings with the profit she hopes to make.

loans.use: to buy "niébé" and peanuts for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase bags of wood coal and baskets of fresh tomatoes and chili peppers.

loans.name: Juan Carlos

texts.es:
Juan Carlos es padre de familia de 25 años, vive en casa de sus suegros con su esposae hijos, la cual cuenta con servicio sólo de luz, ubicada en el distrito de Reque a unos 15 minutos de distrito de provincia de Chiclayo.  Este distrito tiene como actividad  principal la agricultura y ganadería.

Juan Carlos  se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales de corral (cuyes), su corral donde viven sus animales se encuentra en la parte posterior de su casa, los alimenta con alfalfa.  Posteriormente los vende una vez que hayan llegado a su desarrollo óptimo en los diferentes mercados de la ciudad de Chiclayo para poder incrementar sus ingresos y obtener cosas que le hacen falta en su hogar.

El crédito que ha solicitado es de 500 nuevos soles a Edpyme  Alternativa, será destinado  para la compra de otros animales para que crie y después los oferte en el mercado y pueda tener mayores ganancias y poder cubrir sus obligaciones familiares.  Juan Carlos siempre ha sabido salir adelante para mejorar en la vida y darle un poco de comodidades a su familia.
texts.en:
Juan Carlos is a 25 year-old father who lives in his in-laws' home together with his wife and children.  The only service their home has is electricity.  It is located in Reque district, some 15 minutes from Chiclayo province.  The main business activities in this district are farming and livestock raising.

Juan Carlos raises and sells farmyard animals (guinea pigs).  The pen where he keeps his animals is located out the back of his home.  He feeds them alfalfa.  When they have reached an optimum level of development, he sells them in the different markets in the city of Chiclayo so that he can increase his income and obtain things that his household needs.

Juan Carlos has requested a loan for 500 Peruvian soles from Edpyme Alternativa.  He will use this money to buy more animals to raise and then sell in the market so that he can make more profits and cover his family obligations.  Juan Carlos has always known how to get ahead in order to improve in life and provide his family with a few comforts.

loans.use: to buy more animals

loans.name: Dane Dole Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité Dane Dolé a été créé le 05 mai 2010. Il est composé de 20 femmes issues du même village 
Leur activité principale est la vente d'huile d'arachide.

Madame AISSATOU  est la responsable du groupement,elle est âgée de 56 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de 07 enfants.

Son prêt lui permettra d'acheter des graines d'arachides qu'elle va ensuite transformer en huile destiné à la vente.Elle a une bonne expérience de son activité pour l'avoir pratiquée depuis plus de 05 ans.

Son objectif est de subvenir aux besoins de la famille: participer à la gestion quotidienne de la maison,la scolarité et la santé de ses enfants.

En outre elle désire faire de l'embauche bovine après l'hivernage .
texts.en:
The Dane Dolé solidarity group was set up on 5th May 2010. It is made up of twenty women who all come from the same village.

Aissatou, who is in charge of the group, is 56 years old. She is married and mother to seven children.

Her loan will enable her to buy peanut grains which she will then transform into oil for selling. She has good experience in this business, having done it for more than five years. 

Her aim is to provide for her family's needs: to contribute to the daily running of the household and her children's schooling and healthcare.

She would also like to take up beef fattening after the rainy season

loans.use: to buy peanuts for producing oil

loans.name: Jose Walter

texts.es:
José es un cliente de 33  años de edad que tiene un hijo menor que se encuentra en edad escolar. José vive en casa de su padre en la zona rural del distrito de Lambayeque,   cuenta con servicios de agua y luz. El lugar es una comunidad pequeña con un aproximado de 100  familias.

Desde hace 5 años, José, es soldador de metales. Este trabajo le ha permitido brindarle una educación a su hijo y acceder a algunas comodidades. Sin embargo, esta labor no le trae grandes ganancias, pero José se siente positivo y deseoso de superarse. Es por ello que ha decidido invertir en su negocio para poder tener mayores ingresos y crecer en su actividad.

José solicita a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 2500 nuevos soles que le permitirá completar los ahorros con los que cuenta, para comprar una máquina de soldar industrial.

Este préstamo le será de gran ayuda pues su negocio se verá beneficiado importantemente.
texts.en:
José is a 33 year-old client who has one school-age child.  He lives in his father's home in the rural area of Lambayeque district.  His home has piped water and electricity.  It is located in a small community made up of approximately 100 families.

For five years, José has been working as a metal worker.  This work has allowed him to provide his son with an education and enjoy some comforts.  The work does not make big profits but José feels positive and keen to improve himself.  For this reason, he has decided to invest in his business so that he can make more income and grow in his activity.

José is requesting a loan for 2,500 Peruvian soles from Edpyme Alternativa which he will put together with some savings that he has in order to buy an industrial welding machine.

This loan will be very useful to José since his business will benefit a lot.

loans.use: to buy an industrial welding machine

loans.name: Wilder

texts.es: Wilder tiene 27 años, vive con sus padres y sus hermanos en L. propiedad D. sus progenitores. Hace más D. 2 años se dedica al engorD. y venta D. animales, actividad que lo desarrolL. en los espacios del establo D. sus padres. En dicho lugar cuida D. sus animales entre ellos toros y novillos, que son los que más solicitan en el mercado. En ocasiones su padre es quien L. ayuda asesorándolo sobre L. crianza D. éstos animales. Los ingresos que obtiene lo ayuda a enfrentar los gastos que tiene su familia. Le agrada mucho lo que hace, ya que lo afronta con mucho optimismo Con el sin D. salir adelante. Ahora centrará todos sus esfuerzos para incrementar su capital (animales), por ello necesita D. su apoyo para conseguirlo. Es su primer crédito con MFP,  por ello espera D. su aporte económico para concretar sus objetivos. Se siente muy contento D. ser el nuevo integrante D. su grupo y esta agradecido por L. confianza depositada en su persona  y se compromete a ser puntual en sus pagos. Con el crédito que solicitado, lo invertirá en L. compra D. más animales porque tiene suficiente cantidad D. pastizales que es el forraje principal para alimentarlos.
texts.en: Wilder is 27 years old and lives with his parents and siblings on his parent's property.  He has been raising and selling animals for more than 2 years at his parent's stables, there he cares for his animals, amongst them are bulls and cows which are the most in demand at market.  On occasion his father will advise him regarding the care of these animals.  The income he obtains help him deal with his family's expenses.  He enjoys very much what he does and confronts it with much optimism with the means of getting ahead.  Now he will focus all of his efforts on increasing his capital ( animals ), and needs your support to do it.  This is his first loan with MFP, he is awaiting this economic assistance in order to solidify his objectives.  He feels very proud to be the new member of the group and is very thankful for the confidence bestowed on him as a person and is comitted to having punctual payments.  With the loan he solicited, it will be invested in the purchase of more animals since he has sufficient pasture land which is the primary foraging food.

loans.use: to purchase cattle

loans.name: Luis Uriel

texts.es:
Luis tiene 46 años de edad, casado, padre de cuatro hermosos hijos, su negocio es propio, cadete de taxi, siendo el taxi de su propiedad. El cual lleva seis años laborando para el bienestar común de la familia.
El taxi lo compro una parte de ahorros y otra con la liquidación de su trabajo como conductor de la ruta urbana de la capital, pues por ser un trabajo cansado, decide renunciar y optar por su propio negocio.
Su esposa labora como docente, lo que comparten los gastos de alimentación, educación, gastos de pagos básicos. Logrando tener el equilibrio.
Luis como objetivo es la reparación de su taxi el cual no  ha dado mantenimiento debido a que ha tenido pocas ganancias y tiene que cubrir otros gastos. Por tal razón recurre al financiamiento de Afodenic para poder hacer los cambios necesarios como: parabrisas delanteros, dos llantas nuevas, cambio de aceite, afinar motor. Y seguir brindando una carrera en mejores condiciones para el usuario.
texts.en:
Luis is 46 years old, married, and has four beautiful children.  He owns his own business as a taxi driver and owns his own vehicle.  He has been working for six years for the well-being of his family.

Luis bought his taxi with some savings that he had and also the severance pay that he received from his job as a driver on an urban route in the capital.  As this was a tiring job, he decided to resign and start his own business.

Luis' wife works as a teacher and together they jointly cover their family's food, education and basic expenses.

Luis' goal is to repair his taxi.  He hasn't had maintenance work carried out on it because he didn't earn enough and had to cover other expenses.  For this reason, he is requesting a loan from Afodenic so that he can make some necessary repairs and replacements such as: his front windshield, two new tires, oil change, engine tuning.  In this way, he will be able to continue providing a better service to his customers.

loans.use: to have maintenance work carried out on his taxi, buy tires, change the oil, etc. in order to provide a good service

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy balanced feed for her poultry.

loans.name: Bokk Ndeye Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe de solidarité est créé le 31/05/207.Il est composé de 15 femmes qui sont issues du même quartier et partage le même centre d'intérêt : le développement de leur territoire.Leur activité principale est le petit commerce.

Madame Dioncounda est responsable du groupe,elle est divorcée et mère de 05 enfants,elle s'occupe également de sa belle fille.

Elle fait de la transformation et vente de jus de fruits naturel.ELLE pratique cette activité depuis l'an 2000 année de son divorce.

Son prêt lui permettra d'acheter des intrants pour la fabrique de ces jus.

Son objectif est de prendre en charge sa progéniture,payer la scolarité de 3 de ses enfants,augmenter son niveau d'épargne dans le banc villageois.
texts.en:
This solidarity group was created on 31st May 2007. It is made up of 15 women who all come from the same neighborhood and have the same interest: the development of their land. Their main activity is running small trading businesses.

Dioncounda, who is in charge of the group, is divorced and mother to five children; she also takes care of her step-daughter.

She makes and sells natural fruit juices and has been carrying out this business since the year 2000 when she divorced.

Her loan will allow her to buy ingredients for making her juices.

Her aim is to take care of her offspring, pay for the schooling of three of her children and increase her savings in the Banc Villageois.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for the preparation of fruit juice

loans.name: Santos

texts.es:
Santos es una mujer trabajadora de 33 años de edad. Ella vive junto a su esposo y tres menores hijos en el distrito de Chepén – La Libertad. Esta es considerada una familia cariñosa y unida, donde siempre hay apoyo entre sus miembros.

Santos  se dedica desde hace 7 años a la venta de artículos de plástico (recipientes, tinas, cestas, bacines, jarras) en la entrada de un mercado de su localidad. Ella ha tenido ganancias con este oficio y es por ello que desea seguir invirtiendo en él.

Santos ha solicitado a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles que utilizará para comprar su mercadería. Comprará más artículos de plástico así como platos, tazas y vasos de loza. Esto le permitirá tener mayores ventas pues ofrecerá más y mejores productos.

Santos es un cliente de nuestra entidad que goza de un buen historial crediticio, este sería su octavo crédito y los anteriores los canceló puntual y responsablemente.
texts.en:
Santos is a hard working woman who is 33 years old. She lives with her husband and three minor children in the district of Chepén – La Libertad. It is a loving and close family, where there is always support between its members.

For 7 years, Santos has sold plastic items (containers, tubs, basins, jars) in the entrance of the market of her community.  She has had earnings with this tradde and that is why she wants to keep investing in it. 

Santos has asked Edpyme Alternativa a loan for 1000 nuevos soles that she will use to buy merchandise. She will buy more plastic items, such as plates, cups, and ceramic glasses. This will allow her to have more sales and better products. 

Santos is a client of our agency who has a good credit history. This would be her eighth loan and she paid off the others punctually and responsibly.

loans.use: to buy plastic and ceramic merchandise.

loans.name: Yesenia Benita

texts.es: Yesenia Benita vive en su casa con sus 3 hijos juntos se esfuerzan cada día por salir adelante. Desde hace 10 años que tiene este negocio como es la venta de mercadería en general, ya que es una mujer muy emprendedora  y cuando tuvo sus hijos vio una buena oportunidad para establecer este negocio, que tantos logros le ha otorgado. Es onceavo crédito y promete pagar sus cuotas puntualmente, pues no quiere quedar mal con las personas que hicieron posible este aporte que le permitirá continuar trabajando en busca del progreso. Ella tiene planeado invertir el crédito en la compra de mayor cantidad de inventario como toallas, cosméticos, sabanas, ropa en general y calzado al por mayor pues no logra abastecer a sus clientes que le piden mayor variedad. Ya que se acerca la temporada del día de las madres.
texts.en:
Yesenia Benita lives at home with her three children. Together they strive each day to get ahead. For the past 10 years, Yesenia has managed a business selling general merchandise. She is a very enterprising woman. Given her many other achievements, she saw a good opportunity to establish this business when she had her children.

Yesenia is receiving her eleventh loan and promises to submit her payments on time. She does not want to disappoint those who made this loan possible so that she could continue working and making progress. She plans to invest the loan in the purchase of more inventory such as towels, cosmetics, bed sheets, clothing, and shoes in bulk. This will enable her to serve her customers since they request greater variety. In addition, she will have enough merchandise for Mother’s Day.

loans.use: to purchase towels, cosmetics, bed sheets, clothing, and shoes in bulk.

loans.name: Adjeniya 1 Group

texts.fr: ADJENIYA 1 est un groupe constitué de trois personnes et dont la  présidente (celle qui a la main levée sur la photo) se nomme Bénédicte. Les membres du groupe vivent dans le même quartier et pratiquent la même religion. Dans le but d’augmenter leur fonds de roulement, ce groupe sollicite pour la deuxième fois, un crédit auprès de ALIDé. Bénédicte est née en 1975 au Bénin. Bénédicte est mariée à sourou un couturier. Le couple a quatre enfants tous à charge dont trois sont les leurs. Tous les enfants sont scolarisés. Après avoir arrêté l’école au primaire, Bénédicte vend divers produits à son domicile. Parallèlement à cette activité, Bénédicte vend des boissons non alcoolisés. Bénédicte exerce ce métier depuis près de cinq ans, ce qui lui permet ensemble avec son mari , d’assurer les diverses charges de la famille. Bénédicte s’approvisionne dans une ville du Bénin. Ce deuxième prêt permettra certainement à Bénédicte et aux autres membres du groupe ADJENIYA 1 de rehausser le niveau de leur activité et d’accroître leur clientèle et leur revenu.
texts.en: Adjeniya 1 is a group of three people, with a president named Bénédicte (whose hand is raised in the photo).  The group’s members live the same neighborhood and adhere to the same religion.  To increase its working capital, the group is asking for its second loan from Alidé.  Bénédicte was born in Benin in 1975.  She is married to a tailor named Sourou.  The couple is responsible for four children, three of which are their own.  All the children attend school.  Since dropping out of elementary school, Bénédicte has been selling various items out of her home.  Alongside this business, she also sells non-alcoholic beverages.  Bénédicte has been working in this business for five years, enabling her and her husband to cover their family’s expenses.  She buys her supplies in a city in Benin.  This second loan will likely enable Bénédicte and her group to improve their businesses, expand their customer base and increase their income.

loans.use: to purchase beverages and various other products

loans.name: Yadira

texts.es: Yadira es una mujer casada que tiene 3 hijos en las edades D. 25 a 35 años y  3 nietos que están a su cargo, porque su hijo vive en otro país. Yadira tiene una farmacia muy cerca D. un puesto D. salud del barrio y allí se provisionan muchos D. sus clientes que son atendidos en este lugar. Ella mantiene la droguería bien surtida con los medicamentos que más rotan, pues cuenta con una amplia experiencia en esta actividad, ya que varios D. sus familiares, tíos,  hermanos, hijos y primos tienen este mismo negocio y ella construyó su experiencia  desD. hace 20 años, cuando empezó como empleada en una D. las droguerías D. su hermana. Esto le dio la idea D. crear su propio negocio, dando curso libre  a su espíritu D. independencia. Yadira goza D. muy buena clientela y reconocimiento por su efectivo servicio. Su sueño más adelante es ampliar la cobertura D. su negocio y abrir puntos alternos en diversos sitios D. la ciudad; por eso todos los días se esmera por lograr sus metas D. ventas con el fin D. reunir un capital D. trabajo suficiente, para  empezar a cumplir con su sueño. Así mismo a nivel personal desea viajar a la ciudad D. Panamá para tomarse unas vacaciones que bastante le hacen falta, acompañada D. su hijo que allí vive. Mientras construye su sueño maneja una rentabilidad no menor del 30%  y se esmera por incrementarla. Este es el primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo con el cual comprará mercancías para surtir su nueva vitrina, con artículos D. miscelánea que hace poco ha logrado introducir en su farmacia.
texts.en:
Yadira is a married woman who has three children aged 25 to 35 and three grandchildren who she takes care of, because her son lives in another country. Yadira has a pharmacy that is very close to a health center in her neighborhood, and there she supplies many of the clients who are attended to in that place. She maintains a well stocked drugstore with medicine that sells the most, and has ample experience in this activity since various family members, uncles, brothers, sons, and cousins have the same business. She began to construct her experience 20 years ago, when she began as an employee in the drugstore that her sister owned. This gave her the idea of creating her own business, giving free reign to her independent spirit. 

Yadira enjoys very good clients and recognition for her effective service. Her dream is to one day expand her business and open other stores around the city. Because of this, each day she endeavors to reach her selling goals with the hope of compiling enough capital to begin to construct her dream. At the same time, on a personal level she wants to visit Panama City to take a vacation, which she really needs, accompanied by her son who lives there. While she is constructing her dream she maintains no less than a 30% profit margin and endeavors to enlarge it. 

This is the first loan with Fundacion Mario Santo Domingo, with which she will purchase merchandise for her new display case such as miscellaneous articles that she recently introduced into the pharmacy.

loans.use: to purchase new products for her pharmacy

loans.name: Maria Rosa

texts.es:
Rosa es una joven emprendedora de 23 años de edad. Ella vive con su novio y su pequeño hijo en una zona rural del distrito de Piura.

El novio de Rosa se dedica a la agricultura y junto con ella se dividen los gastos del hogar y del niño.

La actividad que desarrolla Rosa es la crianza y  venta de aves de corral (pavos) así como la elaboración de harina de Jora. Ambas actividades las realiza desde hace 7 años desde su domicilio. Rosa cuenta con clientela ya establecida quienes son, principalmente, pobladores de su zona.  

Rosa solicita a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles para mejorar los corrales de sus aves y para comprar maíz y poder tener la materia prima necesaria para la elaboración de su harina. Rosa tiene muchos deseos de mejorar su calidad de vida pues su hogar no cuenta con los servicios básicos de luz, agua y desagüe y esto es lo que la motiva a seguir luchando y esforzándose en sus actividades.
texts.en:
Rosa is a young, 23-year old entrepreneur. She lives with her boyfriend and their young son in a rural region of the district of Piura.

Rosa's boyfriend is an agriculturist and they share their household expenses and their son's expenses.

Rosa's business activity is to raise and sell poultry (turkeys) and she also makes flour for jora (a traditional drink). She has been doing both activities for the past 7 years from her home. Rosa has an already established clientele, primarily composed of the people in her region.

Rosa requests a loan from Edpyme Alternativa (Kiva Field Partner) in the amount of 1000 nuevos soles. She will use it to improve the corral where she keeps her poultry and to purchase corn, to have in stock the ingredients she needs to make her flour. Rosa has many dreams to improve the quality of her life. Her home is not equipped with basic services, such as electricity, water, and sewage services. And this motivates her to keep working and investing her efforts into her businesses.

loans.use: to improve her corrals and to purchase corn to make flour.

loans.name: Las Crisalias Group

texts.es: Este grupo se llama "LAS CRISALIAS" se encuentra ubicado en el Estado de México, las clientas decidieron llevar este nombre ya que a pesar de que ninguna se dedica al cultivo de esta es la principal atracción de la comunidad. Este grupo está integrado por 10 clientas en este grupo se encuentra la señora Alberta quien es integrante del grupo y se dedica a la venta y cultivo de aguacate desde hace más de 25 años, tiene 60 años de edad, soltera, y es el sustento de su familia. Tiene 3 hijos mayores de adad, la señora nos platica que para ella fue un golpe muy duro el abandono de su esposo y el hecho de la gran responsabilidad de sus hijos, ya que dos de ellos aun eran menores de edad, ella decidió contribuir aun mas con la economía de su casa buscando una fuente de trabajo más estable y continuar en la siembra y venta de aguacate con apoyo de su hijo mayor, vende aguacates en diferentes partes de la región y así poder darles una mejor calidad de vida. El prestamo lo invertirá en fertilizantes, abonos y plantas para seguir trabajando al lado de sus hijos, la ilusión que tiene doña Alberta es que sus hijos se formen como hombres de bien y algún día puedan tener una mejor calidad de vida, a pesar que la señora solo cuenta con la educación primaria le gustaría que sus hijos sean profesionistas.
texts.en:
This group is called “Las Crisalias” (The Asters) and is located in the State of Mexico. These clients decided to take this name even though none of them grow these flowers, but they are a main attraction in the community. The group consists of 10 clients. One of the members is Sra. Alberta, who has been growing and selling avocados for more than 25 years. She is 60 years old, single, and the breadwinner of her family. Alberta has three adult children. She says that it was a very difficult situation when her husband abandoned her and she had to take responsibility for her children, two of whom were minors at the time. Even though she decided to contribute more to the household income, she tried to find a more stable source of work. Alberta continued to grow and sells avocados with the help of her oldest son. She sells her product in different parts of the region and is able to provide her family a better quality of life.

This loan will be invested in fertilizers, compost, and plants so that she can continue working alongside her children. Doña Alberta hopes that her sons will become outstanding men who will someday have a better quality of life. Even though she only has an elementary school education, Alberta would like her sons to become professionals.

loans.use: to purchase avocado plants, fertilizers, and compost.

loans.name: Andres Jose

texts.es:
Andrés tiene 44  años de edad,  es un padre de familia que vive junto a su esposa y dos hijos en la zona rural del distrito de Lambayeque, en una comunidad pequeña pero con deseos de superarse.

Andrés desde hace 3 años cuenta con una bodega en el interior de su domicilio. Esta bodega es una de las más surtidas de la zona y por ello tiene gran demanda. 

Andrés se siente satisfecho con su actividad y por ello invierte en ella ya que esto le trae mayores ganancias. Andrés vende toda clase de abarrotes (arroz, harina, azúcar, leche, huevos,  aceite, etc.) así como productos de higiene personal (papel higiénico, pañales, shampoo, etc.) y golosinas.

Andrés solicita a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles que utilizará para la compra de abarrotes para su tienda. Esto le permitirá seguir desarrollando su negocio satisfactoriamente. 

Andrés tiene buenas referencias personales y se le conoce por ser un hombre trabajador y devoto a su familia.
texts.en:
Andres is 44 years old. He is the father of a family and he lives together with his wife and their two children in the rural district of Lambayeque in a small community. But he has dreams of improvement.

Andres has had a grocery store in his house for the past 3 years. This grocery store is has one of the best selections in the region which is why it is in such high demand. 

Andres is satisfied with his activity and for this reason he invests in it to bring in greater earnings. Andres sells all types of groceries (rice, flour, sugar, milk, eggs, cooking oil, etc.) as well as person hygiene products (bathroom tissue, diapers, shampoo, etc.) and snacks.

Andres requests from Edpyme Alternativa (Kiva Field Partner) a loan in the amount of 1000 nuevos soles to use in the purchase of grocery products for his store. This will permit him to keep developing his business with satisfaction.

Andres has good personal references and he is known to be a hardworking man who is devoted to his family.

loans.use: to purchase groceries for his store.

loans.name: Fernando

texts.es:
Fernando tiene  56  años de edad y  vive junto a su esposa en una casa propia,  en la zona rural del distrito de Illimo en Lambayeque.  El hogar de Fernando solo cuenta con el servicio básico de luz.

Fernando tiene 20  años de experiencia en la crianza de animales. El cuenta con una amplia demanda que incluye clientes fidelizados a él y a sus crías.
 
Fernando comercializa sus animales por toda la zona de Illimo y la  gran demanda con la que cuenta se debe a la buena crianza de sus animales. Él sabe que darles la mejor alimentación le trae beneficios pues sus animales crecen fuertes y sanos y por eso  no tiene reparos en invertir en ello. 

Fernando solicita a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1500 nuevos soles que utilizará para hacer mejoras en su corral y para comprar alimento balanceado para sus crías.

Fernando ha cancelado puntualmente créditos con otras entidades.
texts.en:
Fernando is 56 years old and he lives together with his wife in a house of their own. It is located in the rural region of the district of Illimo in Lambayeque. Fernando's home is only equipped with electricity.

Fernando has 20 years' experience in raising livestock. He enjoys an ample demand from loyal clients seeking his livestock.

Fernando raises livestock throughout the entire region of Illimo and a the great demand that he enjoys is based on the good practices used to raise his livestock. He knows that giving them good feed will bring benefits especially because the animals grow strong and healthy and he does not need to invest in further care. 

Fernando requests from Edpyme Alternativa (Kiva Field Partner) a loan in the amount of 1500 nuevos soles which will be used to make improvements on his coral and to purchase balanced feed for his livestock.

Fernando has repaid his loans on time with other organizations.

loans.use: to improve his corral and to purchase balanced feed.

loans.name: Cindy Rosalinda

texts.es: La Sra. Cindy  es una persona muy trabajadora  y responsable,  lo mas  impórtate   para  ella  son sus  pequeños   hijos,  en esta  ocasión    requiere   de nuestro  apoyo  para  realizar   la  barda  de su  domicilio que  con  mucho sacrifico esta  pagando  ,  ve  en el crédito la  oportunidad  de realizar  su proyecto  brindado  a  sus  hijos  una  mayor  seguridad y  tranquilidad a  su  familia.
texts.en: Sra. Cindy is a hardworking and responsible individual.  What matters most to her are her young children.  On this occasion, she needs assistance with building a wall around her home since the cost requires great sacrifice.  This loan will give her the opportunity to complete this project so that her children will have greater security and her family can experience tranquility.

loans.use: to build a security wall around her home.

loans.name: Mahoukpego-Pouce Group

texts.fr: MAHOUKPEGO-POUCE est un groupe constitué de quatre personnes et dont la présidente (dont la main est levée sur la photo) est nommée Elise. Les membres du groupe sont des amies qui fréquentent la même Eglise. Née en 1976 au Bénin, Elise vit avec son mari Cokouvi et ses trois enfants dans une ville du Bénin, depuis quatre ans environs. Parmi les enfants, certains sont scolarisés. Elise assure ensemble avec son mari les différentes charges de la maison. Il y a deux ans que Elise a commencé à faire le commerce de chaussures et de produits cosmétiques de façon secondaire. Elise s’approvisionne au Bénin, et vend ses produits de façon ambulante. Ce crédit servira certainement à Elise et aux membres de son groupe d’augmenter le stock de leurs produits et d’accroître leur chiffre d’affaire de même que leur revenu. Elise ambitionne trouver un lieu fixe de vente dans un marché afin d’y vendre ses produits.
texts.en: The Mahoukpego-Pouce group is composed of four individuals. The group’s leader (raising her hand in the photo) is  called Elise. The group members are friends who attend the same church. Born in 1976 in Benin, Elise  has been living with her husband, Cokouvi, and their three children in a town in Benin for about four years. Some of the children are in school. Elise and her husband jointly provide for different household needs. Two years ago, Elise started a business selling shoes, and, as a secondary activity,  cosmetics. She stocks up in Benin and sells as an ambulant street vendor. This credit will certainly help Elise and her group members to expand their product stock and to increase their sales volume and their revenues. Her goal is to have a permanent  stand at a market in order to sell her wares there.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics and shoes

loans.name: Jose Ramiro

texts.es:
Ramiro es un cliente de 32 años de edad que vive junto a su novia y su menor hijo en casa de sus padres en la ciudad de Chepén – La Libertad. Ramiro y su familia gozan de ciertas comodidades pues su casa se encuentra en la zona urbana y cuenta con todos los servicios básicos. 

Desde hace 5 años, Ramiro, se dedica a ofrecer el servicio de transporte público de mototaxi. La mototaxi consta de una moto con una cabina en la parte trasera donde se pueden transportar pasajeros. Este es un servicio muy común en las pequeñas comunidades del Perú, las rutas que cubren son rutas pequeñas y el costo de este servicio es barato.

Ramiro solicita a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles que utilizará para mejoras en su moto para que esta le siga siendo rentable, así como para gastos personales que su familia actualmente requiere.

Ramiro y su familia cuentan con buenas referencias personales y él estaría muy agradecido de concedérsele el préstamo pues le sería de gran utilidad.
texts.en:
Ramiro is a 32 year old man who lives together with his girlfriend and their young son in his parents' house in the city of Chepen, La Libertad. Ramiro and his family enjoy certain commodities as their house is located in an urban region and they have all the basic services.

For the past 5 years Ramiro has been offering public transport services with his motorcycle taxi. A motorcycle taxi consists of a motorcycle and a cabin in the rear section where passengers are transported. This is a very common service in the small communities in Peru. The routes which they cover are short routes and the cost of this service is affordable.

Ramiro requests a loan from Edpyme Alternativa in the amount of 1000 nuevos soles. He will use it to make improvements to his motorcycle to keep his business profitable. He will also use it for personal expenses currently required by his family.

Ramiro and his family have good personal references and he would be very thankful to have a loan as it would be very helpful.

loans.use: to carry out maintenance to his motorcycle and to cover some personal expenses.

loans.name: Maria Erika

texts.es:
María es una mujer trabajadora de  29 años de edad. Ella vive con sus padres en el distrito de Olmos -  Lambayeque. María tiene muy buenas referencias personales por ser una mujer alegre y trabajadora siempre con voluntad de ayudar a los demás.

La actividad que desarrolla María  es la venta de abarrotes y da pensión a los chóferes de Terminal de Olmos, esta actividad la realiza desde hace 6 años y  cuenta con una amplia clientela establecida en su zona. 

María es una mujer emprendedora con mucha ganas de superarse y es conocida por tener siempre un nuevo negocio en la mente. María ha solicitado a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles que utilizará para la compra de una fotocopiadora, que le permitirá tener un nuevo negocio y por lo tanto mayores ingresos para mejorar su calidad de vida.

María es un cliente recurrente para Edpyme Alternativa y estaría muy agradecida de concedérsele el crédito pues le sería de gran utilidad para su nuevo proyecto.
texts.en:
Maria is a hardworking woman who is 29 years old. She lives with her parents in the district of Olmos in Lambayeque. Maria has many good personal references for being a very content and hardworking woman who is always ready to help others.

Maria has a grocery store business and she caters to the drivers at the terminal in Olmos. She has been in business for 6 years and she has an ample and established clientele in the region. 

Maria is an enterprising woman who is very eager to improve. She is known for always having a new business idea in mind. Maria has requested from Edpyme Alternativa (Kiva Field Partner) a loan in the amount of 1000 nuevos soles to purchase a new photocopier. This will help her have a new business and more income to improve the quality of her life.

Maria is a returning client to Edpyme Alternativa and she would be very happy to have a loan. It will be of great use for her new project.

loans.use: to purchase a photocopier to start a business.

loans.name: Sissigbe Group

texts.fr: Le groupe SISSIGBE est composé de trois  personnes qui sont des amies et qui mènent leur activité au même lieu. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Chantal Ablanvi est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Chantal Ablanvi est né le 27 Avril 1971 dans une ville du Bénin. Chantal Ablanvi est mariée à un Transitaire du nom de Albert. Le couple a quatre enfants dont trois sont à leur charges. Les enfants vivent ensemble avec leurs parents et certains ne sont pas scolarisés. Chantal Ablanvi vend des vêtements tous cousus depuis trois ans, de façon ambulante. Chantal Ablanvi s’approvisionne au Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaire et son revenu, Chantal Ablanvi sollicite, ensemble avec son groupe, un premier crédit.
texts.en:
The SISSIGBE group is composed of three women who are friends and who run their businesses in the same place. The group representative, Chantal Ablanvi, is the one raising her hand in the photo. 

Chantal Ablanvi was born on April 27, 1971 in a town in Bénin. She is married to to a shipping clerk named Albert. The couple have four children; they are still responsible for three of them. The children live together with their parents and some are not enrolled in school. 

Chantal Ablanvi has been selling ready-to-wear clothing for three years, as an itinerant salesperson. She buys her merchandise in Bénin. Wishing to satisfy her clientele and grow her sales and thus her income, she is asking, together with her group, for a first-time loan.

loans.use: to buy clothing for resale.

loans.name: Renacer 1 & 2 Group

texts.en:
Lucilo is the coordinator of his group Renacer 1 & 2 (Reborn). He lives alone in and he has a grown child. He says that his most difficult challenge is to have his own house built with concrete block.

Lucilo is excited to be taking his third loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid his previous loan and grown his business. He has had his business for 14 years, which starting with some savings. He plans to use this loan to invest in his business by buying different sizes and styles of shoes, slippers, sneakers, and others foot wear. He dreams of building an orphanage for homeless children, and he will work to have a successful business to make his dreams come true and help others.

His group is located in Santiago, an area famous for tobacco and beef production.  Santiago is the second biggest city in the Dominican Republic. 

Lucilo thanks all of you for your support.

loans.use: to buy shoes, slippers, and sneakers for his footwear business.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Rosa Amelia

texts.es:
Rosa es madre de familia de  30 años de edad con un hijo, vive en casa de sus padres,la cual no cuenta con los servicios básicos, ubicada en Chacupe bajo que pertenece al distrito de la Victoria.  Este distrito desarrolla la actividad agrícola, comercialización de aves de corral y artesanía (elaboración de sombreros).

La actividad a la que se dedica Rosa desde hace 4 años es la elaboración de sombreros de palma que lo aprendio desde muy pequeña, este trabajo lo realiza con mucho gusto ya que que a pasado de generación en generación en su familia.  También  cuenta en su domidilio con una pequeña tienda donde tiene galletas, frugos y golosinas, lo que le permite tener ingresos para poder cubrir sus necesidades diarias.

El préstamo que a solicitado a Edpyme Alternativa es de 500 nuevos soles para la compra de materia prima (palma) para la elaboración de sus sombreros, los cuales son de muy buena calidad, por eso tiene clientes satisfechos y así obtiene mayores ganancias.  Rosa es una persona muy dedicada a su trabajo y responsable con sus clientes, con el objetivo de sacar adelante a su única hija.
texts.en:
Rosa is the mother of a family, 30 years old, and she has one child. She lives at home with her parents. Their house is not equipped with any of the basic services and it is located in Chacupe Bajo, belonging to the district of La Victoria. This district undertakes agricultural activities, poultry sales, and crafts (sombrero making). 

Rosa has undertaken her business activity for the past four years and it is the crafting of straw sombreros, a trade she learned when she was very young. She enjoys her work especially because it has been passed on from generation to generation in her family. She also has a small store in her house where she sells cookies, fruit juices, and sweets and it permits her to have an income to provide for her daily needs.

The loan when she requests from Edpyme Alternativa (Kiva Field Partner) is of 500 nuevos soles and it will be used to purchase materials (straw) to make sombreros. They are of very high quality and so her clients are satisfied and she obtains greater earnings. Rosa is a person who is very dedicated to her work and she is responsible with her clients. Her objective is to provide for her only daughter.

loans.use: to purchase materials (straw) to make hats.

loans.name: Gloria Alejandra

texts.es:
La señora Gloria Alejandra es madre soltera y tiene bajo su responsabilidad tres hijos los cuales actual mente están estudiando. 
Esta solicitando un préstamo para pagar los gasto D. la titulacion, graduación D. sus hijos ya que no cuenta con el dinero necesario para liquidar estos pagos y que se puedan terminar bien los estudios. 
Planea pagar el crédito con el sueldo que recibe por cuidar y atender a una persona mayor D. edad y limpieza D. la casa. Es la fuente D. ingreso que tiene para su familia. 
Doña gloria Alejandra ya ha tenido tres créditos con FVP los cuales a pagado puntual mente.
texts.en:
Sra. Gloria Alejandra is a single mother who is responsible for her three school-age children. She is requesting a loan to pay her children’s educational expenses. Her children are being promoted, but she does not have the necessary funds to pay their tuition so that they can successfully complete their studies.

She plans to repay the loan with the salary she receives for taking care of an elderly person and cleaning houses. Doña Gloria Alejandra is the breadwinner of her family. She has had three previous loans with FVP/Credituyo that were repaid on time.

loans.use: to pay for her children's school expenses.

loans.name: Vilda

texts.es:
Vilda 
Operación 2011-122
500000 colones

Vilda, es una emprendedora y trabajadora madre Nicaraguense, tiene 41 años, vive actualmente con su esposo.
