Radica en Costa Rica desde hace más de 10 años, apenas con su primaria incompleta ha trabajado desde hace diez años con una clienta de Fundación Mujer, Sonia, de excelente trayectoria. Se dedican a la venta de zapatos, perfumes y ropa que consiguen en su país natal a muy buenos precios, para comercializar en Costa Rica. Hace 3 años, su situación migratoria no le permitía accesar a un crédito, pero una amiga suya le hizo el favor y pudo conseguir un capital, que pago sin ningún contratiempo.
Es madre de 3 hijos y tiene una nieta, vive en la zona de San Rafael de Alajuela, en el Valle Central de Costa Rica, su esposo trabaja en una arrocera de la zona y ambos han sacado adelante el núcleo familiar y desean prosperar y mejorar su situación económica.

Con este préstamo, la solicitante va a viajar a Nicaragua a comprar mercadería para las fechas del día del padre y la madre, próximas a celebrarse en Costa Rica, ambas son fechas de gran movimiento comercial por lo que es importante prepararse con tiempo para poder cubrir los pedidos de sus clientes. Ella ayuda a su hija en el estudio y desea brindarle un mejor futuro educativo a sus hijos.

El impacto del crédito es de suma importancia, ya que les da la oportunidad de comprar mercadería y apoyar a su familia que es de escasos recursos, su moral de pago se demuestra excelente, y las recomendaciones que presenta la demuestran como una persona horada y trabajadora.
texts.en:
Vilda, age 41, is an enterprising and hardworking mother from Nicaragua. She currently lives with her husband. Vilda moved to Costa Rica more than 10 years ago. Even though she did not finish her elementary school education, Vilda has worked with another client of Fundación Mujer named Sonia and has established a good career.

Vilda has a business selling shoes, perfumes, and clothing that she buys in Nicaragua at a good price. The merchandise is eventually sold in Costa Rica. She has been doing this for three years. Her immigration status did not allow her to access credit, but a friend performed a favor for her and was able to secure the capital for her. She repaid the loan without any problems.

Vilda is the mother of three children and also has a granddaughter. She lives in the District of San Rafael de Alajuela, which is in the Central Valley of Costa Rica. Her husband works on a rice farm in the area. Both of them have been able to move their family forward and want to continue prospering and improving their financial situation.

With this loan, Vilda will travel to Nicaragua to buy merchandise to sell for Father’s Day and Mother’s Day, the next holidays to be celebrated in Costa Rica. Both of these dates generate a lot of business, so it is important for her to prepare ahead of time so that she can cover all of the orders from her customers. Vilda helps her daughter with her studies and hopes to provide an education for all of her children so that they will have a better future.

The impact of this loan is of great importance since it will give her the opportunity to buy merchandise so that she can support her low-income family. Vilda has demonstrated that she has an excellent payment history and her recommendations have indicated that she is an honorable and hardworking person.

loans.use: to purchase shoes, perfumes, and clothing.

loans.name: Sop Mame Rokhaya Ndiaye Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe de solidarité est composé de 16 femmes qui habitent le même quartier.Il est créé le 28 mars 2008.La principale activité est le petit commerce.

Coumba est une femme veuve qui a en charge cinq enfants; elle est debout sur la photo habillée en. Elle mène une activité de petit commerce de légumes avec une expérience de plus de 20 ans.

elle se ravitaille et vend ses produits au marché central de la ville. Son nouveau prêt lui permettra de renforcer son activité pour réaliser plus de revenus 

Avec ses bénéfices elle prend en charge les dépenses de sa famille pour assurer un bien être à ses enfants
texts.en: This solidarity group is made up a 16 women who live in the same neighborhood. It was created on March 28, 2008. They are mainly involved in small business. Coumba is a widow who takes care of five children; she is one of the women standing in the photograph. She has managed a small business of selling vegetables for the past 20 years. She buys her supplies and sells her products at the central market in town. Her new loan will help strengthen the business and increase revenues. With her profits, she takes care of all the family's expenses to ensure the well-being of her children.

loans.use: To purchase vegetables for resale

loans.name: Saf Mana Deme Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité Saf mana déme a été créé le 05 mai 2010.Il est composé de 20 femmes issues du même village.Leur activité principale est la transformation de l'arachide en huile.

Madame Diatou en position debout à l'extrême droite de la photo,est responsable du groupement ,elle est née le 15 02 74 ,elle est marié et mére de 05 enfants.

Comme activité,elle fait la même  chose que les membres de son groupement.


Son prêt lui permettra d'acheter des graines d'arachides pour les transformer en huile. 

Son objectif est de réfectionner sa maison,aider son mari à payer la scolarité des enfants et augmenter son niveau d'épargne.
texts.en:
The solidarity group Saf mana deme was created are May 5, 2010. It is made up of 20 women from the same village. Their main business is producing peanut oil from peanuts.

Mrs. Diatou, standing on the far right of the photo, is in charge of the group. She was born on February 15, 1974. She is married and has five children.

She is involved in the same business as the other members of her group.


The loan will allow her to purchase peanuts in order to produce peanut oil.

Her goal is to make repairs on their home, help her husband pay the children's school expenses and increase how much she saves.

loans.use: to purchase peanuts in order to produce peanut oil

loans.name: Charon Carolina

texts.es:
Charon Carolina 
Operación 2011-121
300000 colones

Charon Carolina tiene 21 años de edad, estudio en el colegio hasta noveno año, pero está cursando a distancia para obtener su título, es oriunda de Limón pero vive actualmente en la zona de Heredia con su compañero, no tienen hijos y conforman una pareja joven y unida con grandes proyectos para su vida futura
Con este crédito se pretende comprar mercadería ya que hace 6 meses y por estar desempleada, su abuela y madre la motivaron a formar su propia empresa y en este momento se dedica a la venta de dos catálogos de ropa intima, su abuela, que también es clienta de Fundación Mujer en la zona de Limón, le ha ayudado a colocar su producto y aumentar su clientela la cual ha incrementado sus pedidos y el negocio ha ido creciendo. Por esta razón solicita este préstamo, además de la motivación y el deseo de superación, sus clientes han aumentado también, por lo que requiere de este capital para poder cubrir esta demanda.

Desean mejorar sus ingresos y salir del estancamiento económico debido a su desempleo y apoyar a su compañero económicamente en los gastos del hogar y poder alquilar un lugar junto, aparte de la familia de este.
 El impacto del crédito es de suma importancia, ya que le da la oportunidad a una persona joven de iniciar su negocio, ella está siendo asesorada por dos personas con experiencia, que la están introduciendo en la búsqueda de independencia económica y desarrollo personal.
texts.en:
Charon Carolina is 21 years old. She completed high school through the ninth grade, but she was able to obtain her diploma through distance learning. Charon Carolina is a native of Limón, but she currently lives in the District of Heredia with her partner. Even though this young couple has no children, they have made great plans for their life ahead.

Charon Carolina will use this loan to buy merchandise since she became unemployed six months ago. Her grandmother and mother convinced her to start her own business. She decided to sell intimate apparel through catalogs. Her grandmother is also a client of Fundación Mujer in the District of Limón, which has helped her gain access to her products and increase her customer base so that she could gain more orders and grow her business. For this reason, Charon Carolina has requested this loan. She is motivated and has the desire to succeed. Charon Carolina has gained more customers, but she needs capital in order to keep up with demand.

She wants to improve her income since her financial situation has become stagnant since becoming unemployed. Charon Carolina also wants to help her partner with the household expenses and be able to rent a place together so that they can be apart from her family.

The impact of this loan is of great significance since it gives her the opportunity to start a business as a young woman. She is being mentored by two people with experience and they are helping her get acquainted with financial independence and personal development.

loans.use: to purchase lingerie through catalogs.

loans.name: Confiando En Dios Group

texts.en:
Ermancia is the coordinator of her group Confiando en cristo (Trusting in Christ) 1 and 2. Her group is located in the areas surrounding La Romana, an area economically dominated by the sugarcane harvest. She makes her home here in a simple structure with her long term partner and their six children.

Ermancia is excited to be taking her second loan with Esperanza, after having successfully repaid her previous loan and grown her business. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business. She runs a stall, where she sells charcoal, fruit, and vegetables. She will use the profits to save and reinvest in her business.

She said that her most difficult challenge has been to live in a foreign country with her family, and to give a good education to her family. She thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: to buy charcoal, fruits, and vegetables

loans.name: Clemente

texts.es: El Sr. Clemente y su esposa  Herminia, son unas personas que se dedican al comercio desde hace mas de cinco años, y a través de este negocio han sabido dar sustento y estudio a sus hijos, y por este motivo ellos se ven muy preocupados por sus clientes,  quienes a diario los buscan para comprar los víveres primordiales del día, tanto para la comida de la casa como para llevarles un jugo o galleta a los niños que pasan a la escuela , ahora ellos como comerciantes  piensan en incrementar los productos para proporcionar  una mejor  servicio a  sus  cliente, así  como también  han decidido ampliar un poco mas la tienda para  proporcionar  mayor espacio y comodidad a todos sus clientes.
texts.en:
Sr. Clemente and his wife Herminia have been in the retail trade for more than five years. Through their business, they have been able to support their children and provide them with an education. For this reason, they look after their customers who are looking to buy the basic necessities for daily living. This includes everything from food for the household meals to juice and cookies for the children who are going to school.

Having the mindset of store owners, Clemente and his wife want to increase their inventory of products so that they can provide better service to their customers. They have also decided to slightly expand their storefront so that there will be more space for all of their customers to be comfortable.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise for his store.

loans.name: Dionisio

texts.es:
Dionisio  vive en Pérez Zeledón  específicamente en la comunidad de Pilas. Es una persona con experiencia en la agricultura y ama lo que hace.
El tiene su propia finca, y desea empezar a sembrar frijoles y maíz para la venta, aprovechando el clima y la demanda propia de época. Para eso el desea un préstamo de  ₡500 000 (quinientos mil colones) para la compra de abonos y Insecticidas, necesarios para la producción de estos granos.
El desea aumentar su producción y así mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia. 
El  es  socio de la empresa de Crédito Comunal La Danta S.A una de las 110 empresas socias de EDESA en Costa Rica.
texts.en:
Dionisio lives in Pérez Zeledón, specifically the community of Pilas. He is an experienced farmer who enjoys his job.

Dionisio has his own farm and wants to begin planting beans and corn to sell. He hopes to take advantage of the weather and the demand that exists for this season. For this reason, he is requesting a loan of 500,000 CRC in order to buy compost and insecticides, necessary supplies for producing these crops.

His wishes include increasing his production and improving the quality of life for his family. Dionisio is a member of La Danta Communal Credit Enterprise, S.A., which is one of the 110 member organizations that make up EDESA in Costa Rica.

loans.use: to purchase compost and insecticides.

loans.name: Reinaldo

texts.es:
Reinaldo  es un agricultor muy conocido de la zona de Pilas en Pérez Zeledón.
El tiene una finca sembrada de maíz  y frijoles, sin embargo necesita asegurar y mejorar  su producción ya que a pesar de que la demanda es alta, hay competencia. Por eso el desea un préstamo de ₡500 000 (quinientos mil colones) para la compra de abonos, herbicidas e insecticidas. Reinaldo desea  mantener su producción, y ofrecer el mejora producto al cliente.
El  es  socio de la empresa de Crédito Comunal La Danta S.A una de las 110 empresas socias de EDESA en Costa Rica.
texts.en:
Reinaldo is a farmer who is well-known in the District of Pilas in Pérez Zeledón. He has a farm where he grows corn and beans. However, he wants to secure and improve production. Even though demand for his products is high, competition still exists. For this reason, he is requesting a loan of 500,000 CRC in order to buy compost, herbicides, and insecticides. Reinaldo wants to maintain production and offer a better product to his customers.

He is a member of La Danta Communal Credit Enterprise, S.A., which is one of the 110 member organizations that make up EDESA in Costa Rica.

loans.use: to purchase compost, herbicides, and insecticides.

loans.name: Modesto Gilberto

texts.es: Modesto Gilberto se dedica a la venta de ofrenda floral.  Es una persona muy trabajadora, pues ha mantenido el negocio desde hace más 5 años, siempre les ha brindado a sus clientes un buen servicio.  Inicio este medio de vida por su esposa quien le había dicho que establecieran este tipo de actividad en su vivienda, es así que han logrado sacar a sus hijos adelante actualmente trabajan de manera independiente. El motivo del crédito es para la compra de corona, flores, canastas, plásticos especiales, alambres, oasis y ramos.
texts.en: Modesto Gilberto makes a living selling floral arrangements. He is a very hard worker and has maintained his business for more than five years. He has always provided his customers with good service. He started this business for his wife, who told him to set up this type of business in their home, and has been able to make headway for their children, who now work on their own. He is requesting the loan to purchase wreaths, flowers, baskets, special plastics, wire and bouquets.

loans.use: to purchase wreaths, flowers, baskets, special plastics, wire and bouquets.

loans.name: Bok Jom Group

texts.fr:
le groupe de solidarité Bok jom a été créé le 05 mai 2010.il est composé de 11 femmes issues du même village.
Elles ont comme activité principale l'agriculture et la vente d'huile.

Madame Fatou en position debout à l’extrême droite de la photo est responsable du groupement. Elle a 40 ans à  et 05 enfants en charge.

l'agriculture constitue son activité principale plus précisément la culture d'arachide. Cependant elle mène une activité secondaire celle de la transformation de l'arachide en huile.

Son prêt lui permettra d'acheter des semences de bonne qualité et en quantité suffisante pour préparer l'hivernage.

Son objectif est d'acheter un matériel neuf  afin d'augmenter sa capacité de production.
Aussi elle désire participer à la gestion quotidienne de la maison
texts.en:
The solidarity group Bok jom was founded on May 5, 2010. It has 11 women members who are from the same village.
Their main business activity is farming and selling oil.

Ms. Fatou, at the far right of the photo, is the head of the group. She is forty years old and takes care of five children.

Her main business is the farming of peanuts. However, she also has a secondary business of producing peanut oil from the peanuts.

The loan will allow her to purchase a sufficient quantity of high-quality seeds to prepare for the rainy season.

Her goal is to purchase new inputs so that she can increase her production capacity.

She also wants to help with the daily, household expenses.

loans.use: to purchase seeds

loans.name: Flor Idalia

texts.es: Flor Idalia D. 31 años D. edad vive con su compañero D. vida y sus dos hijos, los cuales asisten a la escuela D. la comunidad donD. residen. Flor posee un negocio, una sala D. belleza que es la que le permite mantener a flote su hogar; la sala D. belleza D. Flor es muy conocida en el lugar porque ofrece a los clientes buena calidad D. trabajo y a precios accesibles, además Flor piensa que la belleza viene desD. el corazón y le transmite a sus clientes ese amor a su trabajo y la alegría que la caracteriza. Ella quiere ver crecer su negocio y por eso le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le dé la oportunidad D. comprar cremas, maquillaje, esmaltes, shampo, acondicionadores, peines entre otros, para así  mantener mucha clientela y lograr darle a su familia seguridad económica y una mejor calidad D. vida.
texts.en: Flor Idalia is 31 years old, and lives with her partner and their two children, who attend the community school.  Flor has a beauty salon, which permits her to maintain her lifestyle. The beauty salong is very well-known in the area because Flor offers her clients high-quality work and reasonable prices. Additionally, Flor believes that beauty comes from the heart, and she conveys this love for her work to her clients. As a result, she is requesting a loan from INTEGRAL, which gave her the opportunity to buy creams, make-up, nailpolish, shampoo, conditioners, and combs, among other items. This will enable her to maintain many clients and to succeed in giving her family economic security and a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy creams, make-up, nailpolish, shampoo, conditioners, and combs

loans.name: Josefa Cupertina

texts.es: Josefa Cupertina D. cincuenta y seis años D. edad vive en casa propia junto a su compañero D. vida. Ella posee un negocio D. venta D. comida y tortillas en el lugar donD. resiD.. Josefa como toda mujer emprendedora trabaja todos los días haciendo lo que más le gusta, que es cocinar. Ella tiene un sazón inigualable al preparar las comidas y es así como satisface el paladar D. las personas que la visitan, además también es un lugar muy higiénico y con precios accesibles. Últimamente se ha hecho D. mas clientela y quiere estar preparada para no decepcionarlos es por eso que Josefa le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar maíz para sus tortillas y material para las comidas como embutidos, carnes, granos básicos, bebidas entre otros. Josefa tiene la esperanza D. que si su negocio prospera le podrá dar a su familia la vida plena que se merecen.
texts.en: Josefa Cupertina is 56 years old, and she lives in her own house with her partner.  She has a business selling food and tortillas in her home. Josefa, like all businesswomen, works every day doing what she likes most: cooking. She has an unequaled flavoring that she uses to prepare her food, and this satisfies the palates of her customers. Also, her business is very clean, and her food is reasonably priced. Ultimately, she wants to grow her clientele and ensure that she doesn’t disappoint her customers. Because of this, Josefa is requesting a loan from INTEGRAL, which will permit her to buy corn for her tortillas and ingredients for her food, including cured meat, meat, basic grains, and drinks, among other items. Josefa hopes that her business will prosper so that she will be able to give her family the life they deserve.

loans.use: to buy corn to prepare tortillas and ingredients for cured meat, meat, basic grains, and drinks

loans.name: María Isabel

texts.es: María Isabel de treinta y seis años de edad vive con su compañero de vida y sus hijos en casa propia. Ella tiene una tortillería y  una venta de gas propano en el lugar donde reside; María es una mujer muy activa y muy dedicada a su trabajo, para ella  su motivación y ganas de salir adelante es lo que va a determinar su destino por eso se esfuerza cada día por servir al cliente como se lo merece. María vende las mejores tortillas del lugar a muy buen precio y últimamente ha tenido más clientela, es por eso que le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar maíz y gas propano, de esta forma María no decepcionara a sus clientes y tendrá seguridad económica en su hogar para una mejor vida en su familia
texts.en: María Isabel is 36 years old, and lives with her partner and children in their own house. She has a tortilla store and sells propane gas in her home. María is a very active woman and is dedicated to her work. Her motivation and desire to go forward is going to determine her destiny because she works everyday to serve her clients like they deserve. María sells the best tortillas in the area at a very good price, and has earned more clients. Because of this, she is requesting a loan from INTEGRAL that will permit her to buy corn and propane gas. In this way, María won’t disappoint her client and will have financial security and a better life for her family.

loans.use: to buy corn and propane gas

loans.name: Marlon Antonio

texts.es:
Marlon pequeño comerciante, con mas de siete años en el comercio, que ha crecido gracias a su empeño y apoyo de la institución con tres préstamo que le ha otorgado, en donde ha logrado la compra de mas productos que le ha generado mejores ganancias.
Pues inicio solo con la venta de Cd y ahora ah ampliado sus productos y comprado otra vitrina y así exhibir sus mercadería. Comprando al mayor en un mercado de la capital, siendo de bajos costos, dando a mejor precio a sus clientes.
Con este préstamo comprara: cargadores de celulares, limpia Cd, control remoto en diversas marcas, audífonos para celulares, para radio, calculadoras, películas, videos, también comprara cosméticos para vender en estas fiestas festivas a la madre. Siendo Afodenic el medio para una mejor inversión a bajos costos.
texts.en:
Marlon is a small business owner with more than seven years in the business. He has expanded it thanks to his commitment and thanks to the support of the institution through the three loans that he has received. He has been able to purchase more products and to generate a greater profit.

He started out selling only CDs and today he has increased his products and he has purchased a case where to display his merchandise. He purchase in wholesale at a market in the capital and taking advantage of lower prices he is able to offer his clients more affordable prices.

with this loan he will purchase: cellular phone chargers, cd cleaners, various brands of remote controls, headphones for cellular phones and for radios, calculators, movies, video cameras, and to purchase cosmetics to sell for Mother's Day. Afodenic (Kiva Field Partner) is the way to have a better investment at a lower interest rate.

loans.use: to purchase cd's, movies, videos, remote controls, chargers, and other merchandise to increase his sales.

loans.name: Teresa De Jesús

texts.es: Teresa de Jesús de 41 años de edad vive con sus hijas, ella posee una tortillería y una venta de lácteos en su residencia. Teresa es una mujer trabajadora y siempre le ofrece a su clientela el mejor servicio, a un buen precio; su negocio es muy conocido en el lugar pues Teresa ha logrado estar adelante de la competencia, ella quiere trazar su camino hacia el éxito por eso le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar maíz para sus tortillas y lácteos que le permitan satisfacer la necesidades de sus clientes. Teresa tiene fe y confianza en que su esfuerzo como madre le ayudara a darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Teresa de Jesús is 41 years old and lives with her daughters. She has a tortilla store and sells dairy products in her home. Teresa is a very hard-working woman, and she always offers her clients the best service at a good price. Her business is very well-known in the area, since Teresa has succeeded in going forward despite the competition. She wants to continue her path toward success. Because of this, she is requesting a loan from INTEGRAL, which will permit her to buy corn for her tortillas and dairy products. This will allow her to meet her clients’ needs. Teresa has faith and confidence in her strength as a mother that will help her give her family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy corn and dairy products

loans.name: Cesar Roberto

texts.es: Cesar Roberto de 49 años de edad, habita en  casa propia con su esposa y dos hijos. Cesar es un hombre luchador y dedicado a su familia. Durante mucho tiempo ha trabajado duramente en la venta de leña y haciendo viajes de arena y piedra para llevar a su familia el pan de cada día. El  negocio de leña lo tiene en su propia casa y los viajes los realiza en la zona donde habita. Su negocio está ubicado en un lugar de fácil acceso por lo que muchas personas lo prefieren y demandan la buena leña que él vende. El sueño de Cesar es poder dar a su familia una mejor vida y esto es lo que lo inspira cada día para seguir trabajando. Con la fe puesta en Dios y con muchas ganas de trabajar a decidido hacer este crédito a INTEGRAL para poder invertir en su negocio en la compra de más leña y piedras para que los clientes siempre encuentren cada vez que necesiten. De esta manera espera aumentar sus ventas lo cual le darán mayores ingresos que le ayudaran para sacar adelante a su familia y lograr su sueño.
texts.en: Cesar Roberto is 49 years old and lives with his wife and two kids in their own home.  Cesar is a fighter and dedicated to his family, for a long time he has been working hard selling firewood and transporting sand and stone in order to obtain the daily bread for his family.  His firewood business is operated from his residence and the transportation jobs are done in the same area where he lives.  Cesar's dreams is to be able to provide his family with a better quality of life and it is what inspires him to continue working everyday.  With his faith in God and his willingness to work, he is dedicated to making his loan with INTEGRAL work so he can invest it in his business; in the purchase of more firewood and stones so that clients always have supply readily available.  He hopes to increase his sales in this way which raises his income to help get his family ahead and realize his dream.

loans.use: to purchase more firewood and stones so that clients always find them readily available.

loans.name: Cinthia Magaly

texts.es: La Sra. Cinthia  junto  con su esposo   tienen una cerrajería , la cual  representa    la manera  de  obtener   ingresos  permitiéndoles sustentar  su  hogar , en esta  ocasión  ella  requiere de  nuestro  apoyo  para  invertir  en su  negocio  realizando   la  compra  de mercancía y  material ,   ya  que  ellos  se  preocupan por  brindarles  un excelente  servicio  a  sus  clientes.
texts.en: Mrs. Cinthia and her husband have a locksmith shop which is their source of income for covering household expenses.  With our support she wants to invest in the business and buy merchandise and material in order to provide excellent service to customers.

loans.use: To buy merchandise.

loans.name: Sulma Yesenia

texts.es: Sulma Yesenia de 32 años de edad, habita en casa propia con sus dos pequeñas hijas que se encuentran estudiando. Para Sulma sus hijas lo son todo y trabaja duramente para poder seguir dando lo que ellas necesitan. Cuenta con un puesto de tortillas en su lugar de residencia. Durante mucho tiempo las personas la prefieren ya que ofrece tortillas de muy buena calidad a un buen precio y sobre todo amabilidad con sus clientes. Solicita este crédito a INTEGRAL para poder mejorar el servicio que ofrece y poder cubrir una mayor demanda. El crédito lo invertirá en las principales materias primas que necesita para continuar trabajando en su negocio. Tales como: maíz, agua, gas propano y leña. De esta manera espera mejorar su nivel de ingresos y superarse poco a poco de la difícil situación económica en la que se encuentra.
texts.en:
Sulma Yesenia, age 32, lives in her own house with her two small daughters who are in school.  They are very important to her and she works hard to provide everything they need.  She has a tortilla stand in her home.  For a long time people have preferred her business because of the quality and low price of her tortillas, and her kindness in customer service. 

She has requested a loan through INTEGRAL to improve her services and meet greater demand.  The loan will be used to buy ingredients and materials to continue running the business.  These are corn, water, propane gas and firewood.  Her goal is to improve income and manage to overcome the difficult situation she finds herself in.

loans.use: To buy corn, water, propane gas and firewood.

loans.name: Noemy Del Carmen

texts.es: Noemy del Carmen D. 41 años D. edad, habita en su casa con su compañero D. vida y sus tres hijos. Doña Noemy vive en condiciones muy humildes y durante mucho tiempo a trabajado duro para poder ayudar a la economía D. su hogar.  Su sueño es ver a sus hijos en mejores condiciones  por lo que desD. hace años se dedica a la venta D. productos D. belleza D. forma ambulante en la zona donD. resiD.. Sueña con contar con variedad D. articulos que le permitan atraer a más clientes ya que este negocio es una D. las principales fuentes D. ingresos D. Noemy. Esto la ha impulsado  a solicitar este crédito para poder comprar variedad D. artículos D. belleza como: lociones, cremas, maquillaje, desodorantes, champo, joyerías, entre otros artículos que sean atractivos para los clientes. Confiada que D. esta manera le va a poder dar a su familia lo que necesitan.
texts.en:
Noemy del Carmen, age 41, lives with her common-law husband and three children.  She lives in modest conditions and has worked hard to help cover household expenses.  Her dream is to give her children better living conditions so she decided to set up a beauty products business by selling door-to-door in her neighborhood.

In the future she hopes to have a variety of articles to attract more customers since this is Noemy's main source of income.  This is the reason she is requesting a loan to buy a variety of beauty products such as lotions, creams, make-up, deodorant, shampoo, costume jewelry and other items to attract customers.  She is confident this will help her proviD. her family with everything they need.

loans.use: To buy a variety of beauty products such as lotions, creams, make-up, deodorant, shampoo, costume jewelry, and other articles to attract customers.

loans.name: Rosa Esperanza

texts.es: Rosa Esperanza de 48 años de edad, habita en su casa con su esposo y tres hijas. Doña Rosa ha trabajado duramente para sacar adelante a su familia ya que para ella es su principal inspiración de su trabajo diario. Ella se dedica a la venta de tortillas en su lugar de habitación. Se caracteriza por ser una mujer trabajadora y sobre todo muy amable con sus clientes. Cuenta con muy buena clientela gracias a su carisma y dedicación en el trabajo. Para ella es muy importante seguir contando con su puesto de tortillas ya que es uno de las principales fuentes de ingresos. Todo esto la ha motivado a solicitar este crédito a INTEGRAL para invertir en su pequeño negocio en la compra de de las materias primas necesarias como: maíz, agua, gas propano, etc. Para continuar con su negocio y poder cubrir a mas clientes que requieran sus deliciosas tortillas. Esperando lograr mejores ingresos que le permitan mejorar su condición de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Rosa Esperanza, age 48, lives in her own home with her husband and three children.  She works hard to help her family get ahead since it is her main source of inspiration in her daily work.  She sells tortillas out of her house.  She is known for being very hard-working and kind, and has a very good customer base thanks to her charisma and dedication to work.

It is very important to her to be able to continue with her tortilla business since it is her main source of income.  This is why she has requested a loan through INTEGRAL which she will invest in her small business by buying raw materials such as corn, water, propane gas, etc.  This will enable her to continue her activity and provide delicious tortillas to more customers.  Her hope is to increase income and improve her and her family's living conditions.

loans.use: To buy raw materials such as corn, water, propane gas, etc.

loans.name: G.s. El Triangulo Group

texts.es: Tamara Patricia y Lucia forman el grupo solidario El Triangulo, Tamara se dedica a la venta de cosméticos, hace mas de 7 años que tiene este negocio a pesar de su edad ha tenido una gran experiencia con sus clientes ya que son jóvenes y saben los encargos que le realizan diariamente. Ella sale todos los días a vender a sus productos desde las 7 de la mañana hasta las 9 de la noche. El motivo del crédito es para la compra de polvos, cremas, body, perfumes, desodorantes, pintura de labios y pintura de uñas.
texts.en: Tamara Patricia and Lucia have formed the support group known as "El Triangulo".  Tamara sells cosmetics and has been in business for seven years despite her age, and has been lucky with her customers who are young and place orders daily.  She goes out every day at 7:00 a.m. and sells her products until 9:00 p.m.  The loan will be used to buy powders, creams, perfumes, deodorants, lipstick and nail polish.

loans.use: To buy powders, creams, perfumes, deodorantes, lipstick and nail polish.

loans.name: Ana Gloria

texts.es: Ana Gloria D.  56 años D. edad, resiD. en su casa con su esposo y su hijo.  Como toda mujer emprendedora tiene su propio taller D. costura en su lugar D. residencia. Tiene muchos años D. experiencia en la costura y diseña cualquier tipo D. prenda D. vestir que los clientes soliciten tales como. Faldas, pantalones vestidos, cubrecamas, edredones, etc. Este negocio ha sido para Ana su principal fuente D. ingreso y sigue confiando que así seguirá siendo. En este negocio lo  más importante es dejar satisfecho al cliente D. esta manera Doña Ana se ha ganado la confianza D. los habitantes D. la zona que cada día la prefieren mas. Esta señora llena D. sueños solicita este crédito para poder invertir en material para la elaboración D. edredones y cubrecamas que es lo que más le solicitan los clientes y que por el momento no hace ya que no cuenta con los materiales necesarios. Espera que su situación económica mejore y pueda brindarle mejor calidad D. vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Ana Gloria is 56 years old and lives in her home together with her husband and son.  Like any entrepreneurial woman, she has her own sewing workshop located in her home.  Ana has many years experience in the sewing business and designs all kinds of items that her customers request such as skirts, pants, dresses, bedspreads, comforters, etc.  This business has been Ana's main source of income and she believes that it will continue to be.

In this business, the most important thing is satisfying the customers.  Ana has gained the trust of the people in her area who prefer using her business more and more each day.  This lady is full of dreams and is requesting a loan to invest in materials for making comforters and bedspreads which is what her customers request most often but which, at the moment, she does not make because she doesn't have the necessary materials.  She hopes that her financial situation will improve and that she will be able to proviD. her family with a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy material for making comforters and bedspreads such as thread, fabric, elastic, etc.

loans.name: Mujeres Emprendedoras Group

texts.en:
Anastacia runs a small bakery producing and selling candies. She makes the candies from milk, coconut, and different fruits. She has operated her candy shop for around three years. She plans to use this loan to buy goods to produce different candies using sugar, flour, coconut, milk, fruits, etc.

She has successfully repaid her fourth loan and this will be her fifth one with Esperanza. Anastacia has four children and a long-term partner, all of them are living together in a very far community surrounded by vegetation, hills, and a river. Her children are studying and they are in a young ages. She said that her biggest challenge is to overcome her mother's illness. 

Anastacia is the group coordinator of her group Mujeres Emprendedoras (women entrepreneurs) 1 & 3. Her story is representative of both her group and of Esperanza's Dominican and Haitian clients (many of whom have recently immigrated to the DR). The group is based in Puerto Plata, in a community that has unreliable access to running water, electricity, and lacks trash service.

loans.use: to buy flour, sugar, coconut, milk, fruits, etc. to make candies for her candy shop.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Martha Olga

texts.es:
Martha de 51 años, tiene  casa propia donde vive con su esposo e hijos, la cual cuenta con todos los servicios básicos, ubicada en la zona rural del distrito de Pacanga  a unos 30 minutos de la provincia de Chepén y a 2 horas del  departamento de la Libertad. Se caracteriza por ser una zona de mucha actividad agricola y comercializa animales de corral.

Martha se dedica  a la venta de todo tipo productos para el uso doméstico (leche, arroz, azúcar, huevos, fideos, toallas higiénicas, pastas para limpiar zapatos, etc) desde hace algunos años en su domicilio. Lo que le permite atender a sus clientela a cualquier hora del día y sus ventas diarias le permitira  tener mayores ingresos para solventar las necesidades de a su casa.

Ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 2200 nuevos soles para  comprar mayor cantidad de mercadería para implemntar su negocio y así pueda brindarle a su familia un mejor nivel de vida, con los ingresos que obtenga con sus ventas.  Martha es conocida en la zona por ser una mujer trabajadora, que con mucho empeño desea tener en un futuro un negocio mayorista y tener la  oportunidad de darles otras cosas a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Martha is 51 years old and she has a house of her own where she lives with her husband and children. It is equipped with all the basic services and it is located in the rural district of Pacanga, at about 30 minutes from the province of Chepen and at 2 hours form the department of La Libertad. It is known to be a highly active region in agriculture and livestock farming.

Martha has been selling for a few years from her home all types of products for the home (milk, rice, sugar, eggs, pasta, hygiene products, shoe polish, etc.).

She has requested a loan from Edpyme Alternativa (Kiva Field Partner) in the amount of 2200 nuevos soles to purchase a greater quantity of merchandise to supply her business and so to provide her family with a better quality life from the income she earns from her sales. Martha is known in the region for being a hardworking woman who is committed to becoming a wholesaler in the future. She wants the opportunity to provide her children with more things.

loans.use: to purchase a larger quantity of merchandise to supply her general store.

loans.name: Mardi De La Concepcion

texts.es: Mardi De La Concepción tiene 56 años. Ella es una mujer que le gusta trabajar. La actividad económica a la que se dedica es una pulpería desde hace más de 6 años que se dedica a este negocio. Ella inicio con pocos productos pues la mayoría de sus vecinos solicitaban una variedad de productos pero al no tener mucho capital, fue que empezó con los financiamientos que le ayudaron a crecer.  El financiamiento que solicita es granos básicos, golosinas, refrescos, pan, detergentes, fósforos y sopas. Su deseo es mejorar el techo de su vivienda, ya que en las temporadas de lluvia tiene problemas en su casa.
texts.en: Mardi De La Concepción is 56 years old and a woman who enjoys working.  Her business is a grocery store that she has owned for more than six years.  She started out selling just a few products.  Her neighbors requested a variety of products from her but she didn't have much capital so she started taking out loans which helped her to grow her business.  The loan that Mardi is currently requesting will be used to buy basic grains, candies, soft drinks, bread, detergents, matches and soups.  Mardi would like to improve her roof because during the rainy seasons she experiences problems in her home.

loans.use: to buy basic grains, candies, soft drinks, bread, detergents, matches and soups

loans.name: Walter Efren

texts.es:
Walter de 27 años, vive en una zona peri-urbana en el Fortín de Guayaquil, su esposa se dedica a los quehaceres domésticos y tienen 2 hijos de 5 y 6 años que estudian en escuelas fiscales. Su actividad comercial a la venta de libros.

Trabajo como guardián y sufrió un accidente por lo cual tuvo que dejar su trabajo y un hermano tenia un negocio y se lo recomendó y así fue como empezó su actividad comercial. Labora desde las 6H00 am a 18H00 pm recorriendo por todo su sector promocionando su libros. Con la ayuda del préstamo quiere comprar mas materiales para sus venta (libros cristianos). En un futuro desea terminar su casa y abrir una librería cristiana y ayudar a sus hijos hasta que sean unos profesionales.
texts.en:
Walter is 27 years old and lives in a peri-urban area of Fortín de Guayaquil.  His wife takes care of the housework and they have two children aged 5 and 6 who are studying in public elementary schools.  Walter's business activity is selling books.

Walter used to work as a security guard but he suffered an accident which meant that he had to leave his job.  One of his brothers had a business and recommended it to him.  This is how Walter started his own business.  He works from 6.00am to 6.00pm, promoting his books throughout his area.  With the help of this loan, he would like to buy more materials to sell (Christian books).  In the future, he would like to finish building his home, open a Christian bookstore and help his children until they become professionals.

loans.use: to buy Christian books

loans.name: Morning Dew Group

texts.es: La Sra. Laura  es conviviente  y tiene 21 años D. edad, actualmente es integrante en la alcancía comunal “El Roció del Amanecer”  conformado por 9 socios que se dedican a diversas actividades D. comercio. Laura trabaja desD. hace 6 años en la venta D. productos D. belleza y a la venta D. ropa en el mercado, Laura  nos cuenta que empezó este trabajo desD. que tenía 15 años ya que su familia también se dedicaba a este negocio,  también porque quería obtener mejores ingresos económicos para poder estudiar, pero ahora que tiene 2 hijos desea mejorar la calidad D. vida D. sus hijos, darles una buena educación. Gracias a su esfuerzo y dedicación se ha comprado sus cosas por ejemplo platos, cucharas, una cómoda, cocina, artefactos. Su sueño D. Laura es vender ropa al por mayor.  El préstamo que se le otorgo fue para comprar mercadería.  Sabemos que Laura  cumplirá sus metas con mucho trabajo y esfuerzo y que los préstamos D. Edaprospo le ayudaran.
texts.en: Laura is married common-law, 21 years old, and she is a member of the communal bank "El Rocio del Amanecer", meaning "Morning Dew". It is maD. up of 9 members who carry out various business activities. Laura has been working for the past 6 years in selling beauty products and clothing in the market. Laura tells us that she started her business when she was 15 years old especially because her family also had this type of business. She also wanted to have a better income to be able to go to school. But now she has 2 children and she wants to improve their quality of life and to proviD. them with a good education. Thanks to her efforts and dedication she has purchased some products such as plates, spoons, a cabinet, a stove, and kitchen implements. Laura's dream is to sell clothing in wholesale. The loan that has been granted will be use to purchase merchandise. We know that Laura will meet her goals through handwork and effort and that the loans from Edaprospo (Kiva Field Partner) will help her.

loans.use: to purchase clothes for wholesale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase cheese curds, milk, cream, cheese, and yogurt.

loans.name: Canal De Bendicion 6 & 8 Group

texts.en:
Eliana is the coordinator of her group Canal de Bendicion 6 & 8 (Channel of Blessing).  Her group is located in the rural areas surrounding La Romana, where the economy is dominated by the sugarcane harvest. She makes her home here in a simple structure with her two children, taking care of them as a single mom.

Eliana is excited to be taking her fifth loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loan and expanding her business. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business selling fried food, by buying chicken, beef, flour, oil, and plantains. She operates a fried food stand where she cooks dinners for sale. She is saving her profits to improve her home by building her future house out of concrete block, which will provide more security. 

She enjoys being part of her group and sharing with them in different activities. Also her favorite thing to do is spend time with her two children.

loans.use: to buy chicken, beef, flour, oil, plantains, etc. for her fried food stand.

loans.name: Bernarda Beatriz

texts.es:
Bernarda de 23 años, vive en una zona peri-urbana en el Fortín de Guayaquil, su esposo le ayuda en el negocio y tienen 1 niño de un años y medio. Su actividad comercial es que tiene una panadería.

Empezó esta actividad por su esposo ya que el entro a un curso de panificador y empezaron poco a poco en su negocio. Labora junto a su esposo de 7H00 am a 20H00 pm. Con la ayuda del préstamo quiere comprar materiales de construcción tales como cemento bloque para adecuar su vivienda. En un futuro desea extender su panadería a otro sector y ayudar a sus hijos a que salgan adelante en sus estudios.
texts.en:
Bernarda is 23 years old and she lives in the suburban region of Fortin de Guayaquil. Her husband helps her with the business and they have a son who is 18 months old. Her business activity is a bakery. 

She started this business for her husband who was trained as a baker and they gradually started their business. She works alongside her husband from 7:00 a.m. to 8:00 p.m. With the help of the loan she will purchase construction materials such as cement and construction blocks to remodel their home. In the future she hopes to expand her bakery into another sector and to help her children advance in their studies.

loans.use: to purchase cement, sand, paints and to purchase ingredients for her bakery, including flour and eggs.

loans.name: Maria De La Concepcion

texts.es: Maria De La Concepción tiene 59 años. Doña Maria tiene 4 hijos de 2, 8, 17 y 18 años a su cargo. La actividad económica es la venta ropa, es una mujer muy luchadora y emprendedora, por lo que disfruta mucho de su negocio. Hace más de 16 años que  se dedica a este negocio, dio inicio a su pequeño negocio por el deseo de superación ya que tenía que mantener a sus hijos.  El financiamiento es destinado para capital de trabajo y el dinero será utilizado para la compra de vestidos, trajes, pantalones, camisas, faldas camisolas. El deseo de Maria es de proporcionarles a sus hijos la educación necesaria para que sean buenos profesionales.
texts.en: Maria De La Concepcion is 59 years old. Maria has 4 children in her care, aged 2, 8, 17, and 18. Her business activity is the sale of clothing. She is an achiever and a very enterprising woman who loves her business. She has been in business for more than 16 years. She started out her small business with the dream of improving, especially because she had to support her children. The loan will be used as working capital and the funds will be used to purchase dresses, suits, pants, shirts, skirts, and undergarments. Maria's dream is to provide her children with the education they need to have a good career.

loans.use: to purchase dresses, suits, pants, shirts, skirts, and undergarments.

loans.name: Gina Roselia

texts.es:
Gina de 37años, vive en una zona urbana en las Orquídeas (llamado así porque en su originalidad había muchas flores orquídeas) de Guayaquil. Su esposo trabaja en servicios de transporte y tienen dos hijos que estudian en escuela fiscales. su actividad comercail es la ventas de ropa.

Comenzó con un pequeño capital que tenia ahorra, y era representantes de las madres comunitarias donde pudo hacerse conocer y así es como emprendió su negocio de prendas de vestir. Labora desde las 9H00 am a 15H00 pm diariamente. Con la ayuda del préstamo quiere comprar mas mercadería como es pantalones, calzados, blusas. Su sueño es ver a sus hijos realizados profesionalmente y poder poner una pequeña boutique.
texts.en:
Gina is 37 years old and she lives in an urban region in Las Orquideas, meaning The Orchids (named as such for the orchids that were originally found in the region) in Guayaquil. Her husband works in transportation services and she has two children who attend community school. Her commercial activity is the sale of clothing.

She started out with a small working capital that she had saved. She was a representative of the mothers in the community so she got to be well known and this is how she started her clothing business. She works from 9:00 a.m. to 3:00 p.m. every day. Her dream is to see her children achieve careers and to set up a small boutique.

loans.use: to purchase $300 worth of pants, $400 worth of shoes, and $300 worth of blouses.

loans.name: Silvia Esperanza

texts.es: Silvia Esperanza tiene 52 años, su actividad económica es una pulpería. Hace más de 13 años que se dedica a esta actividad. Esta pequeña pulpería nace con la idea de buscar una forma de generar ingresos a su familia  pero como no tenía mucho dinero decidió buscar la forma en cómo invertir sus ahorros en víveres y venderlos a los vecinos. Poco a poco fue incrementando su tienda, aunque no cuenta con muchos productos ella sigue trabajando para incrementarlos, vende arroz, azúcar y aceite. Con el préstamo quiere comprar víveres como arroz, azúcar y aceites para su tienda, pues necesario para mantener a sus clientes.
texts.en: Silvia Esperanza is 52 years old and her business activity is a grocery store. She has been in business for more than 13 years. This small grocery store was born from an idea to find a source of income for the family since she did not have much money. She decided to look for a way to invest her savings, in purchasing grocery products and to sell them to the neighbors. Gradually she expanded her store and although she doesn't have many products she continues to work to increase her supply. she sells rice, sugar, and cooking oil. With the loan she wants to purchase grocery products such as rice, sugar, and cooking oil for her store. It is necessary to keep her clients.

loans.use: to purchase grocery products such as rice, sugar, and cookin oils.

loans.name: Janneth Catalina

texts.es:
La Señorita. Janneth  es socia del banco comunal Santa Ana, vive en la comunidad de Los Laures que  pertenece a la parroquia de Santa Ana, esta parroquia es de clima frió, tiene una hermosa vista de la ciudad de Cuenca y de la naturaleza, su gente se dedica a la cría de animales y a la agricultura, muchos laboran en la ciudad ejerciendo varias actividades.

Nuestra socia tiene 19 años, es soltera y tiene una hija de 2 años de edad, no tiene casa propia por lo que vive en casa de sus padres, su papá es de profesión chofer y su mamá se dedica a los quehaceres domésticos.

La Señorita Janneth se dedica a los quehaceres del hogar y a la cría y venta de animales, tiene pollos y cerdos.

Se encuentra en su segundo crédito que realiza en el banco comunal al cual fue invitada por su mamá. Su nuevo crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de pollos y cerdos para crecer en esta actividad.

Su meta es viajar a España.
texts.en:
Janneth is a member of the communal bank Santa Ana. She lives in the community of Los Laures, belonging to the district of Santa Ana. It is a cold climate district and it has a beautiful view of the city of Cuenca and the natural surroundings. The population is made up of livestock farmers and agriculturists. Many work in the city in various business activities.

She is 19 years old, single, and she has a 2 year-old daughter. She doesn't have a house of her own so she lives with her parents. Her father is a driver by trade and her mother takes care of the household obligations.

Janneth takes care of the household obligations and she raises and sells livestock. She has poultry and pigs.

Her goal is to travel to Spain.

loans.use: to purchase poultry and pigs.

loans.name: María Laura

texts.es:
La Señora. María es socia del banco comunal Santa Ana, vive en la parroquia de  Santa Ana, esta parroquia es de clima frió, tiene una hermosa vista de la ciudad de Cuenca y de la naturaleza, su gente se dedica a la cría de animales y a la agricultura, muchos laboran en la ciudad ejerciendo varias actividades.

La Señora María tiene 59 años, es casada y tienen 3 hijos, dos mayores de edad que son  casados e independientes, su último hijo es soltero y trabaja para sus gastos. Su esposo labora como guardia de seguridad, con el trabajo conyugal han logrado construir su casa propia.

Doña María se dedica a los quehaceres de su hogar en donde aprovecha su tiempo para criar animales como: gallinas, cerdos y vacas. Sus animales los vende en su propia comunidad.
 
Es una socia fundadora del banco comunal y le gusta ya que tiene muy buenas amigas en la banca. El dinero de su crédito lo va  a invertir en la compra de ganado.
 
Su meta es tener mas animales para la cría.
texts.en:
Maria is a member of the communal bank Santa Ana. She lives in the community of Santa Ana. It is a cold climate district and it has a beautiful view of the city of Cuenca and the natural surroundings. The population is made up of livestock farmers and agriculturists. Many work in the city in various business activities.

She is 59 years old, married, and she has 3 children, two of whom are grown, married, and independent. Her youngest child is single and works to cover his expenses. Her husband works as a security guard. With their combined work they have managed to build a house of their own. 

She takes care of the household obligations and she takes advantage of her time to raise livestock, such as: poultry, pigs, and cows. Her livestock are sold in her own community. 

She is a founding member of the communal bank and she enjoys having many good friends in the bank. The funds from her loan will be invested in the purchase of cattle.

Her goal is to have more livestock to raise.

loans.use: to purchase cattle.

loans.name: Cristo Y Nuestro Esfuerzo 4 & 8 Group

texts.en:
Junette is the coordinator of her group, Cristo y nuestro esfuerzo 4 & 8 (Christ and our effort). She makes her home here in a simple structure with her long term partner. She says that her most difficult challenge is saving enough money to buy a house. In the meantime she plans to continue enjoying her business.

Junette is excited to be taking a second loan with Esperanza. She has had her business for three and a half years, starting with a loan she took from a friend. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business by buying clothes for sale in her house and through walking around in the community. She will save the profits, because through this business she wants to make her dreams come true, which is to have her own house.

She needed to improve her business by investing more capital, but now she knows Esperanza Internacional.  As a result she has the opportunity to improve her business by taking loans, making good investments, and paying every payment.

Junette´s group is located in the rural area surrounding La Romana, where the sugarcane harvest and tourist industry dominate the economy. She thanks all of you for your support!!!

loans.use: to buy clothing for resale.

loans.name: Fanny Yolanda

texts.es:
La Señora. Fanny es socia del banco comunal Santa Ana, vive en la parroquia de Santa Ana, esta parroquia es de clima frió, tiene una hermosa vista de la ciudad de Cuenca y de la naturaleza, su gente se dedica a la cría de animales y a la agricultura, muchos laboran en la ciudad ejerciendo varias actividades.

Doña Fanny tiene 38 años, es casada y tiene 3 hijos de 16, 11 y 6 años de edad, su primer hijo estudia en el colegio y sus dos últimos hijos en la escuela. Su esposo es chofer profesional y tiene su propio bus en el que trabaja, tienen casa propia que es el fruto del trabajo conyugal.

La Señora. Fanny se dedica a la cría y venta de animales como: pollos y cerdos que son para su consumo y también los vende en su comunidad cuando tiene  alguna necesidad económica. Hace un mes está trabajando como empleada domestica medio día y de lunes a viernes.
 
El dinero de su nuevo crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de pollos y en su alimento.

Su sueño es no tener deudas.
texts.en:
Fanny is a member of the communal bank Santa Ana. She lives in the community of Santa Ana. It is a cold climate district and it has a beautiful view of the city of Cuenca and the natural surroundings. The population is made up of livestock farmers and agriculturists. Many work in the city in various business activities.

Fanny is 38 years old, married, and she has 3 children, aged 16, 11, and 6. Her eldest son is in high school and her two youngest are in primary school. Her husband is a professional driver and he has his own bus with which to work. They have a house of their own, a product of their combined effort.

Fanny raises and sells livestock, such as: poultry and pigs.  They are for their own consumption and she also sells them to the community when they have the financial need. She has been working as a janitor for the past month, working half days from Monday to Friday. 

The funds from her new loan will be invested in the purchase of poultry and their feed.

Her dream is to no longer have debts.

loans.use: to purchase poultry and their feed.

loans.name: Hida Maria

texts.es: Hida Maria de 46 años, es una mujer carismática y trabajadora, vive en su casa propia, con sus tres hijos. Con mucho esfuerzo, lleva adelante su negocio que es la venta de tortillas. Todos los días tiene que levantarse temprano para empezar a preparar sus tortillas. Este crédito será para la compra de materia prima como maíz, cal, leña, comal, bolsas y otras cosas. Así comprará más productos necesarios para abastecer la demanda de sus clientes.
texts.en: Hida Maria is 46 years old and she is a very charismatic and hardworking woman. She lives in a house of her own together with her three children. With a great deal of effort she manages her business selling tortillas. She has to get up early every day to start making her tortillas. This loan will be used to purchase products such as corn, lime, firewood, a grill, bags, and other items. She will be able to purchase more products that she needs to be able to supply her clients' demands.

loans.use: to purchase corn, lime, firewood, a grill, bags, and other products for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to build a wall on her property.

loans.name: Transito De Jesús

texts.es:
La Señora. Transito es socia del banco comunal Despertar, vive por la parroquia de Baños,  esta parroquia es muy visitada por sus aguas termales que son aprovechadas en piscinas, tiene muchos lugares turísticos, su gente se dedica al comercio, a la agricultura  y cría de animales, esta parroquia tiene una gran variedad en su gastronomía  la que cautiva el paladar de propios y visitantes.

Doña Transito tiene 55 años, es casada y tiene 5 hijos mayores de edad, cuatro son casados y tiene un solo hijo soltero quien le ayuda económicamente. Su esposo es de profesión chofer y también se dedica al comercio, no tienen casa propia por lo que vive en casa de uno de sus hijos.

La Señora Transito se dedica al comercio de mariscos hace 20 años, su producto lo vende recorriendo la ciudad y también tiene un puesto en un mercado. En sus tiempos libres se dedica a la venta de ropa y de cosméticos de la marca Yanbal, esta actividad la realiza hace 15 años y sus clientes le realizan pedidos en su hogar.
 
En el banco comunal esta hace 6 años y su crédito lo va a invertir para comprar productos para sus negocios.

Su sueño es conservar su salud para continuar con su trabajo.
texts.en:
Transito is a member of the communal bank Despertar, meaning To Wake. She lives in the community of Banos. This community is highly visited for its thermal waters that are fed into pools. There are many tourist locations. The population is dedicated to commerce, agriculture, and livestock farming. This district has a wide range of foods that captivates the palate of the local population and visitors alike.

Transito is 55 years old, married, and she has 5 grown children. Four are married and only one of her sons is single and he helps her financially. Her husband is a driver by trade and he is also a merchant. They don't have a house of their own which is why they live with one of their children. 

Transito has been a seafood merchant for 20 years. She sells her products by traveling throughout the city and she also has a stand in the market. During her spare time she sells Yanbal brand clothing and cosmetics. She has had this business for 15 years and her clients place their orders at her home.

She has been in her communal bank for the past 6 years and she will invest her loan to purchase products for her businesses.

Her dream is to retain her health to be able to keep working.

loans.use: to purchase Yanbal brand clothign and cosmetics, and seafood.

loans.name: Marcial Heriberto

texts.es: El  Sr. Marcial acudió con nosotros para solicitar nuestra ayuda para mejorar la barda  de  su  domicilio ya que  la  que  tiene actualmente  es muy pequeña y  tiene  miedo  que  su  hijo  se  pueda salir del  domicilio  ocasionando  un accidente,  además   le   gustaría   instalar  un portón  para la  mayor  seguridad  de  su  domicilio,  agradece   el  apoyo  brindado  para  la  realización de  su proyecto.
texts.en: Marcial approached us to request our help to improve a wall in her house. The one that is there is very small and they are afraid that their son might be able to get out, causing an accident. She would also like to install a gate to increase the safety of their home. She is thankful for the support provided for their project.

loans.use: to build a wall on their property.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase rice, cooking oil, beef meat, pork meat, instant soups, bathroom tissue, detergents, beans, juices, soft drinks, and charcoal.

loans.name: María Eulalia

texts.es:
La Señora. María es socia del banco comunal Despertar, vive por los alrededores de la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad es la tercera ciudad mas importante del país, sus casas se mezclan entre lo colonial y lo moderno, su gente mantienen su cultura y tradiciones.
 
La Señora. María tiene 43 años, es madre soltera de 2 hijos de 20 y 18 años de edad, su primer hijo trabaja y le ayuda económicamente, su segundo hijo estudia en un colegio de la ciudad. No tiene casa propia por lo que vive arrendando.
 
Doña María hace 3 años trabaja como empleada domestica medio día y de lunes a viernes. En su tiempo libre se dedica a la fabricación de carteras, aprendió este oficio gracias a una amiga que le enseño, su producto lo vende a sus amigas y conocidas.
 
Este es su primer crédito que realiza en el banco comunal al cual fue invitada por una amiga que es socia activa. El dinero de su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de materia prima para la elaboración de sus carteras.
 
Su sueño es tener casa propia.
texts.en:
Maria is a member of the communal bank Despertar, meaning To Wake. She lives in the suburban region of the city of Cuenca. This city is the third most important in the country. The houses are a blend of the colonial and modern styles. The people retain their culture and traditions.

Maria is 43 years old, a single mother of 2 children, aged 20 and 18. Her eldest son works and helps her financially. Her youngest son attends school in the city. They don't own their own house so they rent.

Maria has been a janitor for the past 3 years, working half days from Monday to Friday. In her spare time she makes purses, having learned the business from a friend who taught her. She sells her product to her friends and acquaintances.

This is the first loan she has with her communal bank. She was invited to join by a friend who is an active member. The funds form her loan will be invested in the purchase of materials to make her purses. 

He dream is to have a her own home.

loans.use: to purchase materials to make purses.

loans.name: Silvia Teresa

texts.es:
Silvia tiene su propio negocio la venta de ropa y cosméticos, con más de cuatro años de experiencia, siendo su oficio costurera, pero por motivo de ganar un poco más, comienza  a vender cosméticos,  lo que se ha ayudado mucho, y que gracias a los financiamiento de Afodenic, ha comprado mas cosméticos, ropa, zapatos,  así como mejoras a su pequeña casa.
El objetivo de Silvia es la mejora a su vivienda, que ha venido mejorando poco debido a otros gastos de familia, ya ahora tiene un bebe de 18 meses de nacido y requiere más cuidado.
Hoy con este nuevo préstamo será para el cambio de techo, el marco es de cuartones de madera, ahora pondrá perlines que es más seguro, laminas de zinc nuevo, golosos entre otros para comenzar la obra.
texts.en:
Silvia has her own business selling clothing and cosmetics and she has more than four years' experience. She is a seamstress by trade but with the objective to earn a little more money she started to sell cosmetics and it has helped her very much. Thanks to the loans from Afodenic (Kiva Field Partner) she has purchase more cosmetics, clothing, and shoes, and she has also made some improvements to her small house.

Silvia's objective is to improve her home. She has been doing few improvements because of other family expenses. She now has an 18 month old baby and he needs more care. 

With this new loan she will replace the roofing. The frame is made of wood and now she will be able to use steel, which is safer. She will purchase new zinc sheets and she will cover the labor expenses to start the project.

loans.use: to purchase materials to replace the roof on her house.

loans.name: Elvia Maria

texts.es:
Elvia de 38 años, es una mujer trabajadora que tiene su negocio hace varios años atrás, ya que su esposo es chofer y ella le quiere ayudar con los gastos de su familia. Poco a poco ha incrementado los víveres de la tienda. 

En la actualidad trabaja de lunes a domingo desde las 07h00am hasta las 21h00pm todos los días. Vende la libra de arroz a $ 0.33, la libra de azúcar a $ 0.35. Tiene muchas aspiraciones en su tienda por eso quiere continuar trabajando y surtiéndola con mercadería y víveres variados.  Por eso quiere el préstamo para poder comprar arroz, azúcar y harina. En el futuro quiere incrementar la mercadería del local.
texts.en:
Elvia is 38 years old and she is a very hard working woman who has had a business for the past several years. Her husband is a driver and she wants to help with the family's expenses. Gradually she increased the grocery products in her store.

She works from Monday to Sunday from 7:00 am to 9:00 pm every day. She sells rice for $0.33 per found, and sugar for $0.35 per pound. She has many aspirations for her store which is why she wants to keep working and adding variety with merchandise and various products. She wants this loan to purchase rice, sugar, and flour. In the future she wants to increase the merchandise in her store.

loans.use: to purchaser rice, sugar, and flour.

loans.name: Mónica Patricia

texts.es:
La Señora Mónica es socia del banco comunal Despertar, vive por los alrededores de la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad es la tercera ciudad más importante del país, sus casas se mezclan entre lo colonial y lo moderno, su gente mantienen su cultura y tradiciones.
 
Doña Mónica tiene 31 años, es madre soltera de dos hijos de 12 y 7 años de edad, su primera hija estudia en el colegio y su segundo hijo en una escuelita de la ciudad. No tienen casa propia por lo que vive arrendando y comparten los gastos del hogar con su mamá.
 
La Señora. Mónica trabaja medio día en el arreglo de departamentos, unas veces en las mañanas y otras en las tardes.

Este es su primer crédito que realiza en el banco comunal al cual fue invitada por su hermana. El dinero de su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de ropa  para iniciar con este negocio.

Su meta es superarse y crecer poco a poco en el negocio que va a iniciar.
texts.en:
Monica is a member of the communal bank Despertar, meaning To Wake. She lives in the suburban region of the city of Cuenca. This city is the third most important in the country. The houses are a blend of the colonial and modern styles. The people retain their culture and traditions.

Monica is 31 years old and the single mother of two children, aged 12 and 7. Her eldest daughter is in high school and her youngest son is in primary school in the city. They don't have a house of their own so she rents and she shares the household expenses with her mother. 

Monica works half days in providing janitorial services for apartments. Sometimes she works in the mornings and other times in the afternoons.

This is the first loan she has with her communal bank. She was invited to join by her sister. The funds from this loan will be invested in the purchase of clothing to start a business.

Her goal is to improve herself and to gradually grow with her new business.

loans.use: to purchase clothing for resale.

loans.name: Maria Elia

texts.es: La Sra. María  es una persona muy responsable ella tiene un negocio de abarrotes en el  cual ella quiere invertir  para satisfacer las necesidades de su clientela, ella  esta casada con el Sr. Roberto los  cuales  juntos  atienden  su  negocio , ellos se preocupan  enormemente por el bienestar de su pequeño hijo que aun depende de ellos es  por  eso que  agradecen el apoyo   brindado para  la realización de  su proyecto   ya  que   gracias  a esto podrán  ofrecer  a  su   familia  una mejor  calidad  de   vida.
texts.en: Maria is a very responsible woman. She has a grocery store business in which she wants to invest to satisfy the needs of her clients. She is married with Roberto and together they manage their business. They are enormously attentive to the wellbeing of their young son who still depends on them. For this reason they are thankful for the support provided for the realization of their project. It is thanks to this that they will be able to offer their family with a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy groceries and tinware to sell.

loans.name: Kory Jaulitas Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “KORY JAULITAS” iniciará el ciclo décimo cuarto en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Germán Busch.  Está compuesta por ocho integrantes, la asociación comunal está dirigida por una mesa directiva a la cabeza de la señora  Virginia.   Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: comercio, producción y servicio de comida y tejido de máquina
 
La señora Virginia indica que hace un año que integra una asociación comunal en Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de una amiga. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de tejido en máquina que viene trabajando con la ayuda de su esposo iniciando este con la compra de la máquina de tejer.
 
El crédito que sacará ahora es para aumentar su capital (compra de lana) que lo venderá por mayor en las ferias. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar en lo posible a su familia, pues ella es casada y tiene dos hijos.

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta salud
texts.en:
The communal bank "Kory Jaulitas" will start their tenth loan cycle with Pro Mujer (Kiva Field Partner) as part of Centro Focal German Busch. It is made up of eight members. The communal bank is directed by a board of directors, headed by Virginia. The businesses of the members of the communal bank are various, and among them are: commerce, production, and catering, and knitting.

The loan that she requests now will be used to increase her capital (to purchases yarn) to sell in wholesale at the fairs. this form of work helps her to generate an income to support her family in what possible. She is married and she has two children.  

When she was asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she said that she appreciates the health care.

loans.use: to purchase yarn.

loans.name: Yaneth Del Socorro

texts.es:
Yaneth de 50 años tiene un negocio a través del cual vende almuerzos, ella vive en el barrio los Calamares,   es casada y tiene 4 hijos en las edades de 11 a 28 años de edad, familia con la que sueña un futuro lleno de prosperidad.
Hace 10 años  limpió un lugar donde estaba ubicado un basurero,  le puso una capa de cemento e inició vendiendo sopas  en ese sitio, muy pronto los clientes empezaron a reconocerla, hasta que logró organizar un kiosco y posteriormente aprovechó su tiempo libre para vender minutos a celulares y adicionalmente agregó dulces enfocando su mercado también a los niños, actividades con las que empezó a producir otros ingresos. En la actualidad planea hacer desayunos porque sabe que hay un mercado potencial  l que nadie ha explorado y  este servicio no existe   en la zona, esta es la razón, esta es la razón  por la cual acude a su credikiva,  primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el cual comprará materias primas e insumos para la preparación de sus deliciosos desayunos y obtendrá descuentos por compras en efectivo y por volumen que le permitirán disminuir un poco más sus costos de producción. Su mayor desafío es el poco capital de trabajo con el que cuenta porque para invertir debe obtener unas utilidades superiores por encima de sus gastos personales y en esto está trabajando persistentemente hasta lograrlo.
texts.en: Yaneth is 50 years old and she has a business through which she sells breakfast foods. She lives in the community of Los Calamares. She is married and she has 4 children aged between 11 and 28. She dreams of having a prosperous future with her family. Ten years ago she cleaned what was a garbage dump. She put in a cement slab and she started selling soups from this location. Very soon her clients started to known her. She even managed to set up a kiosk and later she decided to profit from her time by selling prepaid cellular phone cards and sweets to target children as her market. She started to earn additional income through these businesses. Currently she plans on serving breakfast because she knows there is a potential market that no one has explored. This service does not exist in the region and for this reason she has requested a Kiva loan. It is her first loan with Fundacion Mario Santo Domingo (Kiva Field Partner) and with it she will purchase products and ingredients she uses to prepare her delicious breakfast foods. She will obtain discounts for purchases paid for in cash and for the volume bought. She will be able to decrease her production costs a little more. Her greatest challenge is the small working capital she has to work with. She wants to invest in the purchase of better tools in addition to covering her personal expenses. And for this she is persistently working to achieve.

loans.use: to purchase products and ingredients she needs to prepare breakfast foods.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase construction material to set up a corral.

loans.name: Maria Elizabeth

texts.es:
María tiene su propio negocio, un restaurante que ha vendió esforzándose con empeño para el bienestar comun de la familia.
Desde hace varios años comenzo con ayuda de sus padre lo que ha venido trabajando ahora con financiamiento que la institución ha dado, en siete ciclos, en donde ha invertido en mas inventario, generándole ventas más alta, como compra de utensilio para preparación de los mismos alimentos.
Su objetivo es mantener equilibradas sus ventas, ya que son muchos los compromisos de pagos, para eso, mejora cada día diversos platillos de comida para mantener la captación de clientes.
Con esta nueva inversión del préstamo en Afodenic, hará compra de granos básicos, en arroz, frijoles, azúcar, carne roja, pollo, queso, verduras, frutas, bidones de aceite, con el fin de poder seguir mejorando la demanda de los clientes, a si como poder vender más para poder, pagar sus gastos básicos, como personales. Todo esto con el apoyo financiero de los financiamientos se ha hecho posible.
texts.en:
Maria has her own restaurant business in which she has been investing her efforts and commitment for the general wellbeing of the family.

Several years ago she started out with her father but now she has been working with loans from the institution over the past seven loan cycles. She has invested in acquiring more inventory and it generated higher sales. She purchased utensils to help her prepare her foods.

Her objective is to keep her sales steady, especially because she has many payments. For this reason she tires to continually improve the various recipes to maintain the interest of her clients. 

With this new investment from the loan from Afodenic (Kiva Field Partner) she will purchase basic grains, rice, beans, sugar, red meats, chicken, cheese, vegetables, fruits, and tubs of cooking oil. Her goal is to keep increasing client demand and to increase her sales to cover her basic and personal expenses. All of this has been made possible thanks to the financial support.

loans.use: to invest in the purchase of basic grains, meats, chicken, dairy products, vegetables, and fruits to keep preparing her delicious recipes.

loans.name: Segundo Wilmer

texts.es:
Segundo es un hombre soltero de 29 años de edad, vive en casa de sus padres, la cual cuenta con servicio de agua y luz, ubicada en el distrito de Reque a unos 15 minutos de la  provincia de Chiclayo.  Esta zona es rural y la actividad que desarrollan sus pobladores es la agricultura y ganadería.

Segundo se dedica ha manejar su mototaxi (transporte utilizado por las personas en rutas pequeñas), en la tarde en su distrito, ya que en las mañanas se dedica ha las labores agrícolas, ya quecuenta conunos terrenos donde siembra verduras y una vez que cosecha lo vende a diferentes comerciantes que se dedican a la venta de verduras en los mercados de la ciudad de Chiclayo.  Sus ingresos es para ayudar en las obligaciones diariasd de la casa de sus padres.
