Ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 3000 nuevos soles para brindar algunas mejoras en su terreno de cultivo con elque cuenta, para la compra de abonos para preparar sus tierras y empezar a sembrar y  brindar mantenimiento a su mototaxi que es su herramienta de trabajo, la cual también le permite movilizarse más rápido a ver sus terrenos.  Segundo es una persona muy responsable y trabajador que con esfuerzo trata de salir adelante y darle algunas comodidades a sus padres que siempre lo han ayudado en todo momento.
texts.en:
Segundo is a single man, 29 years old, and he lives with his parents. It is equipped with running water and electricity and it is located in the district of Reque, at about 15 minutes from the provide of Chiclayo. This is a rural region and the population are involved in agriculture and farming.

Segundo drives his motorcycle transport (a transport used by passengers for short distances) in the afternoons in his district. In the mornings he carries out his agricultural work. He has a few plots of land where he plants vegetables. Once he does the harvest he sells his products to the merchants who sell vegetables at the markets in the city of Chiclayo. His earnings are used to help with the daily obligations incurred by his parents' household.

He has requested a loan from Edpyme Alternativa (Kiva Field Partner) in the amount of 3000 nuevos soles to provide a few improvements to his farm land. He will purchase fertilizers to prepare his land and to start planting. He will also provide some maintenance to his motorcycle transportation, which is his work tool. He also uses it to travel faster to check on his fields. Segundo is a very responsible and hardworking person who tries to move forward through his invested effort and to provide his parents with a few comforts. They have always been his support.

loans.use: to carry out maintenance on his motorcycle and to purchase fertilizer for his farm land

loans.name: Luz Divina Group

texts.es:
El grupo Luz Divina esta integrado por 5 mujeres las cuales tienen negocios propios, se conocen muy bien entre ellas mismas y viven en la misma aldea, sus casas están cercanas la una con la otra. La apariencia de sus negocios es buena, lo que nos indica que han tenido un crecimiento del mismo y han mejorado sus condiciones de vida.

A continuacion se detallan las diferentes actividades que ellas realizan:

CELSA DE JESUS se dedica a la venta de productos de consumo popular y tambien presta los servicios de moler maiz.
la mayoria de las ventas son al credito ya que son personas obreras las que viven en dicha zona y que trabajan en fincas de ganado, fincas de Tomates y Chiles Dulce, los trabajadores es al negocio de ella que llegan a sacar los productos al credito.
La Sra. Celsa esta casada y actualmente de su matrimonio dependen 3 hijos.
el credito lo utilizara para la compra de abarroteria como ser Azúcar, arroz, manteca, jabón, maseca, papel higiénico, café, espaguetis, salsa, margarina, sardinas, pollo, sopas instantáneas, huevos, refrescos, y otros.

la sra. MARIA MARLENY se dedica a la venta de granos basicos Maíz y Frijoles, actividad que realiza en su casa de habitación.

la sra. YAHAIRA CAROLINA  se dedica a la venta de productos de consumo popular, tiene una pulperia en su casa de habitacion.
Su negocio opera bajo el nombre de Pulpería la “Bendición” con más de un año de experiencia y administración del mismo.
Ella se ha sabido ganar la clientela por los precios que ofrece y por la atención y amabilidad con que atiende los mismos.

la sra. GLADYZ CECILIA tiene una pulperia en su casa de habitacion en donde vende todo lo relacionado con los productos de la canasta basica familiar.
Su negocio opera bajo el nombre de Pulpería “FATIMA” con Dos años de experiencia y administración del mismo.
Ella se ha sabido ganar la clientela por los precios que ofrece y por la atención y amabilidad con que atiende los mismos.

la sra. GLADIS MIGUELINA se dedica a la venta de ropa americana, su negocio lo lleva a cabo en su casa de habitación, pero la mayoría de sus ventas las realiza de manera ambulante, sale a vender su mercadería en las comunidades de El Barro, Suyatillo, la Maquina y la Chorrera.

todas necesitan el credito para salir adelante con sus negocios y sus familias.
texts.en:
The group Luz Divina is made up of 5 women who own their own businesses.  They all know each other very well as they live in the same neighborhood and their houses are close to one another.  Their businesses appear to be doing well which tells us that they have grown and thus, improved their living conditions.  The following are the details of their different activities:

Celsa de Jesus sells popular consumer products and also has a corn milling service.  The majority of her sales are on credit as her customers are workers  who live in the area and work on the livestock farms and the farms that grow tomatoes and sweet peppers.  Señora Celsa is married and has 3 children.  She will use the loan to buy grocery products such as sugar, rice, lard, soap, corn flour, toilet paper, coffee, pastas, sauce, margarine, sardines, chicken, instant soups, soft drinks and other things.

Señora Maria Marleny sells basic grains like corn as well as beans from home. 

Señora Yahaira Carolina sells popular consumer products and has a small store in her house.  She has been running her business under the name "Bendición" [Blessing] for more than a year now.  She brings in customers by offering good prices and friendly service. 

Señora Gladyz Cecelia has a store in her house where she sells basic family items.  She has been running her business under the name "Fatima" for two years.  She brings in customers by offering good prices and friendly service.

Señora Gladis Miguelina sells Ameican clothing.  She runs her business out of her house, but she makes the majority of he sales as a street vendor.  She sells her merchandise in the communities of El Barro, Suyatillo, La Maquina and La Chorrera.   

All of these women need a loan to succeed in their businesses and get their families ahead.

loans.use: purchase sugar, rice, lard, soap, corn flour, toilet paper, coffee, pastas, sauce, margarine, sardines, chicken, instant soups, eggs, soft drinks, corn beans, sausage and American clothing.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Jessica Marianela

texts.es:
Jessica de 27 años es madre de familia, vive en casa propia con su esposo e hijos, cuenta con todos los servicios básicos, ubicada en el distrito de Tambogrande, que se encuentra a unos 40 minutos aproximadamente de distancia del departamento de Piura.  Las cuales  se caracterizan por la actividad agricola, ganadera, artesana de sus pobladores.

Jessica se dedica a la venta de ropa y bisutería, negocio que a colocado en su domicilio desde hace 2 años, pero también deja sus productos en otros caseríos quincenalmente, tratando de tener mayor demanda de clientes y así pueda obtener más ingresos para solventar sus  gastos familiares.

Al observar Jessica que su negocio cada día es más próspero a creído necesario solicitar un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 1500 nuevos soles para comprar mayor cantidad de mercadría y abastecer su negocio con productos innovadores, con la finalidad que su clientela siga aumentando para poder pagar su crédito y mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia, de una manera responsable y con mucho empeño.
texts.en:
Jessica is 27 years old and she is the mother of a family. She lives in a house of her own together with her husband and her children. Their house is equipped with all of the basic services and it is located in the district of Tambogrande, at approximately 40 minutes from the department of Piura. It is known for its population involved agriculture, farming, and crafts.

Jessica has been selling clothing and jewelry, a business located in her house, for the past 2 years. But she also travels to other communities biweekly to sell her products in order to have a larger demand by clients and to earn more income to cover her family's expenses.

Jessica observed that her business is more successful every day so she believes it necessary to request a loan from Edpyme Alternativa (Kiva Field Partner) in the amount of 1500 nuevos soles. She will purchase a greater quantity of merchandise and to supply her business with innovative products with the goal of increasing her clientele. She will be able to repay her loan and to improve the quality of life for her family in a responsible and very dedicated way.

loans.use: to purchase a larger quantity of clothing and jewelry merchandise for her business.

loans.name: Rosas De Villa Ingenio Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “ROSAS DE VILLA INGENIO” iniciará el ciclo número cuarto en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Germán Busch.  Está compuesta por ocho integrantes, la asociación comunal está dirigida por una mesa directiva a la cabeza de la señora  María.   Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: comercio, producción de artesanías, producción de cuero, carpintería, servicio de comida y tejido de máquina
 
La señora María indica que hace veinte años que integra una asociación comunal en Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de una promotora. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de elaboración de artesanías en cuero desde hace veinticinco años
 
El crédito que sacará ahora es para aumentar su capital (material de cuero)para la elaboración de las carteras, las que venderá por mayor en diferentes lugares, ya que viaja para vende sus productos a diferentes lugares. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar en lo posible a su familia, pues ella es casada y tiene tres hijos
texts.en:
The “Rosas de Villa Ingenio" community bank is about to start its fourth loan cycle with Pro Mujer, as part of the Germán Busch regional office.  The group has eight members and is run by a board of directors which is led by María.  The businesses that the members of the bank carry out are varied and include: commerce, making handicrafts, leather production, carpentry, a meals service and machine knitting.

María tells us that she has been working in Pro Mujer community banks for twenty years.  She was invited to join by a promoter.  She has a business making handicrafts from leather which she has had for twenty-five years.

María will use the loan that she is requesting to increase her capital by purchasing leather which she will use to make billfolds that she will then sell wholesale.  She travels to different places to sell her products.  This work enables her to make money with which to support her family.  María is married and has three children.

loans.use: to buy leather

loans.name: Maria Esther

texts.es:
Maria de 33 años, es una mujer trabajadora que tiene muchas aspiraciones con su negocio de venta de  comida ya que esta separada de su esposo y tiene dos niños que están estudiando aun en la escuela. 

Trabaja todos los dias desde muy temprano para poder solventar los gastos de sus hijos. Vende comida en una carreta que tiene. Vende comida rápida como papas con pollo, hamburguesa etc. Tiene muchas aspiraciones con su negocio por eso quiere el préstamo para poder comprar cemento, bloques y construir un local para tener un negocio fijo y ya no en la carreta y así mejorar el ingreso de su familia.
texts.en:
Maria is 33 years old.  She is a hard-working woman who has a lot of ambitions as regards her meal business.  She is separated from her husband and has two children who are still in school.

Maria works every day, from very early in the morning, so that she can cover her children's expenses.  She sells fast food such as chicken and fries, burgers etc. from a cart.  Maria has many ambitions in her business and would like this loan so that she can buy cement and blocks with which to build premises so that she can have a fixed business location and no longer have to sell from her cart.  This will improve her family's income.

loans.use: to buy cement and blocks

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy driver- and passenger-side doors

loans.name: Reyna

texts.es:
La señora Reyna vive en el estado de veracruz en una comunidad llamada Tierra Blanca o mejor conocida como la novia del sol, la cual se caracteriza por ser una zona cañera y sus abuandantes calores en verano  de hasta 54°c. doña Reyna tiene la edad de 47 años de edad solo estudio la primaria, ella es casada y tiene tres hijos de los cuales dos son mujeres y uno es hombre, actualmente solo estudia la mas pequeña de sus hijas de nombre Barbara que tiene 17 años y estudia la preparatoria.

Doña Reyna nos platica que hace algunos años su esposo y ella construyeron en el patio de su casa unos cuartos los cuales rentan, nos dice que hace un par de años llegaron a vivir a sus cuartos de renta unos señores que viene de distintos estados y trabajan en Barcel los cuales le pidieron el favor de que le vendiera comida todos los dias (de lunes a domingo) 3 veces por semana y ella para ganarse algunos pesos acepto,  gracias a eso ahora tiene dos negocios la venta de comida y de cuartos.

Ella necesita este credito para inverlo en la compra de insumos (chiles, tomates, cebolla, carne, frijol, arroz, aceite tortillas, leche, gas, azucar, sal y cafe) para la preparacion de su comida y posteriormente venderla tambien ocupara un poco en la remodelacion de sus viviendas de renta.

Ella espera que con esta invercion su negocio prospere ya que desea darle a sus hijos una mejor calidad de vida y a la mas pequeña de sus hijas darle la oportunidad de estudiar una profesion.
texts.en:
Reyna lives in the State of Veracruz, in a community called Tierra Blanca which is better known as 'La Novia del Sol' (The Sun's Bride).  It is noted for being an area where sugarcane is grown and also for the intense heat it experiences in the summer when temperatures reach 54°C  (129°F).  Reyna is 47 years old and has an elementary school level of education.  She is married and has three children (two daughters and one son).  Currently, only her youngest daughter Barbara is still in school.  She is 17 years old and in high school.

Reyna tells us that some years ago she and her husband built some rooms in the area outside their home which they rent out.  She tells us that a few years ago some gentlemen came to live in these rental rooms.  The men came from different States and worked for Barcel.  They asked her if she would be good enough to sell them meals every day (from Monday to Sunday), three times a day, and she accepted in order to make some extra money.  Thanks to this, she now has two businesses: selling meals and renting rooms.

Reyna needs this loan to invest in buying supplies (chilis, tomatoes, onions, meat, beans, rice, oil, tortillas, milk, gas, sugar, salt and coffee) so that she can prepare and sell her meals.  She will also remodel her rental rooms a little.  

Reyna hopes that this investment will enable her business to prosper since she would like to provide her children with a better quality of life and would like to give her youngest daughter the opportunity to study for a career.

loans.use: to sell meals and rent out rooms

loans.name: Bacilia

texts.es:
Bacilia es socia del Banco Comunal “Hermanas de Choquetanca II” ubicado en el distrito de Ilave, provincia El Colla y departamento de Puno, tiene 34 años de edad, de está casada y tiene cuatro hijos.  La señora no cuenta con estudios.
Desde hace un ciclo trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos.  Su préstamo inicial de S/. 500.00 nuevos soles, lo invirtió en su negocio de compra y venta de animales domésticos como ganados vacunos ovinos y porcinos.
En la actualidad solicitará  un nuevo préstamo por la suma S/. 1000.00 nuevos soles, dinero que invertirá en la compra de dos ovinos, dos chanchos, también cuenta que se dedica a la chacra como papa, quinua y chuño.  La señora trabaja sola en su negocio ya que su esposo trabaja en una mina en Arequipa.
Su sueño es mejorar el negocio y sobre todo mejorar sus ganancias.	
Le gusta del Banco Comunal son las reuniones el intercambio de palabras con las socias.
texts.en:
Bacilia is a member of the "Hermanas de Choquetanca II” community bank which is located in Ilave district, in El Colla province, in Puno department.  She is 34 years old, married, and has four children.  She did not attend school.

Bacilia has been working with Movimiento Manuela Ramos for one loan cycle.  Her initial loan was for 500 Peruvian soles and she invested that money in her business buying and selling animals such as cows, sheep and pigs.

Bacilia is currently requesting a new loan for 1,000 soles which she will invest in buying two sheep and two pigs.  She tells us that she also grows potatoes, quinoa and chuño.  She works alone in her business since her husband works in a mine in Arequipa.

Bacilia's dream is to improve her business and, above all, to improve her profits.  What she enjoys most about her community bank is talking to her fellow members.

loans.use: to buy livestock - two sheep and two pigs

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to install a front gate

loans.name: Blanca Roxanna

texts.es:
Blanca tiene 20 años de edad, soltera sin hijos a cargo. Vive en casa de sus padres, la cual está ubicada en el Caserío Chacupe bajo, el cual es un caserío pequeño rural que pertenece al distrito de la Victoria.  Cuentan con servicio de luz y el agua que consumen es de un pozo. 

Se dedica a la Agricultura, la crianza de animales de engorde  y venta de los mismos, pero su actividad principal es realizar labores artesanales.Blanca  se dedica a la confección de sombreros de palma, tiene más de 05 años en dicha actividad.  Los sombreros  que ella confecciona son vendidos en la ciudad de Monsefú a comerciantes mayoristas de artesanía y turistas. Para poder realizar esta actividad blanca cuenta con cuenta con 01 maquina de coser donde también  confecciona vestidos y otras prendas de vestir.

Blanca esta solicitando un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 500 nuevos soles para comprar telas para confección de prendas de vestir como vestidos , faldas y otros para comercializar, y tener la oportunidad de poder adquirir más materia prima para sus artesanías.

Blanca es una joven trabajadora, que desea salir a delante, apoyar en los gastos de su hogar y mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Blanca is 20 years old, single, and she does not have children in her care. She lives at home with her parents, located in the community of Chacupe Bajo. It is a small rural community belonging to the district of La Victoria. They have electricity and the water they consume is from a well.

She is dedicated to agriculture and raising livestock for resale. But her primary activity is crafting. Blanca makes straw hats and she has more than 5 years in the business. The hats that she makes are sold in the city of Monsefu to the crafts wholesalers and to tourists. In order to carry out her activities Blanca has 1 sewing machine where she also makes dresses and other articles of clothing.

Blanca requests a loan from Edpyme Alternativa (Kiva Field Partner) in the amount of 500 nuevos soles to purchase fabrics to make articles of clothing, such as dresses, skirts, and others products to sell. Her goal is to acquire more materials to make her crafts.

Blanca is a young, hardworking woman who dreams of moving ahead, to cover the expenses of her home and to improve the quality of life for her family.

loans.use: to purchase materials to make her crafts.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy doors and windows for her house

loans.name: Ana Luz

texts.es:
Ana Luz es socia del  Banco Comunal “Hermanas de Choquetanca II”, ubicado en el distrito Ilave, provincia El Collao departamento de Puno, tiene 42 años de edad, está casada y tiene cinco hijos.  La señora estudio hasta 4to de educación primaria.
Ella se dedica a la compra y venta de ganados vacunos, ovinos y a la chacra (cosecha de papa, quinua, habas, cebada) luego los vende en la localidad de Ilave, también cuenta que su esposo es músico y viaja a diferentes lugares,  pero la ayuda en su tiempo libre.
Está trabajando  con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde  hace un ciclo,  su préstamo anterior fue de S/. 500.00 nuevos soles, dinero que incrementó al capital de su negocio para comprar ganados.
En la actualidad solicitara un nuevo préstamo por la suma de S/. 1000.00 nuevos soles, dinero que incrementará al capital  de su negocio para luego comprar una vaca lechera.
Su sueño es crecer y tener ganados mejorados.
Lo que le gusta del Banco Comunal es  la facilidad del préstamo.
texts.en:
Ana Luz is a member of the “Hermanas de Choquetanca II” community bank which is located in Ilave district, in El Collao province, in Puno department.  She is 42 years old, married, and has five children.  She studied up to the fourth year of elementary school.

Ana Luz buys and sells cows and sheep.  She also grows potatoes, quinoa, beans and barley which she then sells in the town of Ilave.  She tells us that her husband is a musician and travels to different places but he helps her in his spare time.

Ana Luz has been working with Movimiento Manuela Ramos for one loan cycle.  Her previous loan was for 500 Peruvian soles.  That money increased her business capital for buying cattle.

Ana Luz is currently requesting a new loan for 1,000 soles which will increase her business capital so that she can buy a dairy cow.  Her dream is to grow in her business and make better profits.  What she likes about her community bank is the ease of the loans.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Felix Eddy

texts.es:
El Señor Eddy tiene 31 años de edad vive en la zona de la Maica Sud parada 8 al Sud de la ciudad de Cochabamba, el vive con sus padres al ser el hermano menor tiene un niño de dos años de edad no está casado pero vive con la madre la señora Roxana.
Eddy tiene un radiotaxi y al mismo tiempo trabaja en la producción de leche junto con su esposa, el tuvo que dejar el colegio para poder ayudar a su padre ya que su madre sufrió de una enfermedad en los pies lo cual no le permitía realizar su trabajo con la producción de leche y la realización de quesillo y su padre tomo la decisión de irse al Argentina a trabajar pero con el pasar de los años el se olvido de sus familia y Eddy fue el único que se puso a trabajar con el radiotaxi que era prestado, pero después con un crédito se compro su propio vehículo con el cual realiza trabajos y de esa manera obtuvo más ingresos y pudo ayudarla a su madre a salir adelante.
Ahora el solicita el crédito para la compra de un tanque de gas para su vehículo así podrá realizar más horas de trabajo y poder tener más ingresos ya que su esposa Roxana se encarga del trabajo de la producción de leche y elaboración de quesillos para poderle brindarle un futuro mejor a su pequeño y que él pueda realizar una carrera y su madre mejore para que pueda vivir muchos años más con él y Roxana ya que el valora la fuerza de voluntad de la madre para salir adelante.
Eddy es una persona responsable y dedicada al trabajo y sueña con poderle dar un futuro mejor a su madre y a su esposa.
texts.en:
Eddy is 31 years old and lives in Maica Sud district (stop 8), in the south of the city of Cochabamba.  Eddy lives with his mother as he is the youngest sibling.  He has a 2 year-old son.  He is not married but lives with his son's mother Roxana.

Eddy has a taxi and he also works in milk production together with his partner Roxana.  Eddy had to leave school to help his father because his mother had a medical problem with her feet which meant that she couldn't carry out her work producing milk and making quesillo (soft cheese) and his father decided to go to Argentina to work.  However, over time, Eddy's father forgot about his family and Eddy was the only one who could support them.  He started working with a radio taxi that somebody loaned him but used a loan to buy his own vehicle with which he now works.  In this way, he made more income and was able to help his mother to get ahead.

Eddy is now requesting a loan to buy a gas tank for his vehicle.  This will enable him to work longer hours and make more income since his partner Roxana takes care of the milk production work and making the quesillo.  This will enable him to provide his young son with a better future.  It will also enable him to study for a degree himself and help his mother get better so that she can live with him and Roxana for many more years as Eddy values his mother's willpower and desire to get ahead in life.

Eddy is a responsible person who is committed to his work.  He dreams of being able to provide his mother and his partner with a better future.

loans.use: to buy a gas tank for his vehicle

loans.name: Yanaturo (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal Yanaturo está formado por 11 mujeres quienes laboran en diferentes actividades que les ha permitido aportar a la economía de sus hogares y sacar  adelante a sus familias. Nuestras socias son personas muy amables y cordiales. 
Viven por el sector de Yanaturo en la ciudad de Cuenca que es la tercera ciudad más importante del país, esta ciudad se mezcla entre lo colonial y lo moderno, cuenta con una amplia gastronomía y su gente mantiene su cultura y tradiciones.

La Señora. Rosa vive por la comunidad de Yanaturo en la ciudad de Cuenca, tiene 32 años, es casada y tiene 4 hijos de 9, 8, 7 y 4 años de edad, sus tres primeros hijos estudian en una escuelita del sector. Su esposo trabaja en la área de la construcción como albañil, con el trabajo conyugal han logrado construir su casa propia.
 
Doña Rosa trabaja realizando la limpieza de varias casas hace 6 meses, labora de lunes a viernes solo medio día ya que el resto de su tiempo lo dedica al cuidado de sus hijos y de su hogar.
 
El dinero de su préstamo lo va a invertir en la compra de materiales de construcción para realizar algunos acabados a su casa. En el banco comunal se encuentra en su sexto crédito y es una socia fundadora del banquito.

Su meta es terminar su casa y  colocar un negocio en la misma.

Las fotos pequeñas adjuntas son de dos socias que por motivos de trabajo no pudieron estar presentes cuando se tomo la foto del grupo. Son las fotos de María josé y María Aquilina.

Los tres niños de la foto son hijos de las socias.
texts.en:
The Yanaturo community bank is made up of 11 women who work in different business activities which have enabled them to contribute to their household finances and get their families ahead in life.  The ladies are very kind and friendly people who live in Yanaturo district, in the city of Cuenca. Cuenca is the third most important city in the country and is a mixture of colonial and modern.  It has a wide-ranging cuisine and its people maintain their culture and traditions.

Rosa lives in Yanaturo community, in the city of Cuenca.  She is 32 years old, married, and has four children aged 9, 8, 7 and 4.  Her eldest three children attend a local elementary school.  Her husband is a construction worker.  Through their joint work, they have managed to build their own home.

Rosa works as a cleaner, cleaning other people's homes.  She has been in this business for six months and works from Monday to Friday.  She only works half days as she spends the rest of her time looking after her children and her house.

Rosa will invest her loan money in buying construction supplies so that she can do some work on her house.  She is applying for her sixth loan through her community bank and she is one of the bank's founding members.

Rosa's goal is to finish off her house and set up a business there.

The small photos attached to the main group photo are those of two members who, for work reasons, couldn't be present when the group photo was taken.  They are photos of María José and María Aquilina.  The three children in the photo belong to the members.

loans.use: to buy construction supplies

loans.name: Agustina

texts.es:
Agustina es socia del  Banco Comunal “Hermanas de Choquetanca II”, ubicado en el distrito Ilave, provincia El Collao departamento de Puno, tiene 39 años de edad, está casada y tiene siete hijos.  La señora no cuenta con estudios.
Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace un ciclo, su primer préstamo solicitado fue  por la suma de S/. 500.00 nuevos soles, dinero que invirtió en su negocio de compra y venta de huevos y animales domésticos.
En la actualidad  solicitará  un nuevo préstamo por la suma de S/. 1000.00 nuevos soles, dinero que utilizará en la compra de tres unidades de ovejas para luego venderlos, en el negocio trabaja junto con su esposo e hijos.
Su sueño es tener más ganados.
Lo que le gusta del Banco Comunal es la facilidad del prestamo.
texts.en:
Agustina is a member of the “Hermanas de Choquetanca II” Community Bank located in Ilave district, El Collao province, in the department of Puno. She is 39-years old, married, and has seven children. She did not attend school.

Agustina has had one previous loan with Kiva partner Movimiento Manuela Ramos. She borrowed S/.500 soles to invest in her business buying and selling eggs and domestic animals. She is now seeking a new loan of S/.1000 soles to buy three sheep which she will later sell. 

Her husband and children help with the business. Augustina’s dream is to have more livestock. What she most likes about the Community Bank is the ease of obtaining a loan.

loans.use: to buy three sheep

loans.name: Maria Guadalupe

texts.es:
La Sra. María es una persona muy seria y trabajadora, ella  requiere su crédito
porque  desea  comprar   mercancía  para  su negocio  ya  que  actualmente  se  dedica a la venta de  café y  gracias a  dios le a  ido  muy  bien , agradece  el apoyo  para  realizar  su proyecto  ya  que  este  negocio representa  el  ingreso  principal de   su  familia  y  gracias  a este  puede   sacar  adelante  a  sus   dos   hijos  que  son lo mas  importante  en su  vida.
texts.en:
Sra. María is a serious and hardworking woman. She needs a loan as she wishes to buy supplies for her coffee-making and selling business. Thankfully the business is doing well. 

María is grateful for this support of her business as it is the main source of income for her family. She is able to help her two children make their way in the world. They are the most important part of her life

loans.use: to buy supplies for her coffee business

loans.name: Ivan Ernesto

texts.es:
Ivan Ernesto  tiene 23 años vive en la zona de las lomas en la casa de sus padres, de la ciudad de La Paz, cuenta con un taller de elaboración de calzados para niños con 3 años de experiencia en el rubro.
El cliente con el transcurso del tiempo ahorró dinero de donde con ese pequeño ahorro se hizó de un capital para la elaboración y venta de sus productos.
El destino del crédito esta destinado a capital de operación, compra de material de trabajo, con el dinero solicitado incrementará su mercadería y materiales, cueros, plantillas, hilos agujas y otros mas.
El cliente no tiene deudas en el sistema financiero, en cuanto a su experiencia quiere ampliar su negocio y su nivel de ingresos, cuenta con actitud de pago y emprendimiento en la administración del negocio.
texts.en:
23-year old Ivan Ernesto lives in the Las Lomas area of La Paz with his parents. For three years now he has been making children’s shoes in his workshop. Over time Ivan managed to save enough money to buy the materials and then sell his products. Now he is seeking a loan to buy more supplies such as leather, insoles, thread, needles etc. 

Ivan does not have any debts to repay. He wishes to expand his business and increase his income. He has a good attitude towards repaying the loan, and his business is well run.

loans.use: to buy materials for his shoe-making business

loans.name: Juana Pastora

texts.es:
La  señora Juana , tiene 46 años de edad, es originaria de Sutiava un barrio localizado en León , es madre de tres hijos, esta casada , ella se dedica a elaborar cajetas(dulces).Ella inicio con las ventas de una gallinas que tenia las vendía y con las ganancias obtenidas fue que comenzó elaborar cajetas, además que su mama se dedicaba a elaborar dulces fue de ella quien aprendió esta actividad así ha venido manteniendo a sus hijos, les ha pagado sus estudios, paga los gastos de la casa su esposos la ha apoyado desde el principio ella lleva 26 años en el negocio, ella misma los elabora y vende en las pulperías y mercados de la ciudad de León. 
Ella solicito el préstamo para mejorar la infraestructura de su casa y ampliar su lugar de trabajo dándoles mejores condiciones. Con esta inversión podrá mejorar las condiciones de trabajo y mejorar sus ingresos. A ella le gustaría poder contratar a 2 vendedores, vender sus productos en ferias .Su próxima meta es terminar hacerle mejoras  a su cocina que es donde elabora su productos y terminar de preparar a sus hijos profesionalmente
texts.en:
Juana is 46 years old and she is originally form Sutiava, a community located in Leon. She is the mother of thee children and she is married. She makes fudge (sweets). She started out selling poultry and with the profits she obtained she started making fudge candy. Her mother used to make fudge candy and it was from her that she learned the business. And this is how she has been supporting her children and he has paid for their schooling. Her husband pays for the household expenses and he has supported her from the start. She has been in business for 26 years. She makes the product herself and she sells it to the grocery stores and markets in the city of Leon. 

She requests a loan to improve the infrastructure of her house and to expand her working space to provide them with improved conditions. With this investment she will be able to improve her working conditions and she will improve her earnings. She would like to hire 2 merchants to sell her products at the fairs. Her next goal is to finish making improvements to her kitchen, which is where she makes her products, and to help her children until they have earned their careers.

loans.use: to improve the infrastructure of her house and to expand the space were she works.

loans.name: Sembrando Esperanza Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “SEMBRANDO ESPERANZA” iniciará su primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del centro focal Los Andes, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva encabezada por la señora Isabela. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: comercio, producción y servicio.

La señora Isabela,  ingreso a Pro Mujer por invitación de una compañera. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de tejido de mantas que viene trabajando hace cinco años atrás y que aprendió de su compañera. El crédito que ahora sacará es para la compra para aumentar su producción de mantas (compra de lana) material que comprará de la 16 de julio (lugar comercial de la ciudad de El Alto) y lo venderá en la Ballivian. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia, pues ella es casada y tiene cinco hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta las reuniones.
texts.en:
The communal bank "SEMBRANDO ESPERANZA" is beginning its first term in Pro Mujer, as part of the Los Andes Social Center.  It is comprised of eight members and its board of directors is chaired by Mrs. Isabela.  The members' business activities are varied and include commerce, production and services.

Mrs. Isabela joined Pro Mujer by invitation from a friend.  She has been in the blanket weaving business for five years and learned the skill from a friend.  The loan she is requesting is to increase blanket production by buying wool at the "16 de Julio" shopping center in the city of El Alto.  She will sell her products in Ballivian.  This work enables her to generate an income to support her family.  She is married and has five children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she replies that she enjoys the meetings.

loans.use: To buy wool.

loans.name: Las Triunfadoras De Zoquitlan Group

texts.es:
L. señora Faustina es una integrante del grupo "Las Triunfadoras D. Zoquitlán", que esta ubicado en VeraC., México. ElL. se dedica a L. venta D. abarrotes que inicio hace 10 años. solicita el préstamo para comprar más mercancia y asi tener mas surtido su negocio. sus clietes y vecinos L. consideran como una persona trabajadora y responsable. Al momento D. solicitar este préstamo se siente satisfecha ya que podra generar mayores ganancias y L. oportunidad D. hacer crecer su negocio y ser los mejores en su comunidad. 

Tiene 45 años, estudio hasta L. primaria, es casada y tiene 2 hijas. Quiere este prestamo para comprar más producto D. abarrotes y tener todos los productos que en su comunidad necesitan y así ser D. L. preferencia D. sus clientes tanto en calidad como buen servicio, con las ganancias que obtenga piensa ahorrar una parte para L. educación D. sus hijas, ya que desea verlas graduadas y con una profesión que les agraD..
texts.en:
Mrs. Faustina is a member of the communal bank "L. Triunfadoras D. Zoquitlán", which is located in VeraC. in México.  She has been selling groceries for 10 years.  She is requesting a loan to buy more goods and keep a larger stock at her business.  Her customers and neighbors consider her to be very hard-working and responsible.  The loan will allow her to generate more income and give her the opportunity to expand her business and turn it into one of the best in her community.

She is 45 years old, married and has two daughters.  She has a primary level education.  With the loan she plans to buy more grocery products so she can stock everything her community needs making her business the one preferred by customers for quality and good service.  Part of her savings will be used toward her daughters' education so she can see them graduate and become professionals in any field they choose.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for her grocery store, such as rice, beans and soap.

loans.name: Oscar

texts.es: El Sr. Oscar y su esposa  se  dedican  a la   venta   de  ropa semi-nueva  y  venta  de  accesorios para   dama  como   aretes,  collares  y pintura este  negocio a  salido adelante  gracias al empeño y dedicacion de  los  dos,   ya que  se  turnan  para  atender  a  sus  clientes sin descuidar  a su  familia, su  mayor  anhelo es  invertir  en su  negocio  para  tener  una  gran  variedad  de artículos  disponibles  para  sus  clientes,  agradece  el apoyo  realizado  para  concluir   este  proyecto  ya  que  este  negocio  representa  el sustento principal  de   su   familia.
texts.en: Mr. Oscar and his wife sell semi-new clothing and ladies' accessories such as earrings, necklaces and paint.  Their business has been successful thanks to hard work and dedication by both of them.  They take turns attending to customers without disregarding family.  Their greatest desire is to invest in the business in order to have a variety of articles for their customers.  They are grateful for the support received for this project since it is the main source of income for the family.

loans.use: To buy clothing for retail sale.

loans.name: Juan Francisco

texts.es:
El señor Juan, el es originario del departamento de León, de 46 años de edad, esta casado, es padre de familia, tiene 5 hijos, el mantiene a 3 de ellos pues el resto son mayores y viven independientes de el , don Juan se dedica a la tapicería de muebles y asientos de vehículos. Inicio este negocio cuando el tenia 18 años de edad cuando se caso con su primera esposa  el heredo el negocio de su suegro , el enviudo a los 23 años, fue cuando el instalo por su cuenta en un nuevo lugar el negocio propio de tapizar muebles, después se fue a los Estados Unidos a trabajar en una compañía donde elaboraban muebles esa experiencia fue de 4 años después regreso a su ciudad a trabajar y poner su negocio empleando sus conocimientos adquiridos. 
Solicito el préstamo para comprar material de trabajo como cuero, damasco, rollos, hilos, grapas, alfombras, esponjas para tapizar (forrar) muebles y vehículos. Este crédito le ayudara a desarrollar su negocio, tener más productos que ofrecer y a comprar mas material de trabajo para producir mas. El planea en lo futuro poner una mueblería, pues le gustaría expandirse en la zona de occidente instalar mini tiendas en Chinandega.
texts.en:
Juan is originally from the department of Leon. He is 46 years old, married, and he is the father of a family. He has 5 children although he supports 3 because the others are grown and they live independently. Juan is a furniture and automotive upholsterer. He started this business when he was 18 years old and when he married his first wife he inherited the business from his father-in-law. He became a widow when he was 23 and that is when he moved his business to his own space to work upholstering furniture. He went to the United States to work for a furniture company. That experience lasted 4 years and later he came back to his city of origin to work and to put into practice the skills he acquired.

He requested a loan to purchase materials to work with, such as leather, damask fabric, rolls, threads, staples, carpeting, upholstering foam (liners) for furniture and vehicles. This loan will help him to develop his business and to have more products to offer. He will be able to purchase more materials for his business to increase production. In the future he wants to start a furniture store. He would like to expand into a western region and to start up a small store in Chinandega.

loans.use: to purchase materials such as leather, damask fabrics, rolls, threads, staples, carpeting, and sponges to upholster furniture and vehicles

loans.name: Tolentino

texts.es:
Tolentino  tiene 50 años de edad, vive con su esposa e hijos  en caserío Sincape  un pequeño poblado del distrito de olmos a 2 horas de la ciudad  de Chiclayo.

Tolentino se dedica a la venta de artículos de primera  necesidad. El cuenta con una pequeña bodega instalada en su domicilio la cual el atiende y administra. Allí ofrecen en venta a los vecinos y clientes de la zona diversos productos de consumo diario, entre productos de primera necesidad y abarrotes. El negocio cuenta con muy buena acogida, adicionalmente  se dedica a la venta y reparto a domicilio de frutas desde el mercado de olmos.  

Contando con una moto, con la que el se transporta por todo el distrito de olmos repartiendo sus pedidos. Con estas actividades él cubre y solventa sus gastos familiares.
 
Tolentino está solicitando un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 1000 nuevos soles  para la ampliación de su negocio ya que ha visto crecer la demanda de sus clientes de ésta manera podrá  generar más ingresos  para su  hogar y mejorar la calidad de vida de toda su familia.

Tolentino es una persona muy tranquila y trabajadora, que tiene deseos de superación y de sacar adelante a su familia.
texts.en:
Tolentino is 50 years old and he lives with his wife and children in the community of Sincape. It is a small community in the district of Olmos, at 2 hours form the city of Chiclayo.

Tolentino sells basic needs products. He has a small store located in his house which he attends and administers. There he offers a variety of daily use products for sale to his neighbors and clients in the region. This products are basic needs products and grocery store products. Teh business is in high demand. In addition he also has a sales and home delivery business selling fruits from the market at Olmos.

He has a motorcycle on which he delivers throughout the district of Olmos, distributing his orders. These activities help him to cover and pay for his family's expenses.

Tolentino requests a loan from Edpyme Alternativa (Kiva Field Partner) in the amount of 1000 nuevos soles to expand his business. he has seen an increase in demand from his clients and this will help him generate more income for his household and to improve the quality of life for his entire family.

Tolentino is a very calm and hardworking person. He has a wish to improve and to provide for his family.

loans.use: to expand his business with the purchase of general store merchandise.

loans.name: Maria Guadalupe

texts.es:
A la vivienda de la señora Maria Guadalupe le esta haciendo falta la barda. 
Esta solicitando un préstamo para poder comprar el materia que es cemento, block, varilla, arena y pagarle a la persona que se encargara de realizar la mejora.
No cuenta con el dinero necesario para poder comprar el material y realizar la mejora ya que solo desea la comodidad y seguridad de su familia. 
Doña Maria Guadalupe trabaja en una escuela infantil como maestra con este ingreso planea pagar el crédito, ya que su esposo el señor José es empleado de una tienda de materiales de contrición con el ingreso que recibe será para los gastos familiares.
texts.en:
Mrs. Maria Guadalupe's house is in need of a wall around it.  She is requesting a loan to buy materials such as cement, blocks, and rods, and to pay someone to carry out the improvement.

She does not have enough money to buy the materials and pay for the job, but she wants comfort and safety for her family.

Doña Maria Guadalupe works as a teacher at a kindergarten and plans to use her income to pay back the loan.  Her husband, Mr. José, works for a construction materials store and his salary will be used to cover household expenses.

loans.use: To build a wall around the house.

loans.name: Mi Banquito Group

texts.es:
Ciceli participa hace cuatro anos en la ALCOM “Mi Banquito” y hace ocho meses ejerce el cargo de presidenta, a sus  33 anos y con dos hijos dependientes afronta la vida  siendo madre soltera. Ciceli crecio en medio de una familia de agricultores que siembran, cosechan y comercializan tuberculos como: papa, habas y alfalfa. Actualmente ella se dedica  a la siembra y venta de flores; asi ha  logrado tener estabilidad economica y dar estudios a sus menores hijos. Ciceli desea utilizar una mejor tecnologia de riego para su agricultura y lograr adquirir un mejor sistema de riego para tener mejores resultados y asi mayores ganancias con su produccion, el prestamo obtenido sera utilizado en semillas y abonos para sus sembrios.
 La Alcancia Comunal “Mi Banquito” esta conformada por diez integrantes que participan hace cuatro anos con el sistema comunal y estan agradecidos por el prestamo recibido en esta nueva oportunidad para su capital de trabajo. 

*** En la fotografia estan ausentes por motivos particulares de cruze con su horario de trabajo la sra victoria elena y rosa, quienes llegaron con retraso a la reunion.
texts.en:
Ciceli has been a member of the communal bank "Mi Banquito", meaning "My Little Bank" for the past four years. Eight months ago she became the president of the group. At her 33 years of age and with her two dependent children, she faces life as a single mother. Ciceli grew up in a family of agriculturists who plant, harvest, and sell produce, such as: potatoes, fava beans, and alfalfa. She currently plants and sells flowers and this is how she has reached financial stability and how she has been able to give her young children an education. Ciceli wants to use a better irrigation technology in her agriculture projects in order to acquire a better system of irrigation to obtain better results. This will translate into better earnings from her production. The loan will be used to purchase seeds and fertilizers for her plantations.

The communal bank "Mi Banquito" is made up of 10 members who have been in the communal system for four years. They are thankful for the loan received, a new opportunity to use as working capital. Month after month they work hard to make their payments on time. Victoria Elena and Rosa are absent from the photograph for work schedule conflicts, arriving late to the meeting.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and seeds for her plantations.

loans.name: Jose Santos

texts.es:
José tiene 31 años de edad, él es soltero sin carga familiar. Vive en casa de sus padres La cual está ubicada en la ciudad de Chiclayo.  El vive en la parte urbana de sus comunidad , que goza de los servicios de agua y luz eléctrica.

José santos se dedica  a  realizar labores de administración  en una empresa privada, dedicada a la venta de unidades de transporte, actividad que viene  ejerciendo desde hace mas de dos años, él esta en planilla y cuenta con los beneficios correspondientes.  José desea tener un establecimiento propio.

José está solicitando un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 2000 nuevos soles para comprarse un artefacto, para sus uso personal, el cual le facilitará algunas labres en su hogar.

José es un cliente nuevo para Edpyme Alternativa Cliente, cuenta con muy buenas referencias personales y muestra un gran interés por salir adelante y obtener un mejor estilo de vida.
texts.en:
Jose is 31 years old, single, and he does not have family responsibilities. He lives at home with his parents and it is located in the city of Chiclayo. He lives in an urban region of his community and they enjoy running water and electricity.

Jose Santos provides administration support for a private company, dedicated to the sale of transportation vehicles. He has been in this business for more than two years. he is employed and he enjoys the corresponding benefits. Jose wants to have an establishment of his own.

Jose requests a loan from Edpyme Alternativa (Kiva Field Partner) in the amount of 2000 nuevos soles to purchase an appliance for his personal use which will help him with some projects around the house.

Jose is a new client of Edpyme Alternativa (Kiva Field Partner) and he has very good personal references. He is very eager to move forward and to acquire a better way of life.

loans.use: to purchase an appliance for the home.

loans.name: Altantsetseg

texts.en: Altantsetseg is 48 years old and lives with her husband and three children in a ger, a Mongolian yurt, in Hovd province, Mongolia. All of her three children, ages 13, 15, and 16, attend local secondary school. Her husband is a driver who manages a taxi service business in the town. Altanstetseg operates a grocery trading business at a rented stall at a local market. She started her business in 2002 and is planning to continue her business in the future. Her business earning is the only source of income for her family because her husband's business is not profitable enough to contribute to her family's consumption. Therefore she is planning to expand her business in order to feed her family. She is a hardworking lady who says, "Besides my grocery trading, I am planning to manage a flour trading business to supplement to my earning." She is requesting a 2,000,000 MNT loan to purchase flour in order to increase her business sales.

loans.use: To purchase flour for a flour trading business.

loans.name: Sodtsetseg

texts.en: Sodtsetseg is 30 years old and lives with her husband and three children in a ger, a Mongolian yurt, in Hovd province of Mongolia. All her children, one daughter and twins, go to a kindergarten and her husband works as a fireman. She manages a clothes trading business in her town. She started her business after conducting a PC game place for several years.  During her five years of business operation, she has gained much experience and built a strong customer base. She is a friendly woman who says, "I am happy to manage my own business, because I don’t have to ask someone to give me money." She is requesting a 1,500,000 MNT loan to purchase more clothes for her business.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes for her clothing trading business.

loans.name: Altantsetseg

texts.en: Altantsetseg is 36 years old, widowed, and has three daughters, all of whom attend school. They live in a ger, Mongolian yurt, in Hovd province of Mongolia. She manages a used clothing trading business at a rented stall at a local market. She started her business in 1995 and gained much experience. She has many regular customers and is planning to continue her business in the future. She purchases her products once or twice a month. Her working capital reached 1,200,000 MNT. She is a friendly woman who says, "I want to purchase more goods in order to increase my business sales." She is requesting a 1,000,000 MNT loan to purchase used clothing for her business.

loans.use: to purchase used clothing.

loans.name: Tsetsegmaa

texts.en: Tsetsegmaa is 56-year-old widow who lives with her two daughters in a ger, a Mongolian yurt, in Hovd province, Mongolia. Her older daughter is a teacher and her youngest one is a student. She operates a hat trading business out of a rented booth at a trading center. She started her business in 2001. Now she sells a variety of imported hats of all ages. She imports her goods once a month from China. She is very good at picking modern and stylish hats for her business. Therefore her goods are well-known among her customers. She is planning to expand her business in the future. She is a polite woman who says, "I want to buy more hats to increase my business sales." She is requesting a 1,700,000 MNT loan to purchase more inventories.

loans.use: To purchase more hat inventory.

loans.name: Tsend-Ayush

texts.en: Tsend-Ayush is 30 years old who lives in a ger, a Mongolian yurt, in Hovd province of Mongolia. He operates a transportation service business between Ulaanbaatar city and his center of province. He transports coal, wood, and iron for his customers. He started his business in 2005 with his truck and gained much experience. Since then he has managed to stabilize his business and has built good communication both with his partners and customers. He is an open-minded and polite man who is planning to continue his business in the future. He says, "This is only thing I can do best. So I want to continue my business in the future." He is requesting a 1,000,000 MNT loan to purchase auto parts for his truck.

loans.use: To purchase auto parts

loans.name: Bayaraa

texts.en: Bayaraa is 43 years old and lives with her husband and two daughters in a ger, a Mongolian yurt, in Hovd province, Mongolia. Her oldest daughter is a student while youngest one is a pupil. Her husband, who used to conduct a grocery trading business with Bayaraa, manages a cell phone trading business in his town. Bayaraa operates a grocery trading business which started at a rented stall at a local market in 1998. Since 2007 she began conducting her business independently. Now she sells all kinds of daily consumption vegetables such as carrots, potatoes, cabbage, and onions etc. She is one of the most experienced businesswomen in her town. She is a polite woman who says, "During warm season sales increases much compared with other seasons. So I need more goods to sell." She is requesting a 1,700,000 MNT loan to purchase vegetables for her business.

loans.use: To purchase vegetables for her business.

loans.name: Chanthou

texts.en: Chanthou, age 44, is widowed and resides with her children in Takeo Province, Cambodia. Chanthou, and her late husband, sell fruit, earning an income of $10 each per day to help cover the family expenses. Chanthou's family's standard of living has been improved since Chanthou has had this business. Chanthou is requesting a loan of $500 to purchase a motorbike that her children can use to commute to work. This is her second loan from CREDIT, a partner of Kiva.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike to help her children commute to work

loans.name: Tseelei

texts.en: Tseelei is 44 years old and lives with her two daughters in a ger, a Mongolian yurt, in Uvs province of Mongolia. Her older daughter gave a birth recently while her younger one goes to a local secondary school. She manages a household goods for kitchen tools trading business in her town. She started her business in 1998. Since then her business was quite successful which allowed her to increase her working capital to 1,500,000 MNT. Now she sells all kinds of household goods that fulfill her customers demand. She is planning to expand her business in the future. She is a polite woman who says, "I want my children to be educated and have better jobs." She is requesting a 2,000,000 MNT loan to purchase kitchen tools from China.

loans.use: To purchase kitchen tools for her business from China

loans.name: Sareoun

texts.en: Sareoun, age 41, is married and resides with her children in Takeo Province, Cambodia. Sareoun is a farmer, earning an income of $1 per day to help cover the family expenses. Her husband is a motor-taxi driver, earning an income of $5 per day. Their standard of living has improved since Sareoun has had this business. Sareoun is requesting a loan of $800 to purchase wood to repair her house. This is her first loan from CREDIT, a partner of Kiva.

loans.use: to buy wood to repair her house.

loans.name: Cresencia

texts.en:
Cresencia is from the village of San Vicente Bajo, Oroquieta, Misamis Occidental. She is 58 years old, married and has two adult-aged children. To make a living, Cresencia runs a business venture in the food sector selling fruits and vegetables. 

Cresencia has been engaged in her business for 10 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities. Cresencia joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities.

Cresencia is requesting a new loan of 20000 PHP with which she will purchase more fruits and vegetables for her fruits and vegetables business. This loan will be the sixth loan taken out by Cresencia from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About PMPC
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

loans.use: To purchase more fruits and vegetables for her fruits and vegetables  business.

location.town: San Vicente Bajo, Oroquieta City Misamis Occidenta

loans.name: Mao

texts.en: Mao, age 43, is married and resides with her children in Takeo Province, Cambodia. Mao sells palm products, earning an income of $3 per day to help cover the family expenses. Her husband is a farmer, earning an income of $1 per day. Their standard of living has improved since Mao has had this business. Mao is requesting a loan of $800 to purchase wood to repair her house. This is her third loan from CREDIT, a partner of Kiva.

loans.use: to buy wood to repair the house

loans.name: Ry

texts.en: Ry, age 48, is married and resides with her children in Takeo Province, Cambodia. Ry is a housewife while her husband is a recycler, earning an income of $5 per day to help cover the family expenses. Their standard of living has mproved since Ry’s husband has had this business. Ry is requesting a loan of $1200 to purchase a motorbike for her husband to transport recyclable materials to sell. This is her first loan from CREDIT, a partner of Kiva.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike for her husband's recyclable materials transport business.

loans.name: Chenda

texts.en: Chenda, age 23, is married and resides with her children in Takeo Province, Cambodia. Chenda is a housewife and raises pigs while her husband, who is a construction worker, earns an income of $5 per day to help cover the family expenses. Their standard of living has improved since Chenda’s husband has had this business. Chenda is requesting a loan of $700 to purchase a motorbike for her brother to commute to work. This is her first loan from CREDIT, a partner of Kiva.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike for her brother to commute to work.

loans.name: Betty

texts.en:
Betty is married and has a general store in the Philippines. She works hard to support her family and has been in this business for the past 20 years. Betty is requesting a 40,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy more stock to sell in her store.

In the future, Betty would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more inventory to sell

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is 32 years old and married with one child. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. For the past 10 years, Evelyn has run a general store in the Philippines. She is requesting a 25,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy more stock to sell in her store. 

In the future, Evelyn would like to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase inventory to sell

loans.name: Rhoda

texts.en:
Rhoda is 49 years old and married with two children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. For the past 15 years, Rhoda has run a sari-sari (variety) store in the Philippines. She is requesting a 20,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy more items to sell in her store.

In the future, Rhoda would like to expand her business to secure her family’s future.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell in her store

loans.name: Sokunthea

texts.en: Sokunthea, age 29, is married and resides with her children in Takeo Province, Cambodia. Sokunthea is employed at the factory, earning an income of $3 per day to help cover the family expenses. Her husband is a motor-taxi driver, earning an income of $8 per day. Their standard of living has been improved since Sokunthea has been in her business. She is requesting a loan of $1200 to purchase wood to repair her house. This is her third loan from CREDIT, a partner of Kiva.

loans.use: to buy wood to repair her house.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to build a restroom

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en: Lilia is 61 years old, married, and has three children. She is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. She has been raising pigs for five years and has borrowed from NWTF 17 times. Lilia is requesting a loan for 20,000 PHP through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs. In the future, Lilia would like to repair and renovate her family home.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en: Marilou is married, has five children and is a very hard-working entrepreneur. She is 53 years old and has one child who is still in school. Marilou earns a living by repairing vehicles and is applying for a loan for PHP 16,000 from NWTF to buy new tools and equipment for her shop. She has been in this line of work for nine years and dreams of having enough money to repair and renovate her family's home.

loans.use: to buy tools and equipment for her shop.

loans.name: Lai

texts.en: Lai, age 50, is married and resides with her children in Takeo Province, Cambodia. Lai is a housewife while her husband is a construction foreman, earning an income of $3 per day to help cover the family expenses. The standard of living has improved since Lai has had this business. She is requesting a loan of $500 to purchase cows to help plow the rice fields. This is her first loan from CREDIT, a partner of Kiva.

loans.use: to buy cows to help plow the rice field.

loans.name: Phan

texts.en: Phan, age 25, is married and resides with her children in Takeo Province, Cambodia. Phan raises pigs and is employed at the factory, earning an income of $3 per day to help cover the family expenses. Her husband sells mango, earning an income of $3 per day. Their standard of living has improved since Phan has had this business. She is requesting a loan of $1000 to purchase pigs to raise for sale. This is her second loan from CREDIT, a partner of Kiva.

loans.use: to buy pigs to raise for sale

loans.name: Betty

texts.en:
Betty is from the village of Caputol, Aloran, Misamis Occidental. She is 63 years old, married and has six adult-aged children. To make a living, Betty runs a business venture in the retail sector running a general store in the local community. 

Betty has been engaged in her business for 16 years and earns approximately 3000 PHP a month for these activities. Betty joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 35000 PHP from PMPC. 

Betty is requesting a new loan of 30000 PHP with which she will purchase more products for her general store such as dry goods, can goods, soap, etc. This loan will be the 20th loan taken out by Betty from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About PMPC
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. 

Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchased products such as can goods, dry goods, soap, etc. for her general store.

loans.name: Ang

texts.en: Ang, age 39, is married and resides with her children in Takeo Province, Cambodia. Ang and her husband sell fruits, earning an income of $3 per day to help cover the family expenses. Their standard of living has improved since Ang has had this business. She is requesting a loan of $1000 to purchase more fruits to stock the store. This is her first loan from CREDIT, a partner of Kiva.

loans.use: to buy more fruits to expand the business

loans.name: Leng

texts.en: Leng, age 53, is married and resides with her children in Takeo Province, Cambodia. Leng raises pigs to sell, earning an income of $2 per day to help cover the family expenses. The family is also assisted by her husband who produces wooden furniture, earning an income of $1 per day. Their standard of living has improved since Leng has had this business. She is requesting a loan of $1200 to purchase used motorbikes to resell. This is her third loan from CREDIT, a partner of Kiva.

loans.use: to buy used motorbikes to resell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a motorbike for her husband to transport recyclable materials.

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en:
Rosalinda is a hardworking entrepreneur who has operated a sari-sari (variety) store in the Philippines for 15 years. She also earns more income from food vending, farming rice and raising pigs.

Rosalinda has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts and with the help of loans from NWTF, and is now requesting a loan of PHP 19,500 through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell to customers. She dreams of repairing and renovating her family home and securing the future of her children.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell to customers.

loans.name: Riza

texts.en:
Riza is from the village of Bunawan, Villaflor, Oroquieta City. She is 37 years old, married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Riza runs a business venture in the Agriculture sector buying and selling coconut fruits in the local community. 

Riza has been engaged in her business for two years and earns approximately 2000 PHP a month for these activities. Riza joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 14900 PHP from PMPC. 

Riza is requesting a new loan of 3000 PHP with which she will purchase more coconut fruit to sell as part of her business. This loan will be the sixth loan taken out by Riza from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About PMPC
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. 

Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase more coconut fruit to sell.

loans.name: Seoung

texts.en: Seoung is married and resides with her children in Takeo Province, Cambodia. Seoung and her husband are farmers who sell fruit.  They earn an income of $1 each per day to help cover the family expenses. The standard of living has been improved since Seoung has had this business. She is requesting a loan of $1200 to purchase a new motorbike for her children to commute to work. This is her first loan from CREDIT, a partner of Kiva.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike for her children to commute to work.

loans.name: Cherina

texts.en: Cherina is married and has five children. She works hard to support her family. She has a general store in the Philippines and earns additional income from farming sugar cane and raising livestock. Cherina is requesting a loan for 29,500 PHP through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell in her general store. Cherina has been sustaining her business activities through her past 10 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to repair and renovate her family home.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Melanie

texts.en:
Melanie, a 23-year-old married mother of one child, works very hard to provide for her family by operating a sari-sari (variety) store in the Philippines, a business she has had for two years. She sells a variety of items such as diapers, canned goods and other miscellaneous items.

Melanie has requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to buy more items to sell in her store, and in the future would like to repair and renovate her family home.

loans.use: to buy items to sell in her store such as diapers, canned goods, etc.

loans.name: Dhankumari

texts.en:
This is 55 year-old Dhankumari.  She is married and has two children ages 34 and 32.  In 2000, she established her vegetable farming business.  Working 7 days a week and 4 hours a day, she supports her family.  She has already received and successfully repaid one loan from Patan BPW and used her most recent loan to buys seeds and fertilizers.  In the future, Dhankumari plans to uplift the economic condition of her family.  She thanks you for your support.   

Over 70% of Nepal's economy is agricultural.  Typically, Nepali households grow crops on small plots of terraced land.  Rice (bhat), lentils (daal), and vegetables (thakari) are the staples of the Nepali diet.  With a Kiva loan, BPW's borrowers are able to purchase greater amounts of seed and fertilizer.  With more seeds and fertilizer, a borrower is able to grow cash crops to be sold in the local market.  Such crops allow households to move beyond subsistence and provide much-needed cash income throughout the year.  

This loan was administered by Kiva's local partner MFI, Patan Business and Professional Women. Patan BPW became Kiva's first field partner in Nepal in 2007.  Patan BPW operates throughout the Kathmandu Valley, offering microcredit and business training programs to low-income women.  In addition to providing economic opportunity to their clients, Patan BPW seeks to empower Nepali women within the home and community.  For more information about Patan BPW, visit our partner page and keep an eye out for new loans and borrower updates: BPW Partner Page     

Join our lending team: BPW Lending Team

loans.use: to buys seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Lin

texts.en: Lin is 27 years old, married, and has children They live in Takeo Province, Cambodia. Lin is employed at the factory, earning an income of $2 per day to help cover the family expenses. The family is also assisted by her husband who is a construction worker, earning an income of $2 per day. The standard of living has been improved since Lin has been working. She is requesting a loan of $300 to purchase a new motorbike for her children to commute to work. This is her second loan from CREDIT, a partner of Kiva.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike.

loans.name: Koam

texts.en:
The mother of three children who are still attending local school and are dependent on her income, Koam, 35, is a fish-paste seller in Siem Reap Province, earning around $3 a day to cover her family's daily expenses. Her husband assists the family by planting a variety of crops on his own farmland for both the rainy and the dry season.

Koam, a hard-working woman who always tries to earn money to feed her children, wants to start a small vegetable-selling business but lacks sufficient capital. She is therefore requesting a loan to buy some vegetables and a new bicycle for picking up her products to sell in and around her community.

loans.use: to buy some vegetables and also a new bicycle to pick up her products to sell.

loans.name: Edilberta

texts.en: Edilberta is married and has seven children. She is 41 years old, has five children still in school, and works very hard at her business, selling fish. Edilberta is applying for a PHP 15,000 loan from NWTF to buy additional coolers for storing her fish. She has been in this line of work for 10 years and is determined to earn enough money to expand her business and send all of her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional coolers for her fish.

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en: Marilyn is married and has nine children. She is 51 years old, has three children who are still in school, and works very hard at a food-vending business in the Philippines. She is applying for a loan for PHP 20,000 from NWTF to buy ingredients to make more food items to sell. Marilyn has been in this business for 20 years and would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en: Lolita is a widow with five children who works very hard to support her family by running a general store and raising livestock. She is borrowing PHP 10,000 from NWTF to buy more items to sell to her customers. She will be her fifth loan from our organization, and she is determined to continue working hard so that she can achieve her dream of expanding her business and securing her family's future.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Nandakumari

texts.en:
This is 41 year-old Nandakumari. She is married and has 4 children, aged 22. 21,13 and 11. In 2002, she established her vegetable farming business.  Working 7 days a week and 4 hours a day, she supports her family. She has already received, and successfully repaid, a loan from Patan BPW and used the funds to buy seeds and fertilizers.

In the future, Dhankumari plans to uplift the economic conditions of her family. She thanks you for your support.   

Over 70% of Nepal's economy is agricultural. Typically, Nepali households grow crops on small plots of terraced land. Rice (bhat), lentils (daal), and vegetables (thakari) are the staples of the Nepali diet. With a Kiva loan, BPW's borrowers are able to purchase greater amounts of seed and fertilizer.  With more seeds and fertilizer, a borrower is able to grow cash crops to be sold in the local market. Such crops allow households to move beyond subsistence and provide much-needed cash income throughout the year.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizers.

loans.name: Juanita

texts.en:
Juanita is 42 years old and married with four children. Two of her children attend school. For the past five years, Juanita has been selling flowers in the Philippines and she has received four previous loans from NWTF to sustain her business. Juanita is currently requesting a 12,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies.

In the future, Juanita would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and farm supplies

loans.name: Nena

texts.en:
Nena is from the village of San Luis, Gingoog City. She is 63 years old. Nena is married and has 4 adult children. To make a living, Nena owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, selling canned goods, junk foods, beverages, shampoo, soap & biscuits in the local community. Nena has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Nena joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Nena has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional inventory & working capital. Nena is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional canned goods, junk foods & beverages. This will be the 2nd loan taken out by Nena from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional canned goods, junk foods & beverages.

location.town: San Luis, Gingoog City, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Ma

texts.en:
Mrs. Ma is married with a school-aged child. She lives in the Siem Reap province. To make a living, Mrs. Ma sells wares such as soft drinks, candy, snacks, and cooking supplies, along the street. To help meet the family’s living expenses, her husband works as a local farmer and earns approximately 3 USD a day. The couple shares the responsibility to provide for the family.

Some of Mrs. Ma’s stall items have been exhausted and she would like to replace them. She is requesting a loan to buy additional inventory and continue selling her wares.

loans.use: to buy additional inventory

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase seeds.

loans.name: Magdalena

texts.en:
Magdalena is from the village of Gampis, Sindangan. She is 58 years old, married and has two children, one of whom is still studying. 

To make a living, Magdalena has a dried fish business. She sells the dried fish herself, in the public market or to a buyer of dried fish. Magdalena has been engaged in her business for 12 years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month. Magdalena joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and her living situation. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from PMPC. Magdalena is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP, with which she will finance her dried fish business. 

This will be the fourth loan taken out by Magdalena from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to improve and expand her business. 
   
About PMPC Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.
