Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to finance her dried fish business.

loans.name: Menardo

texts.en:
Menardo is from the village of Minsapinit, Gingoog City. He is 31 years old. Menardo is married and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Menardo owns & operates a ]specialized retail store, selling cassava in the local community. Menardo has been engaged in his business for over 5 years and earns approximately 7000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Menardo joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and his ability to engage in business activities. Menardo has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional inventory & working capital. Menardo is requesting a new loan of 11000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional sacks of cassava. This will be the 3rd loan taken out by Menardo from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand this business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

loans.name: Aileen

texts.en:
Aileen is from the village of Tinabalan, Gingoog City. She is 29 years old, widowed, and has three children, all of whom attend school. To make a living, Aileen owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from buying and selling canned goods, snack foods, shampoo, soap, and beverages in the local community. Aileen has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month.

In 2010, Aileen joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Aileen has successfully repaid a previous loan of 9,000 PHP from HSPFI, which was used to to purchase additional inventory and acquire working capital. Aileen is requesting a new loan of 14,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional canned goods, candies, and detergents. This loan will be Aileen's fourth loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional canned goods, candies, and detergents.

loans.name: Manju

texts.en:
Manju is 39 years old, married, and has one child.  In 2000, she established  her vegetable farming business.  Working seven days a week and four hours a day, she supports her family.  She has already received and successfully repaid one loan from Patan BPW and used her most recent loan to buy seeds and fertilizers.  In the future, Manju plans to raise the economic conditions of her family.  She thanks you for your support.   

Over 70% of Nepal's economy is agricultural.  Typically, Nepali households grow crops on small plots of terraced land.  Rice (bhat), lentils (daal), and vegetables (thakari) are the staples of the Nepali diet.  With a Kiva loan, BPW's borrowers are able to purchase greater amounts of seed and fertilizer.  With more seeds and fertilizer, a borrower is able to grow cash crops to be sold in the local market.  Such crops allow households to move beyond subsistence and provide much-needed income throughout the year. 

This loan was administered by Kiva's local partner MFI, Patan Business and Professional Women. Patan BPW became Kiva's first field partner in Nepal in 2007.  Patan BPW operates throughout the Kathmandu Valley, offering microcredit and business training programs to low-income women.  In addition to providing economic opportunity to their clients, Patan BPW seeks to empower Nepali women within the home and community.  For more information about Patan BPW, visit our partner page and keep an eye out for new loans and borrower updates: Join our lending team: BPW Lending Team

loans.use: to buys seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Gil

texts.en:
Gil is from the village of Dolipos Alto, Oroquieta City. He is 47 years old, married and has three adult children. To make a living, Gil runs a business specializing in piggery, in the local community.

Gil has been engaged in his business for just this year and earns approximately 2000 PHP a month for these activities. He joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and his ability to engage in business activities. He has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from PMPC. 

Gil is requesting a new loan of 10000 PHP, with which he will purchase materials needed for his piggery business. This will be the second loan taken out by Gil from PMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand his business. 

About PMPC:
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

loans.name: Ganhuyag

texts.en:
Ganhuyag is 41-year-old widower who lives with his only son in a house in Ulaanbaatar, capital city of Mongolia. Ganhuyag was married in 2008 and has a boy who is 2 years old now. Unfortunately, his wife died a few years ago because of the deep sickness. 

After his wife's death Ganhuyag began operating a construction materials trading business in order to feed his boy. He started this business in 2010. Previously, he had worked as an accountant for several years. Therefore his accounting skills helped him to expand and develop his business operation. Now he has many regular customers and is planning to continue his business in the future. He is an honest man who says, "I always seek for new opportunities in my business." He is requesting a 3,500,000 MNT loan to purchase more inventory for his business.

loans.use: to purchase more inventory.

loans.name: Chandradevi

texts.en:
This is 48 year-old Chandradevi. She is married and has 2 children, aged 19 and 15. In 2004, she established her furniture making business. Working 6 days a week and 8 hours a day, she supports her family. Chandradevi has already received and successfully repaid a loan from Patan BPW and used the funds to buy pieces of wood and lumber for her business.  

In the future, Chandradevi plans to uplift the economic conditions of her family. She thanks you for your support.    

In Nepal, furniture is still made the old-fashioned way. Using little more than basic hand tools, skilled artisans form raw lumber into beautifully finished pieces of furniture. With precision and an eye for detail, furniture makers produce shelves, bed frames, and cabinet sets. With the help of a Kiva loan, a furniture maker is able to increase the volume of their lumber purchases or hire additional labor. This additional leverage allows an entrepreneur to increase productivity and profitability.

loans.use: to buy wood and timber.

Elsie's husband is providing motorela or habal-habal services. Elsie has been engaged in her business for over 16 years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month through these activities.

In 1995, Elsie joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Elsie has successfully repaid a previous loan of 14,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory and serve as working capital. Elsie is requesting a new loan of 16,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional canned goods, bananas, and snack foods. This loan will be the fifteenth loan taken out by Elsie from HSPFI. Mr. Mour’s old house often needs repair and the floors are worn down and broken. He does not have enough money to buy new floors to replace the broken sections. Therefore, Mr. Mour is requesting loan from Kiva.

loans.name: Ankeldevi

texts.en: This is 60-year-old Ankeldevi. She is married and has two children aged 38 and 30. In 1999, she established her poultry farming business. Working seven days a week and four hours a day, she supports her family. She has already received and successfully repaid four loans from Patan BPW and used her most recent loan to buy small chickens. In the future, Ankeldevi plans to uplift the economic condition of her family. She thanks you for your support. In the Kathmandu Valley, raising poultry for eggs and meat is a very profitable business. Kiva loans are used to purchase chicks, food, and necessary medicine to keep the chickens healthy. Once matured, the chickens are sold at small butcher shops or in the many open air markets throughout the valley. This loan was administered by Kiva's local partner MFI, Patan Business and Professional Women. Patan BPW became Kiva's first field partner in Nepal in 2007. Patan BPW operates throughout the Kathmandu Valley, offering microcredit and business training programs to low-income women. To reduce this expense, Mrs. Va is requesting a loan through Kiva to buy a new motorbike. She plans to use the motorbike for traveling and also to start a motor taxi service to make extra income.

loans.name: Hoa

texts.en: Mr. Hoa is a 32-year-old married man who is blessed with four children who are teenagers. He lives in Kompong Chhnang province. Mr. Hoa currently works as a domestic construction foreman who is able to hire employees to help provide his services. His wife is a rice farmer who sells a few produce items in a small store in front of her home. Mr. Hoa’s business has been very busy recently because there are many clients who need his services to build houses. However, he lacks construction materials. That is why Mr. Hoa has requested a loan to provide the capital to buy construction materials.

loans.use: to buy construction materials

loans.name: Sardaran's Group

texts.en:
Sardaran is a housewife as well as a working woman. She works in a factory for a low income. She also does her household responsibilities very well. She has given birth to a son who is a rickshaw driver. He drives a rented rickshaw and provides transport services to passengers. Her husband works in a private company for a reasonable income.
  
Sardaran has applied for a loan from Kiva's partner, Asasah, for her son who wants to buy a rickshaw which will help him provide better transport services to his customers without any time restriction. He will be able to keep the whole earnings from his work without giving to the rickshaw owner. He has been attached to this profession for the past four years, and Sardaran is confident that a new rickshaw will help him improve his profits. 

In the photo, the lady with a book (an Asasah passbook) is Sardaran.

loans.use: to buy a rickshaw for a transportation business.

loans.name: Saing

texts.en:
Saing, 55, is the mother of one and has been living in Dongkor district of Phnom Penh City. Saing is a local farmer who has been planting a variety of crops for years. She also relies on income from her son’s work in a private organization. 

Presently, her property's walls are getting old and broken down, and it is not safe for her and her family. As her savings account does not have enough in it by itself, Mrs. Saing has decided to add some borrowed funds from Kiva to pay for rebuilding the walls.

loans.use: to rebuild her property's walls

loans.name: Tahira's Group

texts.en:

He makes contracts with different shoe-selling companies and provides the finished goods to them on order. Tahira herself is a very caring lady. She manages her household activities by staying at home.  

Tahira has applied for a loan from Kiva's partner, Asasah, for her husband’s business. With this loan, he will buy raw materials such as leather, shoe laces, nails and glue for making shoes in larger quantity and fulfilling his orders. He has been operating this business for the past six years, and Tahira is hopeful that an investment will be productive for his business and earn him better profits. 

Tahira is a new loan user of Asasah and this is her first loan application. She is confident about her family’s better financial future.

texts.en:
Remilyn is from the village of Malagana, Claveria, Misamis Oriental. She is 31 years old. Remilyn is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Remilyn owns & operates a specialized retail store, selling clothing, beauty items & shoe products from NATASHA, AVON & BOARDWALK in the local community. Remilyn has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 7500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Remilyn joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Remilyn has successfully repaid a previous loan of 14000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional inventory & working capital. Remilyn is requesting a new loan of 15000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional stocks like clothing, beauty supplies & shoes. This will be the 5th loan taken out by Remilyn from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock like clothing, beauty items & shoes.

loans.name: Chuon

texts.en: Chuon, 58, is a village woman living in Kompong Cham Province. Since the beginning of 1980, Chuon has owned a small farm where she and her husband plant potatoes and rice, making $4 profit a day to meet the family’s daily expenses. This couple has four children, two of whom are married and the other two are single. With this loan, Chuon will plant more potatoes which will enable the family to make extra profit to meet their daily expenses.

loans.use: to plant potatoes.

loans.name: Tessie

texts.en:
Tessie is from the village of Malagana, Claveria, Misamis Oriental. She is 51 years old. Tessie is married and has 7 grown children. To make a living, Tessie owns & operates a specialized retail store, selling clothing, beauty supplies & shoe products in the local community. Tessie has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 6000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Tessie joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Tessie has successfully repaid a previous loan of 6000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional inventory & working capital. Tessie is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional blouses & t-shirts. This will be the 4th loan taken out by Tessie from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional blouses & t-shirts.

loans.name: Rullo

texts.en:
Rullo is from the village of Lapasan, Cagayan de Oro City. He is 37 years old. Rullo is married and has 1 young child. To make a living, Rullo owns & operates a specialized retail store, selling dried fish like pinikas, bolinao & sap-sap in the local community. Rullo has been engaged in his business for over 10 years and earns approximately 15000 PHP a month for these activities. In the picture is Rullo & his daughter.

In 2008, Rullo joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and his ability to engage in business activities. Rullo has successfully repaid a previous loan of 17000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional inventory & working capital. Rullo is requesting a new loan of 20000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory of different kinds of dried fish. This will be the 6th loan taken out by Rullo from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand his business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory of different kinds of dried fish.

location.town: Lapasan, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Lorilane

texts.en:
Lorilane is a hardworking entrepreneur living in the Philippines. She is 36 years old and married. Lorilane has three school-aged children.

Lorilane has been in the business of selling cosmetics for six years. Each month, Lorilane earns PHP 5,000. She is asking for a loan of PHP 7,000. She plans to use this loan to buy lipstick and make-up to sell.

In the future, Lorilane would like to improve her business to support the needs of her family.

loans.use: to buy lipstick and make-up to sell

loans.name: Aida's Group

texts.en:
Aida is the leader of this group. She resides in Balykchi, a small town in the Isykul region. She is 33 and married to a musician. Together with her husband, she brings up two daughters and a son. All three children are preschool age (under seven). 

In order to meet the family needs, Aida’s husband provides musical services at various celebrations and events. Aida helps her husband with that activity. In this way the family earns 15 000 soms per month. Aida applied for the loan because they need additional financial funds to purchase musical equipment in order to improve the quality of the provided musical services. In the future she wants to provide her children with a good education.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 

MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). 

MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase musical equipment.

loans.name: Keo

texts.en: Mrs. Keo, 50, stays at home to manage her household. She uses most of her time doing housework such as cooking, cleaning house, caring for her children and managing other properties. Most of the family's income comes from her husband, a machine repairer, who earns an average of $2 a day to cover the whole family. They have four children, three of them students. The fourth is already married and sells mobile phones in a rented shop. Mrs. Keo will use her loan to help her son to buy more mobile phones for sale and also rent a new shop.

loans.use: to buy more mobile phones to sell and also rent to a new shop for her son.

loans.name: Manzooran's Group

texts.en:
Manzooran operates a milk-selling business at her home. She keeps a buffalo for this purpose. She gets up early in the morning, milks her buffalo and sells to her community clients. Her husband is a clerk in a government organization. Manzooran has given birth to three children. Her eldest son operates a catering business while the other two are studying in a local school. 

Manzooran has applied for a loan from Kiva's partner, Asasah, for the expansion of her son’s catering business. With the loan, he will buy catering items like tables, table covers, crockery, etc., to be able to fulfill his customers' needs and make more profit. He started doing this business some time ago, and Manzooran is hopeful that an investment will help him improve his business. 

Manzooran is a regular user of Asasah and this is her third loan application. In previous years, she has maintained good credit behavior and never missed any meeting. In the photo, the lady with a book (an Asasah passbook) is Manzooran.

loans.use: to buy catering items for a catering business.

loans.name: Rizza

texts.en:
Rizza is from the village of Upper Carmen, Cagayan de Oro City. She is 33 years old. Rizza is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Rizza owns & operates a specialized retail store, selling fruits like mangoes, watermelon & bananas in the local community. Rizza has been engaged in her business for over 12 years and earns approximately 12000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Rizza joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Rizza has successfully repaid a previous loan of 11000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional inventory & working capital. Rizza is requesting a new loan of 14000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional stocks of fruits. This will be the 4th loan taken out by Rizza from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory of fruit.

location.town: Upper Carmen, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Tseinpil

texts.en:
Tseinpil is 52-year-old widow who lives with her three children in a ger, a Mongolian yurt, in Uvurhangai province, Mongolia. Her younger daughter goes to a local secondary school. 

Tseinpil manages a used clothes trading business in her town. She started her business in 2010. Previously, she conducted a clothes trading business for several years and gained much experience. Now she sells all kinds of used clothing for all ages. She buys her inventory twice in a month from Ulaanbaatar, capital city of Mongolia. She is a responsible woman who wants to have her own clothing manufacturing business in the future. She is requesting a 1,400,000 MNT loan to purchase goods for her business.

loans.use: To purchase used clothing.

loans.name: Oyunchimeg

texts.en:
Oyunchimeg is 22 years old and lives with her husband and son in a ger, a Mongolian yurt, in her parent's backyard. They live in Uvurhangai province, Mongolia. Her husband works in a paper producing factory. She manages a hair salon at a rented booth at a trading center. 

Oyunchimeg started her business after graduating from school with Diploma of Hairdressing in 2008. In 2009, she changed her working place in order to increase her customers. Now she has many regular customers and is planning to continue her business. She is a polite woman who attributes her business success to her good communication skills. She is requesting a 500,000 MNT loan to purchase equipment for her business.

loans.use: To purchase salon equipment.

loans.name: Jessica

texts.en:
Jessica is a hardworking entrepreneur living in the Philippines. She is 39 years old and married. Jessica has four school-aged children.

Jessica has been in the business of selling cosmetics for six years. Each month, Jessica earns PHP 3,000. She is requesting a loan of PHP 10,000. She plans to use this loan to purchase lipstick and make-up to sell.

In the future, Jessica would like to improve her business to support the needs of her family.

loans.use: to purchase lipstick and make-up to sell

loans.name: Tuvshintugs

texts.en:
Tuvshintugs is 30 years old and lives with his wife and three children in a house in Uvs province of Mongolia. His older daughter goes to a local secondary school while younger two are in kindergarten. He manages an eyewear trading business with the help of his wife in their town. 

Tuvshintugs started his business at a rented stall at a local market in 2008. Now they sell variety of eyewear for all ages. In addition he works as a welder in order to supplement his earnings. The eyewear business is the only source of income for their family. So they work hard to expand their business. Now their working capital exceeds 3,000,000 MNT. Tuvshintugs is a hardworking man who says, "One has to be healthy to live happy." He is requesting a 1,500,000 MNT loan to purchase more goods for his business.

loans.use: To purchase more eyewear goods.

loans.name: Jean

texts.en:
Jean is from the village of Tipolo, Plaridel, Misamis Occidental. She is 25 years old. Jean is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Jean owns & operates a business raising livestock, primarily pigs, for sale. Jean has been engaged in her business for over a year and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2005, Jean joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Jean has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase baby livestock to raise & sell in future. Jean is requesting a new loan of 9000 PHP which will be used to purchase livestock feed & other supplies. This will be the 11th loan taken out by Jean from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase livestock feed & other supplies.

loans.name: Suong

texts.en: Mrs. Suong is a 36-year-old married woman and mother of two who lives in Kompong Chhnang province. Mrs. Suong has always earned a living by planting crops on her own farmland next to her house. Her husband also supports her in the rice-planting business. Mrs. Suong is seeking a loan to buy two cows for her farm. The cows can be rented out to farmers for additional income and also be used for breeding so she can raise the offspring.

loans.use: to buy two cows for using in farming business.

loans.name: Kalyibubu's Group

texts.en:
Kalyibubu is the leader of this group. She is 60 years old and married to a security guard. Together with her husband, she has raised six daughters and three sons. All the children are married and support their parents financially. 

Kalyibubu is engaged in cultivating agricultural products. This year she plans to grow wheat and potatoes, but she needs additional money in order to purchase fuel for field works. For this purpose, Kalyibubu applied for the loan. In the future she hopes to obtain a good harvest and gain a good profit from selling wheat and potatoes.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 

MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). 

MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase fuel.

loans.name: Tserenbat

texts.en:
Tserenbat is 33 years old and lives with his wife in a ger, a Mongolian yurt, in Uvurhangai province of Mongolia. He manages a milk trading business with the help of his wife in their town. 

They own cow farming, a business which started in 2010 after having 5 cows in their possession. They have been herding husbandry animals since their childhood, therefore, they have much experience in this business field. Now they sell 20 liters of milk every day and earn enough money to buy all the necessities. Tserenbat is a kind man who says, "I am planning to save some money in order to buy a much better breed of cow." He is requesting a 1,400,000 MNT loan to purchase construction materials to build a house for his farming business.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials.

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
Emma is from the village of Highway Lawis, Plaridel. She is 39 years old. Emma is married and has 6 school-aged children. To make a living, Emma owns & operates a clothing business, providing new clothing services to local community members. Emma has been engaged in her business for over 7 years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Emma joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Emma has successfully repaid a previous loan of 15,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional inventory & working capital. Emma is requesting a new loan of 15000 PHP which will purchase more cloth and dressingmaking supplies for the expanding of her clothes and dressmaking business. This will be the 15th loan taken out by Emma from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase more cloth and dressingmaking supplies for the expanding of her clothes and dressmaking business.

loans.name: Raylyn Bation Group

texts.en:
Raylyn is from Cogon, Ozamis City. She is 25 years old, married and has one school-aged child. She is the group leader of a three-member group loan offered by PMPC. While each member receives an individual loan, they are all responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Raylyn’s Group. 

Raylyn owns and operates a sari-sari (retail) store, selling a variety of products to local community members. This is a new business for Raylyn, and it earns approximately 1,500 PHP a month.

In April 2011, Raylyn joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 4,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase more products such as shampoo, soap, dried goods and canned goods, etc. This will be her 1st loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About PMPC:
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase more products such as shampoo, soap, dried goods and canned goods, etc.

loans.name: Nurgul's Group

texts.en:
Nurgul, the leader of this group, is 24 and married to a construction worker. Together they are raising a daughter and a son; both children are preschool age. The family resides in Tashkomur, a small mining town in the south of Kyrgyzstan.  Four years ago, with an initial investment of 4000 soms, Nurgul started to breed livestock animals. Reselling them at a higher price after fattening, Nurgul earns about 5000 soms per month. With the profits from this loan she wants to purchase more livestock for breeding. In the future Nurgul wishes to purchase a new house for the family.


--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan.  MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (remaining environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase livestock.

loans.name: Chhun

texts.en: Mrs. Chhun is a 30-year-old farmer in the rural area of Prey Chor district. She plants an annual rice crop with the help of her husband. Mrs. Chhun is looking for a $1200 loan to buy a plot of  land in order to enlarge her rice-crop planting. She has four children, two attend school and the other two are at home.

loans.use: to buy a plot of farmland.

loans.name: Ferdinand

texts.en:
Ferdinand is a 38 year old man who runs a furniture business. He is married with two children: Kristo, who is 12 years old and in the 1st year of junior high school, and Sandy, who is 9 years old and in the 4th grade of elementary school. He has been running his business for almost eleven years, and he uses it to generate income in order to meet his family’s needs and pay for his children’s educational costs. 

Ferdinand operates his business in front of his own house.  He really enjoys his work and intends to improve the business. He has been in TLM’s group lending program for 5 cycles and has a good repayment record.  He needs more capital, and so is now moving to TLM’s individual lending program and requesting a loan of IDR 10,000,000. He plans to spend the loan on cutting equipment, a fret saw and some beams of wood in order to enhance the continuity of his business as well as to increase his income. He is hoping TLM will approve his loan application.

loans.use: to purchase cutting equipment, a fret saw and some beams of wood.

loans.name: Bolormaa

texts.en: Bolormaa is 47 years old and lives with her husband and son in a ger (Mongolian yurt) in the Uvurhangai province of Mongolia. She manages a welding business in her town with the help of her husband. She started her business in 2003 and has gained much experience. Her husband is responsible for making iron products, such as ovens and chimneys, and Bolormaa is responsible for selling them. They purchase their product materials twice a month from Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Now she has many regular customers and has built good communication with her partners. Besides her business she works as a wood product salesperson in order to supplement her income. She is a polite and kind woman who says, "I want my son to be educated and be a better person who can contribute his share to the development of the nation." She is requesting a 1,100,000 MNT loan to purchase iron for her business.

loans.use: to purchase iron for her business

loans.name: Surriya's Group

texts.en:
Surriya has applied for a loan from Kiva's partner, Asasah, to buy a rickshaw for her son. Her husband sells ice blocks. He operates his business in the community. His business goes well in the summer season. Surriya has seven children: four of them are studying while three are working driving rickshaws. 

With this loan, Surriya's son will buy a rickshaw which will help him provide better transport services to passengers and earn more profit. Currently, he is using his brother’s rickshaw which is disturbing the work schedule for both of them. Surriya is confident that her son will be able to improve his income and her family will be better off financially as a result.

loans.use: to buy a rickshaw for a transportation business.

loans.name: Damira's Group

texts.en:
Damira, 36, is the leader of this group. Together with her husband she is raising three daughters, all of whom study at school. In order to meet their needs, the family breeds cattle. They make additional money by selling dairy products. In this way Damira earns 5,500 soms per month. With the profits from her loan she wants to purchase a calf for breeding; a part of the loan will also be used to pay for her daughter’s graduation party. In the near future Damira plans to start repairing her house.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan.  MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (remaining environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase a calf and pay for her daughter's graduation party.

loans.name: Ly

texts.en: The photograph shows Mrs. Ly standing inside her house. She makes her daily revenue by working as a local farmer in the village. She is a widow and now lives with her only kid in the province of Kompong Cham. Mrs. Ly owns a medium-size farm where she plants banana and mango trees. Mrs. Ly is looking for a loan to purchase pig food and piglets to breed. She will use the rest of the loan fund to plant corn.

loans.use: to purchase pig food and piglets

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more inventory

loans.name: Jambalsuren

texts.en: Jambalsuren is a 44-year-old widower who lives with his two children in a ger, a Mongolian yurt, in Uvs province of Mongolia. His older daughter is a student while the younger one is in secondary school. He manages a taxi service business in his town. He started his business in 2007. In his province public transportation hasn't been developed much. Therefore his business is quite successful which gives him much profit. With his business earnings he pays his daughter's tuition fee and feeds his family. He also conducts a meat and meat product trading business in addition to his taxi service business. He is a friendly man who is planning to continue his business in the future. He says, "I am working hard to better my life and to pay tuition fees of my children." He is requesting a 2,000,000 MNT loan to purchase a new car.

loans.use: To purchase a new car

loans.name: Renante

texts.en:
Renante is from Oro Vista Village, Cagayan de Oro City. He is 34 years old, married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Renante owns and operates a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from buying and selling yellow bananas, papaya, mangoes and Chinese melon in the local community. Renante has been engaged in his business for over 14 years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2010, Renante joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and his ability to engage in business activities. He has successfully repaid a previous loan of 12,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional inventory and provide working capital. Renante is requesting a new loan of 14,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional stocks of fruits like watermelons and bananas. This will be the fourth loan that Renante has taken out from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve/expand his business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks of fruits like watermelons and bananas

location.town: Oro Vista Village, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Orienta

loans.name: Kuluiza's Group

texts.en:
Kuluiza is the leader of this group. She is 50 and married to a farmer. Together they have raised a son and four daughters. The son is married; the first daughter studies at university, she is married too; the second daughter works in Russia and the others are at school. In order to earn money the family breeds cattle and cultivates agricultural products. Kuluiza sells 9-10 liters of milk every day. This activity brings her an additional 3000 soms per month. The family applied for the loan because they need money to purchase 200 kg of potato seeds. In the future Kuluiza hopes to get a good harvest; she also wants to see all her daughters get married.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused microfinance institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only microfinance institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase potato seeds

loans.name: Lhagvasuren

texts.en: Lhagvasuren is 51 years old and lives with her husband and three children in a house in Uvurhangai province, Mongolia. Her younger two daughters are students and her husband is a retired man who stays home all day. She manages a meat trading business at a rented stall at a local market. She started her business in 1999 and has been able to stabilize her business. Now she has many regular customers and is planning to continue her business in the future. She is a polite woman who possesses good communication skills. She says, "All I want is to have a nice apartment and to expand my business in order to pay tuition fees of my children." She is requesting a 3,000,000 MNT loan to purchase more meat for her business.

loans.use: To purchase more meat

loans.name: Sath

texts.en: Mr. Sath, 41 years old, is a humble villager living in the Baray district of Kompong Tom. He is married and blessed with five children. Four of the children are single and still study and the other one is married and lives in his own house.  To earn a living, he provides a motorbike taxi services. Mr. Sath’s wife sells many kinds of Khmer cakes in the mobile place. Recently, his existing motorbike has broken down often during use. Because of that, Mr. Sath has decided to seek a loan of $600 from Kiva, which he will use to replace the broken motorcycle.

loans.use: to buy a new motorbike (Tuk Tuk).

loans.name: Felicidad

texts.en:
Felicidad, from the village of Upper Carmen, Cagayan de Oro City, is 42 years old, married and has four grown children. To make a living, Felicidad owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop selling canned goods, snack foods, beverages, shampoo, soap and biscuits in the local community. Engaged in her business for over 10 years, she earns approximately 12000 PHP a month.

In 2008, Felicidad joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Having repaid her previous loan of 14000 PHP from HSPFI that was used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital, she is requesting her fifth loan for 17000 PHP to purchase additional canned goods, snack foods and beverages. Felicidad plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her store.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional canned goods, snack foods & beverages.

location.town: Upper Carmen, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a used motorbike to ride to her job location.

loans.name: Charity

texts.en:
Charity, from the village of Mambuaya, Cagayan de Oro City, is 42 years old, married, and has six grown children. To make a living, Charity owns and operates a specialized retail store selling ready-to-wear clothing, blankets, bed sheets and pillow cases in the local community. Engaged in her business for over five years, she earns approximately 7000 PHP a month.

In 2003, Charity joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Having repaid her previous loan of 15000 PHP from HSPFI that was used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital, she is requesting her 12th loan of 10000 PHP to purchase additional bed sheets, blankets and ready-to-wear clothes. Charity plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her store.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional bed sheets, blankets and ready-to-wear clothing.

location.town: Mambuaya, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Hotam

texts.ru: Хотам житель района Хамадони. Ему 60 лет. Он женат, имеет 7 детей. Две его сыновей находятся на заработках в России. Сам он зарабатывает путем разведения крупнорогатого скота. Разводит скот у себя дома. Он разводит скот в дальнейшем для продажи. Этим видом деятельности занимается 28 лет. Кредит берет для закупа крупнорогатого скота, чтобы увеличить их количество.
texts.en: Hotam lives in the Hamadoni district.  He is 60 years old, married and has seven children.  Two of his sons currently work in Russia.  Hotam earns his living by breeding cattle at his home.  He breeds and raises livestock for subsequent sale and has been involved in this business for 28 years.  Hotam is requesting this loan for the purchase of cattle, in order to increase livestock quantity.

loans.use: to purchase cattle

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah, from the village of Guinitan, Pagalungan, Cagayan de Oro City, is 43 years old and single. To make a living, Sarah owns and operates a specialized retail store selling used clothing or ukay-ukay and shoe products from NATASHA & AVON in the local community. Engaged in her business for over five years, she earns approximately 10000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Sarah joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Having repaid her previous loan of 11000 PHP from HSPFI that was used to purchase more inventory and as working capital, she is requesting her fourth loan for 14000 PHP to purchase additional stocks of used clothing or ukay-ukay. Sarah plans to use the extra revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her store.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks of used clothing or ukay-ukay

location.town: Guinitan, Pagalungan, Cagayan de Oro City

loans.name: Abdunazar

texts.ru: Абдуназар проживает в районе Шахринав. Возраст, 43 года. Женат. Имеет 5 детей. Жена, домохозяйка. Сам он предоставляет услугу. В основном он занимается перевозками на своем грузовом автомобиле. Этим видом деятельности занимается 15 лет. Кредит берет для ремонта грузового автомобиля.
texts.en: Abdunazar lives in the Shahrinav district.  He is 43 years old, married and has five children.  His wife is a homemaker.  Abdunazar provides a service.  He is primarily involved in transportation, using his heavy-duty truck.  He has been in this business for 15 years.  He is requesting this loan to repairs to his truck.

loans.use: to repair his heavy-duty truck

loans.name: Marceline

texts.en:
Marceline is from the village of Upper Carmen, Cagayan de Oro City. She is 30 years old, is single and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Marceline owns and operates a business venture in the food sector making and selling food. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from buying and selling hard boiled duck eggs or balot in the local community. Marceline has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2009, Marceline joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Marceline has successfully repaid a previous loan of 14,000 PHP from HSPFI. This was used to purchase additional inventory and provide working capital. Marceline is requesting a new loan of 17,000 PHP which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed like raw duck eggs. This will be the fifth loan that Marceline has taken out from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients needed like raw duck eggs

To make a living, Cristina owns and operates a business venture in the food sector making and selling food. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from buying and selling chicken and duck eggs in the local community. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve/expand her business.

loans.name: Rosalina

texts.en:
Rosalina is from the village of Bugo, Balite, Cagayan de Oro City. She is 36 years old, married and has one school-aged child. To make a living, Rosalina owns and operates a business venture in the food sector making and selling food. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from making and selling specialty food products like suman, rice cakes and longganisa in the local community. Rosalina has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 8,000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2011, Rosalina joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed like flour, meat and spices. This will be the first loan that Rosalina has taken out from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

loans.name: Kevina

texts.en: Kevina is a single mother of two children aged two months and three years. She has no other dependants and lives with her children in  a rented home in Hoima Uganda. Her family goal is to build a house for her children and for three years she has been running a charcoal business. She started by selling timber but later changed to the charcoal business. She faces a challenge of where to burn the charcoal since the Ministry of Forestry evicts them from the forests and her desire is to buy land and plant trees. Kevina needs the loan to purchase charcoal to sell.

loans.use: To purchase charcoal to sell

loans.name: Rosie

texts.en:
Rosie is from the village of Malinao, Banisilan, South Cotabato. She is 51 years old, is separated from her spouse and has one adult child. To make a living, Rosie owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from buying and selling junk food, bananas, charcoal and coconut wine in the local community. Rosie has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 12,000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2009, Rosie joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 9,000 PHP from HSPFI. This was used to purchase additional inventory and provide working capital. Rosie is requesting a new loan of 11,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional junk food, charcoal and bananas. This will be the seventh loan that Rosie has taken out from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional junk food, charcoal and bananas

loans.name: Pauline

texts.en: Pauline is 35 years old and a single mother of three children aged from 3 to 15. She lives with her children in her own house in Karuguuza, Uganda and her family goal is to educate her children. Being the only breadwinner she has to work in her business where she sells used clothes and she has been doing this for three years. From this business she has been able to buy a cow which she hopes will be a source of income in the next eight months. Pauline intends to use the loan to buy used clothes for sale.

loans.use: To purchase used clothes to sell.

loans.name: Rosemary

texts.en: Rosemary, a 31-year-old mother of four children aged 6-12 years, is married to a teacher and they reside in their own three-roomed house in Karuguuza, Uganda. A hard-working mother whose goal is to educate her children, Rosemary started a small retail shop a year-and-a-half ago. She diligently saved her business proceeds and bought a plot of land. With the dream of upgrading her shop, Rosemary is requesting a loan to purchase soda, sugar and soap for her enterprise.

loans.use: to purchase soda, sugar and soap to sell.

loans.name: Margie

texts.en:
Margie is a hardworking entrepreneur living in the Philippines. She is 36 years old and married. Margie has three school-aged children.

Margie has been in the business of selling cosmetics for six years. Each month, Margie earns PHP 3,000. She is requesting a loan of PHP 5,000. She plans to use this loan to purchase make-up and perfumes.

In the future, Margie would like to improve her business to support the needs of her family.

loans.use: to purchase make-up and perfumes to sell

loans.name: Kabiije Scc Group

texts.en:
Doviko is 45 years old and married to a farmer. They have 13 children. Doviko is a dedicated and hard working person and because of this, his group members of Kabiijje SCC have chosen him as their leader. 

He lives with his family in his own semi-permanent house in Karuguuza, Uganda. 

For six years he has been running a butchery. From his profits in this business, he has been able to rear goats despite the challenge of high inflation rates. Doviko needs a loan to purchase goats and pigs for his butchery.

loans.use: To purchase goats and pigs to butcher.

loans.name: Ludy

texts.en:
Ludy is from the village of Central Poblacion, Kalilangan, Bukidnon. She is 35 years old. Ludy is married and has one infant child. 

To make a living, Ludy owns and operates a salon, providing hairdressing and beauty services to local community members. Ludy has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month.

In 2010, Ludy joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. Ludy has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase needed materials and pay for the utilities. 

Ludy is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase needed materials for the maintenance of the salon service. This will be the third loan taken out by Ludy from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:
HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase materials needed for her beauty salon.

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
Cecilia is from the village of Palomoc, Titay, Zamboanga Sibugay. She is 53 years old. Cecilia is married and has five adult children. 

To make a living, Cecilia owns and operates a home furniture-making business in the local community. Cecilia has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month.

In 2011, Cecilia joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. Cecilia is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase materials for her home furniture-making business. This will be the first loan taken out by Cecilia from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income. 

About PMPC:
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase materials for her home furniture-making business.

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en:
Catherine is 27 years of age and married with three-school-aged children. Catherine is a farmer working in the Philippines who earns PHP 5,000 per month. 

Catherine is asking for a loan of PHP 10,000 to purchase livestock feed and vitamins. Catherine has had a hog-raising business for almost five years.

In the future, Catherine hopes to strengthen her piggery in order to raise more pigs and earn more income to help her husband in financing the schooling of their children and to satisfy their daily basic needs. She is thankful for the financial help of the Kiva lenders and hopes that they will continuously assist her in the business in order for her to achieve her business goals. She dreams of having a grocery store someday and she hopes that her children will finish their studies.

loans.use: to purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Sowali

texts.en: Aged 29 years, Sowali hails from the Kyenjojo District of Uganda where he lives with his six children and their mother in a semi-permanent house. Sowali is requesting a loan to buy a motor vehicle engine for his transport business.  Having acquired his first motor vehicle from maize produce sales, he dreams of owning at least four more cars in the future.

loans.use: to purchase an engine for his motor vehicle.

loans.name: Grace Joy

texts.en:
Grace Joy is from the village of Francfort,  Bumbaran, Lanao del Sur. She is 24 years old. Grace Joy is separated from her spouse and has three small children. To make a living, Grace Joy runs a specialized retail store buying and selling spices, food seasoning, and vegetables like string beans, squash, and tomatoes in the local community. Grace Joy has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month.

In 2011, Grace Joy joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Grace Joy is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional vegetables and food seasoning. This will be Grace Joy's first loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to further improve her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional vegetables and food seasoning

loans.name: Yophesi

texts.en: Yophesi, aged 24, is a government employee and a teacher by profession. He lives in a rented single-room house in the district of Kyenjojo Uganda. After realising that his salary was not sufficient, he decided to venture into the maize trade. Business has been profitable despite challenges in finances. Yophesi needs the loan to buy a maize mill.

loans.use: To purchase a maize mill.

loans.name: Komila

texts.ru: Комила жительница района Хамадони. Возраст, 46 лет. Вдова, имеет 4 детей. Она одна воспитывает детей. У нее высшее незаконченное образование. Она занимается торговлей. У нее имеется магазин в центре района, где она продает спиртные напитки. Этим видом бизнеса занимается 2 года. Кредит берет для увеличения ассортимента товара и аренды нового помещения. Она хочет расширить свою деятельность, и открыть аптеку.
texts.en: Komila lives in the Hamadoni district.  She is 46 years old, a widow and has four children.  She is raising her children on her own.  Komila has not completed her higher education and is involved in retail sales.  She has a store in the center of the district, where she sells alcohol.  She has been involved in this business for two years.  Komila is requesting this loan in order to expand her merchandise selection and lease a new space.  She wants to expand her business and open a pharmacy.

loans.use: to expand mechandise selection and lease a new space.
